campaign.story:
THE INDEPENDENT COMICS TEAM UP OF THE SUMMER IS HERE!
Instructions for Pledges and Add-Ons
Click the image above to buy Kamen America Vol. 1-3 at Iconic Comics!
BLACK HOPS X KAMEN AMERICA unites for the first time, in a single adventure, the independent comics characters created by artist / colorist / letterer Timothy Lim and writer / editor Mark Pellegrini. Technically the 4th volume in the BLACK HOPS: U.S.A.-*-G.I. series, this book connects to the epilogues provided in the campaign editions to both titles and is easy reading for folks who have read either or both works.
As seen in the 3rd volume of BLACK HOPS: U.S.A.-*-G.I. , Misha Lovacova is the pyrokinetic sister of Kanina Lovacova, aka Hare Trigger. She is extradited by the Black Hops team to America, which sets up the events of Kamen America, Volume 2.
Misha's Extradition in Black Hops Volume 3
BLACK HOPS X KAMEN AMERICA brings the Black Hops team together with KAMEN AMERICA as they must pool their resources together to thwart CRYPTIQ before they can resurrect an ancient threat. CRYPTIQ, likewise, has recruited VERMILLION MASQUERADE after the events of KAMEN AMERICA VOLUME 3 to assist them in their nefarious scheme!
Kamen America Animation by Scott Malin
Penelope / USA-*GI Animation by Scott Malin
Art By Jason Ch'ng and JoveJun


GRAPHIC NOVEL, OMNIBUS REPRINT, ADD-ONS
We are happy to be offering not only the main BLACK HOPS X KAMEN AMERICA title but the reprint of BLACK HOPS: OMNIBUS! This version of the Omnibus comes with a different back cover by MAN TSANG as well as 8 extra pages of supplemental art.
218+ Pages of Story
Contains Black Hops: Volume 1, Volume 2 (Hare Trigger), Volume 3 (Hopocalypse Now) 
Thanks to the add-on function, combining your Black Hops X Kamen America items is easier than ever! We offer the base tier of the BLACK HOPS X KAMEN AMERICA graphic novel with the possibility of add-on items at checkout, including the BLACK HOPS OMNIBUS HARDCOVER REPRINT and a Lenticular Poster by Shikarii!
Select your basic perk (any of the ones which ship to America: do NOT choose International Shipping if you are in the United States)
At checkout, you will have the choice of adding BLACK HOPS: OMNIBUS, a lenticular poster, and signatures for your books
If you're looking for KAMEN AMERICA volumes, you can buy them externally at ICONIC COMICS!
Hardcover of BLACK HOPS X KAMEN AMERICA, Art by Kionaoki
Back Cover art by Scott Malin
Hardcover Omnibus Reprint
New Back Cover by Man Tsang
Limited Edition Gold Edged, Double Sided Standee
Limited Edition Gold Edge Standee (Back View)
Gold Edged Standee vs Basic Standee
Lenticular Poster by Shikarii
Limited Edition Kamen America Leather Mask
Modeling Courtesy of Brittney
Courtesy of the Detroit Leather Company
Original Hare Trigger Art by Matthew Weldon
Original Art by Matthew Weldon
IMPORTANT: FULFILLMENT POLICIES and PRACTICES
We are proud of our 100% fulfillment rate and are committed to providing quality customer service and an expedient delivery: all of our books are 100% complete at the time of a campaign launch and the majority of our physical offerings are also in-hand. Every package comes with standard tracking, e-mailed to you the moment the label is printed. To ensure best-practices as far as fulfillment is concerned, we ask that you read this VERY CAREFULLY before ordering.
DIGITAL DOWNLOADS
Digital files are sent out 24 hours after we receive our funding, which is typically 14-17 days after the last day of the campaign. These are e-mailed to the address on file and are valid for 7 days. Any extension of this is subjective.
We will not be mailing out links after 31 days.
No questions asked, no extensions past this point.
To ensure that you receive the necessary e-mails that contain these links, DO NOT block, filter, or unsubscribe ICONIC COMICS, KAMEN AMERICA, WETRANSFER, or ORANGEDOX.
New to this year is a tracking function that we have backstage that allows us to see download activity based on the e-mail addresses that the link is sent to. We reserve the right to terminate any current or future download ability based on unusual spikes in downloads coming from certain e-mail address. We are aware that people like to enjoy books on multiple devices, but it is at our discretion to evaluate individually any cases that seem to suggest piracy or link sharing.
SHIPPING
All physical items come with an automatically generated tracking number e-mailed to you once the label is printed. We will offer replacements for any lost or damaged item. We will NOT offer refunds / replacements for books that we track as "DELIVERED", as it is your word against ours that any form of theft has occurred. Should this happen, please file a complaint with your local UPS / USPS / FEDEX provider.
We are not responsible for missing parcels after 3 months from the day they are sent out: that is when tracking information is no longer available to us, and it becomes the customer's word against our fulfillment that a package was not sent. Please read our fulfillment policies very carefully so that there is no confusion later on.
We also cannot guarantee the sending of products 3 months after the last package is sent out. Part of our on-time delivery is that customers are responsible for filling out their surveys in a timely manner. We cannot hold on to parcels on behalf of extremely late readers: at some point, we liquidate our stock to make room for new books. While we try to accommodate late surveys, we cannot guarantee either the quality of the book sent or that there will be books available at the time the survey is completed. PLEASE FILL OUT YOUR SURVEY ON TIME. MONITOR ALL UPDATES in the month of expected delivery.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have minimized risks over the last 2 years of crowdfunding by being very transparent with our policies and fulfillment procedures on our campaign pages. We have a dedicated fulfillment team that is 100% committed to the speedy delivery of campaign perks. Our books are 100% finished before launching our pre-order campaigns, meaning you won't be waiting several months or years for your orders: we deliver early or on-time, provided that your surveys are filled out expediently upon the campaign closing.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: KAMEN AMERICA Volumes 1-3 on AMAZON KINDLE!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone!
Just another quick update: the full library of KAMEN AMERICA is now on Amazon Kindle! Volume 2 went live this morning and Volume 3 is up for pre-order: it will be available next Wednesday, June 9.

Hello Everyone!
Thank you for making BLACK HOPS X KAMEN AMERICA such a resounding success: we still have a month and change to go, but we have already submitted our files for print and should be on track for an August-September fulfillment! We are also knee-deep in art for KAMEN AMERICA, VOLUME 4 and VOLUME 5, which we can't wait to show you in full this fall! And don't worry, we have more BLACK HOPS coming your way but after the events of BH X KA, there's enough shakeup that we can't tease any art without spoiling a lot of things that happen this summer!

updates.update_userinfo: Deluxe Acrylic Standees Are Here: BCCC Announcement!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone!
A few days ago we received all of our remaining deluxe acrylic standees: these things are HUGE! If you've ever bought any of our previous standees, these are easily about 10% bigger than our last largest one (which was for Kamen America Volume 3). Check out the photos below: the edge is actually a silver / gold hybrid, with more prominent silver on the outer edge but a layer of gold that is sandwiched between the front design and the back design!

updates.update_userinfo: Posters and Standees SOLD OUT: More On the Way!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone!
Thank you to our long-time and new readers for making BLACK HOPS X KAMEN AMERICA our most successful pre-order launch to date! We surpassed our totals for last year's BLACK HOPS VOLUME 3 campaign in less than 9 hours, and we are on track to surpass our totals for ALL Black Hops campaigns by the end of today. We hope that our mutual readership for both Black Hops and Kamen America will enjoy what we have to offer with this crossover!

updates.update_userinfo: FUNDED in Under 1 Minute -- Thank You! Highest Tier Update!
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone!
Wow, thank you so much! We have surpassed our funding goal in under 1 minute and are on track to besting our previous Black Hops 3 / Omnibus total very soon. We cannot thank you enough for your readership, and we always strive to give you entertaining stories presented in the best quality format we can muster.
Please keep in mind that this is a 60 day campaign, so our fulfillment will not commence until July - August, even though we give ourselves till September in case of incidentals that are beyond our control!

campaign.story:
"Barnum & Elwood" is a new comedy adventure series about a Con-Man and a Talkin' Goat who are trying to hit the big time in 1930s America.  The story is a buddy comedy created by the New York-based writing duo Brian VanHooker and Steve Quistagaard, who have been best friends and writing partners for 20 years. Most recently, Brian and Steve filmed a pilot named "The Tramp" starring John O'Hurley (Seinfeld, Family Feud, The National Dog Show) that won a number of awards on the festival circuit. Brian is also a staff writer at MEL Magazine and hosts a Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles podcast named "Turtle Tracks." 
Brian VanHooker (left) and Steve Quistgaard (right) on the set of "The Tramp" starring John O'Hurley (rear) in 2018.
Of everything Brian and Steve have ever worked on though, nothing is as personal to them as "Barnum & Elwood" a story about two pals in pursuit of their dreams.
The story begins in 1930s America, where Barnum — an ill-tempered, alcoholic con-man from New York — has just inherited a farm in rural Virginia from his dead uncle. On the farm he discovers Elwood, a friendly, naïve goat who mysteriously has the ability to talk.  
Page 2 of issue #1
In short order, Barnum decides that Elwood is his ticket to success, so he hits the road with Elwood, exploiting the goat any way he can. Over time, they grow to love each other and become best friends.
Page 5 of issue #1
Originally conceived of as an animated series, Brian & Steve have since decided that "Barnum & Elwood" would be best suited as a comic book, and they hired professional artist Beejay Hawn help make that happen.  Beejay's credits include Jim Lawson's "Dragonfly" and she was the #38 variant cover artist for the #100th issue of IDW's Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles series.  For Barnum & Elwood, Beejay redesigned the characters to look better than ever and she has already completed issue #1. 
Here's where the Kickstarter comes in.
We are asking for $4,000 to print issue #1 and to finish and print issue #2. Most of the money, about $2500, is going to Beejay for her services, as she's drawing, inking and lettering a 20-page comic and doing a variety of covers. Another $1000 is for printing both issues with Comic Well Spring and the remaining money is for shipping, Kickstarter fees and everything else. 
The multi-talented Beejay Hawn, who will be penciling all of issues #1 and #2 as well as inking, lettering and coloring the colors.
Issue #1 — which is already completed — is the story of how Barnum and Elwood meet on the farm. Excited by his new discovery, Barnum drags Elwood to Richmond, Virginia and they get a job as Harry Houdini's opening act. 
Issue #1 with Kickstarter exclusive cover.
Issue #2 — which is written and has completed layouts — is about Barnum's latest get-rich-quick scheme, when he decides to open a celebrity cruise line with Elwood as the main attraction. In the story, the duo tear down the old barn on the farm and fashion it into the "Goat Boat" (a shoddily build ship with a goat head on it).  From there, they set sail down the James River and have a crazy, swashbuckling, high-seas adventure.
Issue #2 with Kickstarter exclusive cover.
The Reward Tiers
The most basic reward tier is for $20, where you'll receive both issues #1 and #2 with their exclusive Kickstarter covers as well as some bonus items, which include "Barnum & Elwood" stickers, a digital copy of issue #1 when the Kickstarter closes and a "Thank you" in the back of both issues.
In the next tier, you pay $40 and get four comics: the Kickstarter covers for issues #1 and #2, as well as the retail cover for each.  This also includes the bonus items.
The $100 tier is where things get exciting. In addition to the Kickstarter versions of the issues #1 and #2 and the bonus items, you'll receive a personal cameo in issue #2. Beejay Hawn is a professional caricature artist, and at this level, she will draw you into issue #2. When Barnum & Elwood set sail on the Goat Boat, YOU will be on that boat!
Then there's the top tier for $250. Here you'll receive four comics — just like the $40 tier, along with the bonus items — but in this level you'll receive a SPEAKING CAMEO in issue #2!
Add-Ons
There will also be some awesome add-ons that you can buy, including an Elwood T-shirt and sketch covers done by Beejay Hawn!
We Need Your Support!
This Kickstarter will be running for the entire month of May, 2021 and we need help seeing this project to fruition! Over the past several years, Brian VanHooker and Steve Quistgaard have poured their hearts and souls into these two characters and they've got big plans for them going forward, including dozens more adventures planned. It all starts right here though, with this Kickstarter and your support, so please, spread the word about this Kickstarter, tell your friends and get yourself some copies of issues #1 and #2. Or, if you're feeling adventurous, set sail upon the Goat Boat yourself with a cameo tier!

Thank you for your time and support. It means the world to Brian, Steve and Beejay to have you believe in us.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Issue #1 is ready to go, it just needs to be printed. Issue #2 has a script and layouts done, all that's left is for artist Beejay Hawn to draw, ink and letter Issue #2. That's a lot of work, but delivering this on time should not be a problem. Our biggest challenge will be funding this project, so please spread the word and invite as many friends to this project as possible!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone!
I just wanted to let you all know that issue #2 of Barnum & Elwood is now going to be 28 pages as opposed to 20. We wanted enough room to tell the story and to fit in all the cameos in a satisfactory way. Since we raised a little extra money, we'll still have enough funds to handle this and still get all of you your pins.

At Midnight on Jun 1 the campaign ended at 118% funded! Thank you all so much for your INCREDIBLE support!

I've sent you all backer surveys, please complete them so that I can get you your rewards (unles you already replied to the email I sent)

Hello Everyone!
Just wanted to let you all know that the Kickstarter ends tomorrow, at 11:59pm on May 31. If there are any add-ons or anything you want to add before the campaign ends, now's the time to do it!

 I'll be reaching out to all of you when it wraps up for info and for pictures for those of you who backed a cameo tier.

updates.update_userinfo: Stretch Goal Reached! You All Get a Pin!
updates.update_content: Last night, the campaign exceeded $4,500, which was our first stretch goal. Now all backers at Tier 1 ($20) and above re getting a free pin with their order!!

updates.update_userinfo: Attention Artists: Be Featured in the Guest Artist Gallery
updates.update_content: In issue #2 of "Barnum & Elwood" we'll be featuring a Guest Artist Gallery, where artists can offer their take on our duo. Here's a couple of examples, including TMNT Artist Chris Vance and artist Lauren D.

Hello everyone! I just wanted to thank you all once again for backing the Kickstarter and getting us funded so quickly! The Kickstarter will continue until May 31, which means people will still be joining the campaign until then.  Since we have the funds to create issues #1 and #2, there are only two things we'd like to do with additional funds raised: first, thank the backers, and then, tell more "Barnum & Elwood" stories. This is why we've developed just two simple Stretch Goals.

Stretch Goal #1: Everyone Gets a Pin

Fully Funded!
Just ten days into the campaign and we've met our goal! I wanted to extend a huge thanks to all of you for your incredible support! Thank you all for believing in us and believing in this project!

What Happens Now?

updates.update_userinfo: We're One Week In and 87% Funded!
updates.update_content:
Yesterday was a HUGE day for us, as we jumped up from 72% funded to 87%! We are getting very close! Thanks to all of you for your support!

We've Got Some Surprises planned for next week, so stay tuned and in the meantime, keep spreading the word about Barnum & Elwood!

updates.update_userinfo: We're Off to a Great Start!
updates.update_content:
Just four days after the launch of the Barnum & Elwood Kickstarter and we're at 64% of our goal, which is truly fantastic! Thank all of you so much for your support of this campaign. I'm especially looking forward to having so many of our supporters drawn into the comic for those of you who opted for one of the cameo tiers!

I also wanted to encourage you to tell your friends about this campaign and post about it on social media. That'll help us get to the finish line so Beejay Hawn can start drawing issue #2 and get both issues to all of you as quickly as possible!

campaign.story:
The Blood N'Bullets project has been 'on the trail' for quite a few years now, and its stage has finally arrived in the form of issue #1 as a 48 page graphic novel, the first in a two part story arc! I started writing screenplays back in 2008 and had some immediate interest from Hollywood producers and one horror project was actually rushed into production!  Blood N'Bullets aka BnB was the third screenplay that I wrote and was the second in the Supernatural Western genre but unlike my previous scripts which has more male dominated roles, I wanted the BnB story to focus on strong and charismatic female characters which were not often seen in so many of the Western stories of the past.  The BnB screenplay has been optioned three times in the past by Hollywood producers, and I hope after this project is published, it will once again be a sought after property!  

Early promotional art for BnB screenplay from 2010
I started with a new original character, "Bloody" Mary Masterson, a gun for hire with a deadly reputation and a quick temper to make her a force to be reckoned with.  Mary is accompanied by her dog Hamlet and she's known to quote Shakespeare to her faithful companion while out on the trail.  Mary is a loner and doesn't much care for towns, but she has come to town to visit her brother Holden who has recently remarried after his first wife died...but therein lies a serious problem....as Holden has married a Native American named Blackbird and neither Mary nor the rest of the town is too keen on Holden taking  Blackbird as his new wife! 
Mary and Blackbird may have to learn to set their differences aside when all Hell Breaks Loose in this sleepy town after mysterious strangers arrive from Europe with a lust for blood and taste for vengeance!   
BnB #1 is the first installment of a two part graphic novel written by me and brought to life by Silvano Beltramo of Italy drawing the interior of the book, and returning Loco Hero colorist Sean Callahan bringing the project into the world of color as well Es Kay in Australia putting words to paper as the Letterer!  This all-star team did a fantastic job under my art direction and has put together a truly stellar graphic novel I'm sure you will enjoy!
"Bloody" Mary Masterson and early comics development.
In 2015 I started working with artists to bring projects like BnB and Loco Hero to life, and like many projects there were pitfalls and artists who didn't work out which caused long delays in art being turned in.  The good news is that in those subsequent years I grew as a writer and publisher, and Kickstarter became THE place for Indie publishers to showcase their creations.  For those not familiar with my previous project Loco Hero which launched April of 2020, we won "Cover of the Year" and were Runner-Up for both Indie Publisher of the Year and Indie Character of the Year for the 2020 Independent Creator Awards which was a great honor.   I also was managing these new self-publishing projects while delivering my own cover art assignments for Lady Death, GI:JOE, TMNT, Vampirella and a slate of Officially Licensed Fine Art prints for The Mandalorian!  Talk about getting no sleep....but no complaints, it's been a great year artistically speaking!!

Thanks to some industry friends Kevin Guillotte and Richard Boom, a great team was brought together to make BnB a feast for the eyes as well as the mind!  The image below showcases some of the killer art and storytelling skills of Silvano Beltramo! 
A beauty to behold even in black and white...
As the pages flooded in from a very inspired Silvano, the colorist from Loco Hero Sean Callahan from here in Colorado, brought these pages to life with his unique and vibrant colors and lastly a new letterer for the project Es Kay from Australia really dropped the hammer and brought the whole project home to the finish line!  By the time this campaign launches, ALL pages will be drawn, colored and lettered and there should be no delays in sending this Graphic Novel with Moore BITE than most to the printer!  As with the previous Loco Hero campaign, we will be offering a variety of covers from the Art Core team who worked on and in the book (myself included) and covers will be available in both trade dress (with logo) and virgin (without logo/text). 
FORMAT: 48 pgs full color!

Standard Edition covers by our ART CORE team including writer/creator/artist Monte Moore


New Campaigns mean some new art from some of the industry hottest and most respected artists as well!  This Campaign features Rock Star Variant covers from Stephen B. Scott, Jason Metcalf and Marat Mychaels and depending on how the campaign does, there may be even Moore mystery covers revealed during the Kickstarter! 
Rock Star Variant Covers from some of the industry's favorite artists!


Below you can see some of the Holofoil cover options to feed those hungry collectors who like some Moore rare bling in their comics collection!

Stunning and highly collectable covers printed in Holofoil are Collector Favorites!

Philanthropy
Much like my previous campaigns, I have chosen to share some of the successes of this campaign with a worthy cause or organization. On our previous campaign for Loco Hero we raised several thousand dollars for Operation Second Chance for our US Veterans in need and since this campaign for BnB is a Western themed project I have chosen the Native American Heritage Association to receive the lion's share of the proceeds from the Giving Moore reward tier where backers will receive a signed version of the "Nature's Kingdom" art shown below, this item can also be over-pledged as an 'add-on' so simply add $20 to your pledge to also receive this fine art print. 
"Nature's Kingdom" print to benefit the Native American Heritage Association.

Rewards
Choose your rewards from the right side of the screen at all support levels!  We have digital versions of the book as well as physical copies of Blood N' Bullets in regular and limited edition holofoil cover varieties, with variant covers from some of the best in the industry. Every backer of a physical tier will also receive a free digital copy of Blood N'Bullets!   Cover art prints are available as well as original art pieces, custom framed prints and Moore!  Since new cover art is sure to be added during the campaign, it isn't necessary to choose which cover you want right now when ordering the Standard (ArtCore) Edition covers, the Rockstar Edition Covers, Cover Art Prints and bundles including those. You will be given the opportunity, during the survey at the end of the campaign, to select exactly which covers you want for your pledge, even if those were not announced at the time of your pledge! If you would like an additional item or items over and above your selected reward tier and already chosen add-ons, you will be able to select those items during the survey period at the end of the campaign as well, or you can 'over-pledge' now to have a buffer in case any new items become available that you miss.
Reward tiers that have limited availability, like the Holofoil editions, custom framed metal prints, one-of-a kind copies, original art, and commissions are NOT available to be add-ons at any point during the campaign, either at the point of pledge, or through the survey. Be sure that if you are wanting one of these that you make that tier your your primary pledge. 
"Dark Spirits" Original Art by Monte Moore
Presenting the Pearl Linen Edition Comics. These comics feature a pearlescent coating and a textured cover. This is a new process that we have never used for any of our books before, and they are truly stunning!  We have chosen 6 different covers to be represented in this style and have limited the offering to a total of 100 comics per each cover. 25 full sets have been reserved for the "Fresh Linens" tier, 25 full sets will be included in the Full House tier level, and the remaining 50 copies of each of this books are available as add-ons in the add-on section. 
Pearl Linen covers for the true collector featuring several M3 covers in this tier!

Pearl Linen Edition Texture Detail
Stretch Goals
We were told on our last campaign that we had some of the Absolute BEST Stretch goal swag that included dog tags, cool art, stickers and Moore so in this campaign our Western themed stretch goals will be no different!  All backers who back a pledge level and receive physically shipped rewards (non-digital) will also receive all of the cool swag below, so the Moore the campaign raises the Moore cool stuff you will get, so please share share and share some Moore when it comes to social media! 
Moore Stretch Goal Items for all backers receiving physically shipping reward tiers (non-digital)




 Would you like to know Moore?  (Starship Troopers reference oh yeah! ) 
Monte Michael Moore - Project Creator
I  have been a professional illustrator and full time artist in the  gaming, comics, pin-up and entertainment industries for nearly 30 years.   Ever since I was 16 I knew I wanted to be an artist, but never in my  wildest dreams did I think I would have the career I have enjoyed thus  far.  I've seen my Art Heroes turn into friends and mentors who are  artistic greats and now who consider me a peer.  After earning a  Bachelor of Fine Arts in Design/Illustration from Colorado State  University, I attended my first Comic-Con International in San Diego  with some friends which self-published our first comic book in 1993.   After that I started freelancing for other indie publishers and getting  my own work marketed to new industries like gaming and attending my  first GenCon.  As an avid gamer since the early 80's and a fan of  comics, I knew I had found the right place for my art.  I've gotten a  reputation as one of the hardest working artists in the industry, always  striving to make my art better, to never miss deadlines, to be  available to fans and collectors and to work with new clients.  My first  art book was published when I was 25, and after Winning the World  Fantasy Art Show in 1998 and 2001 for Best Black and White Art, I knew I  was on the right track.  Although my art was rejected by many clients  early on...I never gave up, it only fueled my determination.  Eventually  every single client and magazine that rejected me...finally accepted  and hired me.  Now my work can be seen on great properties and magazines  such as Star Wars, Harry Potter, Star Trek, Dungeons and Dragons,  Playboy, The U.S. Marine Corps, Coors, Harley-Davidson and many others.   I've enjoyed working for clients on movie posters, role-playing games,  collectable card games (like Magic: The Gathering), video games, novel  covers, and have even become recognized as one of the top custom  painters in the motorcycle industry, one of my own personal passions.   I've also had the opportunity to design over 80 unique fantasy and  gothic themed sculptures which are marketed all over the world. Since  2014 I've been working with the fine folks of Coffin Comics to create a cadre of Lady Death covers that have been wildly supported by their  tremendous fan base.  More recently I've branched into writing for the  film industry, and thus far have written 10 screenplays, sold 5 script  options and had 2 feature films already produced.  Although it is  difficult to become proficient at so many disciplines, I personally find  it more rewarding to be working on so many projects, rather than only  becoming known for one look or style like many artists today.  During an  average work week for me I might paint a 10 foot wall mural, create a  private commission, paint a movie poster or design an R2-D2 folding camp  chair while later building a website or designing a sculpture.  It  takes a lot of time and dedication to create this artwork and promote it  by traveling the world and staying connected on social media. Staying  in communication with my supportive fans is very important to me as they  provide me the opportunity to create the artwork that I love to bring  to life.  Thanks for checking out the Blood N'Bullets campaign, I hope  you are able to help bring this project to life!  

 Sincerely Monte M.  Moore - Artist

updates.update_content: Dear Backers, our fulfillment of moving along nicely and I’m headed Arizona this week to sign books! I have copies of all books in hand so I could check print quality and they look fabulous - now I can also draw the sketch cover commissions and Remarques. We will very likely be shipping ahead of schedule and plan on launching new campaigns for A Loco Hero #1 (rerelease) on Indiegogo and Loco Hero #2 on Kickstarter so I hope you will be able to support the Maverick Arts creator-owned efforts! - Monte

SURVEYS CLOSE AT MIDNIGHT TONIGHT!
CLICK HERE TO COMPLETE YOUR SURVEY
Head's up everybody, we are closing surveys tonight at MIDNIGHT.   Please go to the following link and fill out out your post-campaign  survey so that our fulfillment company can be able to send your rewards.

SURVEYS CLOSE AT MIDNIGHT TONIGHT!
CLICK HERE TO COMPLETE YOUR SURVEY
Head's up everybody, we are closing surveys tonight at MIDNIGHT.   Please go to the following link and fill out out your post-campaign  survey so that our fulfillment company can be able to send your rewards.

Much like the success of this campaign, the fulfillment stage of this project has been on FIRE!! Not only are ALL the stretch goal items received and 'in-house' at Coffin Comics for stretch goal pack assembly, but this friday our print partner confirmed that the BOOKS are also complete and now delivered for Quality Control checking and begin the backend process of fulfillment!  The Coffin Comics Fulfillment Crew will be working on these this week, then this weekend I will head down to Arizona and the following weekend have a signing session to sign ALL the books!  We are planning on signing all books so if you are a rare collector who does not want you books signed and wants them 'raw', please send a message to us indicating you do NOT want your books signed!  For those awesome fans who also supported our LOCO HERO project from last year, I wanted to remind you that Loco Hero #2 is launching in 3 weeks here on Kickstarter so please mark your calendars and join the fun!  Thanks for your support! - Monte and the Maverick Arts Team!

updates.update_userinfo: Books and Stretch Goals Nearly Complete!
updates.update_content: So here we are a mere month past when we wrapped up the Campaign and believe it or not the books are nearly done being printed and should be delivered to our fulfillment experts at Coffin Comic this friday!  We had some delays due to printing on our previous kickstarter (Montage Art Book) so I've really been trying to keep the foot on the gas to make sure that not only is everything done on time but that it's highly likely we will fulfill and ship way ahead of our projected schedule! All the stretch goals have been printed and are being assembled and checked for quality at Coffin HQ, and my plan is to be in AZ at the end of this month on site at Coffin to sign nearly 1500 books so they can be shipped out to our awesome backers!  Thanks for your support, and keep your eyes out for News on Loco Hero #2 coming this July (at least that is the plan) AND an IndieGogo campaign for Loco Hero #1 on IndieGogo to offer some new variant covers and give those who missed out on one of last years hottest debut books/titles!  - thanks Monte

updates.update_userinfo: Please fill out your surveys soon
updates.update_content:
Surveys are closing soon! Please fill them out or we cannot fulfill your reward shipment. Thank you.
Hello backers, thank you for the support on this project. We are currently getting books made, and Coffin Comics (who is doing our fulfillment) is already gearing up to start packing all these great rewards and stretch goal packs!  In order for them to fulfill these orders, we need to have a completed survey from every backer. Please fill out the post-campaign survey that came to you via email if you have not yet done that. If you think you HAVE done that, just double-check, just in case.

updates.update_userinfo: Print Ready Files have been sent to the Printer!
updates.update_content: Well we made record time this week with some massive pre-press efforts, and huge thank you to Marshall Dillon for his expertise and getting the files ready for press!  The first books being printed will be Press Proof copies for us to examine and make sure there aren't any issues, as well as the Sketch Cover "One of a Kind" copies for those backers getting Original Hand Drawn Art, and the Big Irons "Most Wanted" copy with the remarque area so that I can jump on those pieces of art right away!  We will keep you posted on the printing process as we head down the trail!

Dear BnB Backers!  You should have all received your survey from CrowdOx by now via email, please check your spam folder if you have not seen it!  If you have specific questions or have not received it, please email Joshua Andrews the Operations Manager for Maverick Arts Studios and he can take care of any issues. Thank you to all the backers who have completed your survey and added new add-ons to your pledge!  We lost about 10 backers in the pledge collection phase which dropped us under the 45K stretch goal but I was already committed to still honoring the pledge of the Gold Foil trading card of the "Happy Trails" art but with new pledges coming in we are already back over that mark again anyway, so way to go and show your support!  I also wanted to update you all on production/printing progress as right now ALL the files for printing are being formatted by Marshall Dillon as we get everything ready to to head to the printers as all art, coloring, lettering and covers are all in and complete!  About half of the stretch goal reward items have been received at Coffin Comics HQ which is handling our fulfillment/shipping for us, and the other half have been ordered and are 'in-production' as we speak.  That's all for now, please get those reward surveys in if you haven't already filled it out as that is where you confirm your shipping address, select your covers and pledge rewards and make any last minute ADD-ONS you might like!  Thanks again and please message Josh at the studio at JoshWesleyAndrews@gmail.com with any customer service needs.  Thanks!  - Monte   #ExpectMoore!

Everything You Need to Know About the Survey
Thanks for your support backers! We have had a few questions about how to fill out the survey, so we developed this walk-through to help anybody who is having difficulty with this.
The most asked question is about the cover art images.  The images show when you select the cover, and selecting the covers is not final until you have finalized your selection. When you click on the choice, it will show the cover in a thumbnail, when you click the thumbnail, this picture will expand to a much more detailed view. Here is a quick guide to the cover art, in case you don't want to click through them  looking for the cover you wish.

campaign.story:
Here's a quick guide to all of our major updates since this Kickstarter began:
 MAY 7: 103% funded! NEW Final Goal: $6.3M and 2 NEW HOLIDAY SPECIALS!
MAY 7: $5.5M GOAL REACHED! 12 EPS and 12 NEW SHORTS!
 MAY 6: 89% funded. New Reward: Premiere Screening & Afterparty!
 MAY 5: 83% funded. New RiffTrax Rewards! Snowglobe + Mission Patches!
 MAY 4: $4.4M GOAL REACHED! 9 EPS and 2x GIZMOPLEX EVENTS! 
 MAY 4: 79% funded. T-Shirt and Poster Designs. Bonus Challenges 7 & 8!
 MAY 3: 75% funded. All About the Gizmoplex! Bonus Challenge 6!
 MAY 2: 71% funded. 3D movie + glasses unlocked! Bonus Challenge 5!
 APR 30: Joel clarifies remote production plans + new LIVE set visit reward!
 APR 29: Bonus Challenges 3 + 4: 3D Movies, New Rewards & More!
 APR 27: A Week of Livestreams: 5 Movies, 1 Jackbox Game Night & Final Telethon!
 APR 23: $3.3M GOAL REACHED! 6 EPS and GIZMOPLEX APPS! 
 APR 22:  Production Plans, Multiple Hosts and... The Return of Joel Robinson?! 
 APR 21:  Sticker Rewards DOUBLED! Livestream on 4/26.
 APR 20:  More About the GIZMOPLEX APPS! 
 APR 16:  Challenges 1-2 and How to Unlock Bonus Rewards
 APR 13:  More About Reward Levels & Add-On Rewards
 APR 9:  Joel Answers Some FAQs
 APR 8: $2.0M GOAL REACHED! 3 EPS and THE GIZMOPLEX! 
Not sure what's included in each reward level? We've got you covered: here's a chart showing all of the rewards and bonus rewards that come with each pledge package!

 Missed a live event? Rewatch here:
 Livestream 1: HOBGOBLINS w/ the MST3K LIVE TOUR CAST!
 Livestream 2: UNTAMED YOUTHw/ special guest J. ELVIS WEINSTEIN!
 Livestream 3: QUEST OF THE DELTA KNIGHTSw/ special guest MARY JO PEHL!
 Livestream 4: GAMERA vs GUIRON w/ Jonah, Hampton, Nate & Conor! 
 Live Special: JACKBOX SHOWDOWN w/ Team Jonah vs. Team Emily!
 Livestream 5: WEREWOLFw/ special guest BILL CORBETT!
 Livestream 6: ZOMBIE NIGHTMARE w/ surprise guest FRANK DIETZ!
Welcome back, everyone.
Joel Hodgson here. Before we get started, I know it's been a really long, strange, difficult 12 months for a lot of us, so I hope everyone is doing okay and staying safe.
So... where were we?
In the not-too-distant past – about 6 years ago, November 2015 AD – we ran a Kickstarter to BRING BACK MST3K after 15 years in hibernation.
It was a little bit stressful, and a lot of work, but I've gotta tell you... the whole experience went better than we had ever hoped:
Thanks to you, our campaign broke a bunch of Kickstarter records.
Over 48,000 of you took up the cause... and together, we raised over $6 million.
With your help, we got picked up on Netflix and made 20 new episodes!
And you know, you can't ever please everybody, but it seems like most of you were pretty happy with 'em.... and the critics were too: 
Also, having those new episodes on Netflix, along with a lot of our "classic" episodes, helped a lot of folks discover Mystery Science Theater for the first time. So, if you weren't there to help #BringBackMST3K... Welcome! We're glad you're here to help  #MakeMoreMST3K.
Thanks to our Kickstarter, we also built up enough momentum to experiment with taking MST3K in new directions, including three live national tours, where we got to meet thousands of you in person!  Also, during our live tours, it became really clear to me that MST3K works best when you can experience it together, with your family and friends, or your fellow MSTies.
Anyway: as you know, nothing good lasts forever.  Sometime in late 2019, during our third live tour, we got word: even though Netflix liked how our new episodes came out, they wouldn't be renewing us for a third new season.
(Sometimes, business is just business, you know? Was it disappointing not to get renewed? Well, sure. But starting now, we want to focus on looking forward, not back. And when you see what we're planning now, I hope you'll agree that this could end up being the best thing for MST3K in the long run.)
Then, the day after we finished the live tour, the whole world shut down for a year. And you know, as terrible as COVID has been, it did mean that I had plenty of time to think about where Mystery Science Theater can go next.
When I thought about it long enough, I realized three important things:
 1. The world isn't done with MST3K yet.
 We still want to make more episodes of MST3K.
A lot of you still want us to make more MST3K.
2. It's time to try something new.
If enough of you want more MST3K, maybe we don't need anyone to renew us.
From now on, we want you to decide how long MST3K keeps going.
We don't need a network to "let us" make more MST3K. We can make it for you. 
When we do, you should be the first ones to see it.
3. We need a better space for sharing MST3K, and watching it together.
Without a network, we'll need a home for new MST3K, and...
We want it to be easy to enjoy MST3K live with other people, so...
We need our own online theater for live screenings and events! 
I'm glad you asked, friend... because that's what this new Kickstarter is all about.
Thanks to all of you, Mystery Science Theater 3000 has come a long way since our first Kickstarter.  Now, if you decide to get involved again, here's what we can do next:
1. MAKE MORE MST3K episodes with a new, sustainable model, that lets you decide how long we should keep going, and lets us bring new episodes directly to you, without depending on a network to distribute or keep renewing us for new seasons.
2. BUILD THE GIZMOPLEX, our own virtual online theater, where we can host frequent live screenings, premieres, and community events – and you can host MST3K watch parties with friends whenever you want. More on that in a minute. 
Man... you're way ahead of me. 
If you were part of our first Kickstarter, this next part might sound familiar:
 If our new Kickstarter can raise at least $2,000,000, we'll be able to make three more new episodes of Mystery Science Theater 3000...but we'll also have enough to build the Gizmoplex. 
And then – just like last time – the more we raise, the more we can do! Here's what we'll be able to do at each of our goals, all the way up to our final goal of $5.5 million: 
UPDATE (5/8): We hit $6.4M, which means JOEL ROBINSON will return to HOST 2 NEW EPISODES and we'll add a 13TH NEW EPISODE!
Also, you know, we don't want to get ahead of ourselves, but if things go well, we've got a lot of other ideas we'd like to add into the mix. You can find out more about that below, and also in this Backer Update.
Now listen, I hope you're already convinced that the best reason to join our new Kickstarter is because we'll able to #MakeMoreMST3K and #BuildTheGizmoplex.
But since this is Kickstarter, let's talk about REWARDS.
I'm really proud of how most of the rewards from our first Kickstarter campaign turned out, and ever since then, a lot of you told me how much you loved them too. So, this time around, I want to do our best to "raise the bar." You'll have to decide for yourself if we pull it off, but I'll tell you that we've got a few rewards this time that I'm really excited about – especially the Gizmoplex DIY Concession Pack, our new Challenge Coins, and a pretty amazing design for an MST3K Musical Snow Globe! 
UPDATE – Since there are so many rewards to keep track of, and we want to make sure you know what to expect in each pledge level, we've also put together this chart, which has been UPDATED to include the ALL-DIGITAL EXPERIMENT 85! 
So yeah, as you can see, until you get above Experiment 500, most of the rewards "stack", which means you get all of the rewards listed in all of the lower pledge levels,  not just the new rewards listed with each pledge level. And unless it says otherwise, all reward levels above Experiment 500 include everything listed on this chart. I'm telling you, it's a lot of cool stuff. 
UPDATE (MAY 5): Joel has shared some "sneak peek" images of the designs for our new rewards, including TWO T-SHIRT DESIGNS, TWO POSTER DESIGNS, the MUSICAL SNOWGLOBE and the just-released MISSION PATCHES!
 FIRST LOOK: T-SHIRT DESIGNS 
FIRST LOOK: POSTER DESIGNS 
FIRST LOOK: MUSICAL SNOWGLOBE 
You can read more about the Musical Snowglobe in this Backer Update, but you should know that it will have a "wind-up" mechanical element in the base which plays a new rendition of the MST3K Theme Song, composed just for this reward by Paul Sabourin:
FIRST LOOK: NEW MISSION PATCH (ADD-ON) 
Also, one big change since last time is that we're now able to offer "Add-On Rewards" right here on Kickstarter. That means that we don't have to guess exactly what you'll like, or create a million different confusing pledge levels. 
Here are some of the Add-On Rewards available right now:

 SHIPPING NOT INCLUDED!
Also, just in case you missed the notice in the description of each reward level: We're not collecting shipping costs for any rewards until after the Kickstarter ends.
About 2-4 weeks after our Kickstarter campaign ends, you'll get a reward survey to give us all of the details we need, like your t-shirt size, or the name(s) you want us to use for each of the "Special Thanks" rewards. When you give us those details, we'll also collect shipping for any rewards that go in the mail!
REWARD TIMING
While a handful of rewards – like the "MST3K Season 13: Collector's Box Set" on DVD and Blu-Ray – might not be available until as late as June 2022, other rewards – like Weekly Production Updates – will start within just a few weeks of when our Kickstarter campaign ends. So, don't let the "June 2022" delivery date scare you. Kickstarter just asks us to list the latest date when we expect all rewards to be sent out.
Now, I know this is already a lot of information, especially if you already watched our video, and I think I've told you most of the really important stuff.
And, if you still want more information, there's a lot more detail below, so keep reading if you want to know more about...
How the Gizmoplex will work!
How the Gizmoplex can make MST3K better! 
How we set our funding goals!
How we'll spend whatever we raise!
Also, one of the things I like best about Kickstarter is that it's not just a "monologue," but a really great way to have a conversation with all of you who care about the show. So, if there are other things you want to know about, I hope you'll take a look at our FAQ... and if the answer isn't there, I hope you'll ask!
We'll also do our best to read and respond to all of your comments. But just so you know, I'm pretty sure that our first Kickstarter also got more comments than any project that came before it! So, if that happens again, please be patient if it takes us a little while to get to everything. We've got a whole month, and a lot more to tell you!
There's one more thing I need to say before you go, and it's pretty important:
Over the last year, as I was trying to imagine where Mystery Science Theater can go next, I also spent a lot of time thinking about how we got here.
(It's kind of crazy to realize that it's been almost six years since our first Kickstarter, and almost thirty-three years since we first aired on KTMA on Thanksgiving in 1988.)
Anyway, when I look back on everything that's happened, it's really clear that our first Kickstarter was one of the defining moments in Mystery Science history. For our first campaign, we asked you to help us make new episodes, and to prove to "the networks" that there was still an audience for MST3K... and you did!
But together, we've done a lot more than that. Thanks to you, Mystery Science Theater has been able to produce 2 new seasons, 20 new episodes, 6 comic books, 3 live national tours, and 1 record-breaking Kickstarter.
Today, I hope you'll join us again to write MST3K's next chapter: to prove that we can #MakeMoreMST3K without depending on a network to keep us alive, and to #BuildTheGizmoplex, a unique online theater where MST3K can continue to grow.
But – and this is the important part – I also want to be cautious. We're all just crawling out from COVID, and it's been a difficult year. I know that things are more difficult for a lot of people than they were during our first Kickstarter. If you decide to pledge, please: only give what feels comfortable, even if it's just a few bucks. And if you can't afford anything, that's okay too! We'll find other ways for you to stay involved, and to make sure you can still get access to all of our new episodes and Gizmoplex events.
That's all: more than anything, please just take care of yourself... and if you can't help out right now, don't think twice about it. We'll still be here when you're ready.
I guess that's everything, so... we've got 30 days. Let's see how this thing goes.
Cheers & Thanks,
Joel


Hey, you're still here. So, I guess you want more details, huh?
Oh yeah, that's right. Thanks for reminding me.
I think the Gizmoplex might be the biggest "new idea" we're working with this time around, so there are a lot of details and possibilities I'm excited to share with you as we go. Here's what you should know right away.
Having a Gizmoplex All-Access Pass has three important benefits:
1. Live Premieres & Events: The Gizmoplex will host at least TWO LIVE EVENTS EVERY MONTH for our first year, where you can join me, our cast and writers, and some special surprise guests. Each event will be like a night at the theater, and will have a lot of fun surprises. Some of our ideas include theme nights hosted by our cast and special guests, live commentaries, and maybe even live riffing! Also, we won't just screen episodes: it'll be a real show, and could include new sketches, trailers (done "MST3K style"), live Q&A panel discussions, interviews, contests... and the return of the MST3K "viewer mail" segment! (And yes, if you can't make one, you'll be able to see it after.)
2. The MST3K Watch Club: To make it easier to watch MST3K with your friends, the Gizmoplex will also be the official home of the MST3K Watch Club! Each month, you'll get on-demand access to a new selection of episodes, and the ability to host your own live screenings for up to 10 people! Anyone with a Gizmoplex Pass can join for free, and if you want to invite someone who doesn't, they can get a "Day Pass" for just $0.99!
3. Gizmoplex Apps: Since we reached our second goal ($3.3M) we'll be able to develop apps that bring the Gizmoplex to mobile devices and TVs! Right now, the plan is to include apps for six of the most popular platforms: iOS, Android, AppleTV, AndroidTV, FireTV and Roku. And no promises, but we're also looking into apps for XBOX, PlayStation and Samsung TVs. Like Crow says: we're gonna conquer cyberspace, man! (Read more about the apps here.)
So, if you think about it, we think it's a pretty different model than we could pull off anywhere else. I really want the Gizmoplex to feel like something new: less like another Netflix with nothing but MST, and more like a charming, off the radar, suburban cineplex that plays movies for 99 cents, long after their first run.
If we get this right, the Gizmoplex Pass won't just give you a monthly subscription to a catalog of MST3K episodes, or a place to watch the episodes you own on-demand: it'll be more like a "Season Pass" that gives you tickets to every show at your favorite theater: front row, opening night, every time. Take that, Moviepass!
You can read a LOT more about our plans for the Gizmoplex in this Backer Update.
Also, even though this won't make a lot of sense until I give you more details, there's one more thing I want you to understand:
The Gizmoplex won't just be our new online theater and event space. It's also going to be an important new location that The Mads are creating on the show, and inside the world of Mystery Science Theater, as their next step toward world domination: the first cineplex on the moon!
Anyway, I think it'll all make sense when you see it... but until then, remember, “It’s just a show, I should really just relax.”
So, there you have it: in a nutshell, this is what we want to do. After 33 years, it's time for Mystery Science "Theater" to have an actual (virtual) theater that MSTies can call their own. It's time... to #BuildTheGizmoplex.
Any other questions?
Oh, wait. I think I know what you're going to ask. 
Just like last time, I'm sure some of you are wondering, so go ahead and ask. 
I knew that's what you were gonna ask! And since we're asking you to pledge some of your hard-earned money – especially after a difficult year – I want to be really open and transparent about this. So, let's break this down a little bit.
1. Without a network supporting us, we need to fund everything ourselves. During our first Kickstarter, we estimated that, once production was up and running, we'd be able to produce new episodes for about $250K each. In the end, though, the budget for each new episode ended up being closer to $350K. For the last two seasons, we were able to cover the difference through our deal with Netflix... but this time, we're on our own. We've got a lot of ways we can keep the budget lower, but, you know... it's still going to cost something. And when you think about it, $350K for 90 minutes of television is still one of the best deals in show business.
2. We still can't spend everything we raise on Kickstarter to make the show.
Campaign Fees: Between Kickstarter and the credit card processor, we pay about 8% of your pledge in fees. There's also a fee for CrowdOx, the platform we'll use to manage all of your surveys and rewards after the campaign ends.
Making Rewards: We reserve about 20% of your pledge in order to design, produce, print, sort and pack all of your rewards. And that's not even including shipping, which we're not collecting until after our Kickstarter campaign ends!
Dedicated Support: During our first Kickstarter, we underestimated the amount of work involved in providing customer support and creating detailed backer updates, so we had to depend on volunteers to do a lot of it. This time, we want to make sure we're prepared, so we budgeted about 4% of each pledge for that.
Building & Running the Gizmoplex: We really want the Gizmoplex to be great, but getting it started will take some work – and keeping it running also means we'll have some monthly fees to cover. We also need some budget to support all of the special live events we're planning to host. So, we're using about 3% of your pledge for that.
When you put it all together, we have to spend about 35% of what we raise just to cover Kickstarter expenses, and to keep all the promises we're making to you.

3. The more episodes we make, the less each one costs! Like we explained during our first Kickstarter, the basic idea is pretty simple: for some parts of production, we have to spend the same amount up front, no matter how many episodes we're making.
For example, let's say that our writers realize the show needs a custom-built oversized rubber chicken. No matter how many episodes we have, it's going to cost $1000 to make. So, if we only use it in three episodes, we have to spend $333 per episode on a rubber chicken. But, if we use the chicken in twelve episodes, that $1000 goes a lot farther, and our rubber chicken kaiju only costs us $83 for each episode. Make sense?
     Based on those numbers, you can see that the cost for each episode gets lower as the number of episodes goes up:
So yeah, just like our first Kickstarter, I know that a fair number of you won't care about these types of details... but since some of you will, we want to be as clear as possible.
1. KEEP CIRCULATING THE URL. Back in the day, MST3K wasn’t seen nationwide and we encouraged people to record the shows on VHS and send them to their friends and loved ones. It was our version of “I Want My MTV.” Every episode of MST3K ended with a message that encouraged MSTies to “Keep Circulating the Tapes,” and you guys did. Then, in our last Kickstarter, we updated that to "Keep Circulating the URL," and you did that too. Now, we've got a new URL, so we're asking you again:
2. FOLLOW @MST3K ON SOCIAL MEDIA. Be sure you're following our account on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube. Those are one of our best ways to keep everyone up-to-date on what's going on, so encourage your fellow MSTies to follow them too! We really appreciate it, and we couldn’t do it without you. You’re like our virtual street team!
3. CIRCULATE THE MESSAGE FROM EACH UPDATE. From now until our Kickstarter ends on May 7, most of the backer updates that we send will include a suggested message or image. Copy, paste, and post them on your own social accounts to help spread the word. It's as simple as that! 
4. CHECK IN WITH YOUR FELLOW MSTIES.  We don't want you to pressure anyone, but we do hope you'll check in to make sure they know about this Kickstarter.  And when you do, be sure to remind them that pledging even a $1 token pledge will still help us unlock more Challenge Goals, Bonus Rewards, and get them weekly updates all the way through the production of Season 13!
5. JOIN OUR "VIRTUAL STREET TEAM." If you've got a little extra time, and want to make sure we reach our final goal, there are more specific ways to volunteer and help. If you want to get specific "assignments" to help us #MakeMoreMST3K, you can sign up to be part of our elite volunteer team.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As we learned last time, there are always risks with Kickstarter... and the world is a little crazier right now than usual. Here are a few that we've considered:

• After a difficult economic year, this might not be a good time for some people to offer financial support to a robot puppet show dedicated to cheesy movies.

• COVID is a huge unknown, and could still impact all sorts of things, from our production schedule and approach, to our timeframe for producing and delivering your rewards.

• Another ship could block the Suez Canal, trapping your challenge coins and snow globes for weeks, months, or years. But also, what are the odds it'll happen twice in one year?

• Building the Gizmoplex is a big undertaking, and we'll be depending on a few tech partners to make specific parts of the experience possible. So, if one of our partners ran into problems, there's always a risk of that affecting the Gizmoplex.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
If you’re returning to Sasquanaut, THANK YOU! 
If you're new to Savage Sasquanaut, WELCOME! 
Do you enjoy over the top, rocket fueled excitement in your sci-fi adventure stories? 

SAVAGE SASQUANAUT features the legendary Bigfoot who is lost in space!

Join the fun as he carjacks starships, arm wrestles aliens, hoodwinks an empire, and confronts his biggest fears all while bending the cosmos to his will, searching for home.
$6,000 Stretch Goal is unlocked
pronounced "SAS - KWA - NOT"
SAVAGE SASQUANAUT is a fish out of water story about the legendary Bigfoot who was part of a NASA experiment when a freak accident lost him in space!

The series is an action-packed sci-fi adventure with stunning visuals, humor, intrigue, love and betrayal brought to life by award winning colorist and creator WES HARTMAN, illustrator GAB SANTOS, and letterer MCLAIN MCGUIRE.  

And welcoming to the Savage Sasquanaut and Cosmic Roots Studio team, is editor CHUCK PINEAU! Thanks for coming aboard Chuck!
Creative team seen here. (Not actual astronauts)


HERE'S A QUICK "STORY SO FAR" IF YOU'RE NEW

WHAT'S HAPPENING IN ISSUE FIVE?
Sasquanaut and crew come face to face with their pursuers who have hunted them across the galaxy!  Crimson Hombre, Sovi-Yeti, and Lieutenant Camden also come calling to extract their revenge on our titular hero, and Empress Dalia and her military forces crash down all around our heroes on the Big Rock Comet Casino, or as I have nicknamed SPACE VEGAS!  Will the unavoidable conflict Sasquanaut faces spell the doom for himself and everyone around him?

Issue 5 is the penultimate issue of SAVAGE SASQUANAUT volume 1 and begins the two part climactic conclusion of the comic that READING WITH A FLIGHT RING calls a "great new unique idea and it’s executed extremely well."
Are you a fan of STAR TREK, FIREFLY, FARSCAPE, and BUCK ROGERS?  Can you imagine if Jack Burton from BIG TROUBLE IN LITTLE CHINA replaced Luke Skywalker in STAR WARS?

If you can, then you may have an idea of what you're going to get from the SAVAGE SASQUANAUT!
People who love Star Wars, Star Trek, Firefly, and Farscape.
Fans of Conan the Barbarian (especially if you ever wished he went into space).
Fans of Big Trouble in Little China (Bigfoot is Jack Burton!)
Bigfoot enthusiasts.
Fans of action, humor, and stunning artwork!
Collectors of high quality independent comic books from a long time industry veteran and a phenomenal brand new talent.
People who love to read awesome stories about larger than life characters

Keep scrolling down, there's more to see!

FREE SHIPPING IN THE UNITED STATES!
Sorry international, folks! Shipping is expensive and Brexit has made shipping to the UK even more troublesome.  I don't control what shipping costs are, its expensive and slow and the last few campaigns I didn't charge enough.  



WES HARTMAN - is an award winning comic book colorist (BD Price Audience Award 2010 for best color), and a small press comic book creator and editor and creator of the Sasquanaut comic. He has spent the last 15+ years working with the biggest and best talent at Marvel, DC, Dark Horse, Aspen, Dynamite, etc. and has had his work featured in TV, film, and video games.  Some of his previous creations and credits include Moon Streak, Sky Sharks, Gears & Bones, Pirates vs. Ninjas, and more.

GAB SANTOS -  “Gabouwness” is an Illustrator and Character Concept Artist who was born and raised in Manila, Philippines.  Gab usually does character designs, cover illustrations, but sometimes he also does fan art, comics, and even card games.  He really loves to read comics, play classic video games.  He is fond of making robot designs and mechanical/sci-fi/fantasy/apocalyptic themed illustrations because he finds it cool to draw what the world would look like in the future. He says that art is what he loves to do and that is why he works hard to improve, not only for himself, for the people that love and support him every day.

MCLAIN MCGUIRE -  lives in the Austin, Texas area where he can be found in his studio creating, lettering, and designing comics and working on other graphics. McLain is happily married with two amazing kids and two crazy dogs. He is an established musician and has been in the music industry for over twenty seven years as well as working in the comic industry for over thirteen years. McLain takes every opportunity he can to work on Indy and Professional Comics to show his continuous support in the industry as well as give his own creativity. He’s worked on many titles such as Cavewoman, Razors Run, and Metal Edge by Basement Studios/ Amry Dark Entertainment. CCP Comics Super Crazy Animal Hand, The Other, Dead Robot, SYSTiM, Electron Boy, Father Faust, Lady Khimera, Clean up, and more. McLain can also be credited for his lettering and designs in the two hit titles from Short Fuse Studios, The Defectives (On-going series currently on issue 4.) and Morbid Musings. He is also working as an artist, letterer, designer, project manager, and partner with 4 Leaf Comics on titles The Forgotten Isle mini-series, Churchill Manor, Don’t Pay The Ferryman mini-series, and The Mortician. McLain gives his absolute best in everything he works on. When McLain is not in the studio working on comics he’s a stay at home dad seven days a week. McLain is credited in the comic industry as a letterer and designer for Indy and major Publishers for over forty titles streaming.

CHUCK PINEAU -  Chuck Pineau is a writer/editor who has (co)created projects such as Welcome to the Void, Belial and Essence House. He is best known as an editor, having worked on dozens of titles for companies such as Antarctic Press, Markosia, and Scout Comics.
Wes says:
"I've written for, and created several titles, as well as done editing for most of my nearly 20 year comic career. However, I'm often viewed as "just a colorist."

While I'm extremely proud of my coloring role, and the many opportunities I've been granted because of it, there is so much more in me that I am striving to get out.

So with Sasquanaut and my comic imprint Cosmic Roots Studio, I am investing in myself as a creator (with your help) to cut my own path through the jungle and prove to myself and the rest of the world that I am more than "just a colorist."

And with THIS story I feel UNLIMITED.

Sasquanaut needed to be much more flexible in a way that my previous stories were not. Sasquanaut allows me to seamlessly crisscross genres at the turn of a page and never feels out of place. 

As long as the reader can accept that Bigfoot is flying through space, which is no more absurd than Teenage Mutant Ninja Turles, then I can take the story in ANY direction that appeals to me. 

Sasquanaut's  zany adventures in space keeps me, and hopefully YOU dear reader, entertained and always guessing what comes next."

Kickstarter has proven to be an amazing venue for getting new creative ideas that could potentially never be realized without you and the Kickstarter platform.

Crowd funding is an amazing opportunity for YOU the potential fans to directly engage with a creator in a way that has never been provided before.

You have the power to make the products you want come to life.

YOU get to decide that. You decide what products we offer are worth your hard earned money, and that is a privilege that I do not take for granted.

To prove that you can trust me with your hard earned money I can point to the two previous campaigns that were successfully funded and delivered early.

This issue, just like the last four campaigns, is 95% complete before this page has gone live.  You are not paying to produce this comic, it is already done. The only remaining work is to proofread and finalize the lettering.

There is no risk that this book won't come out.

The only potential risks are the lingering effects of the global pandemic we have been facing and that may have on the production schedule.

Because of that, I have tried to plan some extra time into my production and fulfillment schedule to account for any potential backlog or delays at the printer who has been closed or operating in a limited capacity like most other businesses in the country.

There is a very good likelihood that everything will proceed as it regularly would prior to the COVID-19 crisis, and if that is the case fulfillment should be done faster than scheduled.

I pride myself on my communication and professionalism, and your trust in me is not taken lightly.  You can see on my past three campaigns I have made regular updates detailing the status and progress on every step of the campaign.

And I'm taking it even further this time.  Every Monday night, join me on Twitch as I continue to produce and create Sasquanaut right before you eyes one page at a time.  Join the conversation about the creative process and ask any questions on how to make a comic and know without a doubt that your money is being put to work.

Thank you for checking out my project. 
Thank you for showing an interest in something that I have spent years putting together, and thank you most especially if you've pledged on this campaign on any of my previous campaigns.  You are making my dreams come true and I cannot express how much this means.

We are in an amazing new golden age for independent and self published comics, and it is driven by  wonderful people like you who support passion projects, like this one. 

Again thank you.

Volume 1 of Savage Sasquanaut is 6 issues long. The first 4 Issues have so far been met with universal praise, and I've worked relentlessly to create comics of impeccable quality for your enjoyment.

This series is the beginning of what I hope will be so much more, and I cannot wait to share them all with you.  This is happening because of you, thank you.

Also thanks to Dark Fantasy Studio and Humble Bundle for allowing me to purchase the right to use such a dope song. Also thanks to Fiverr.com for hooking up the Cosmic Roots Studio logo animation.

PLEASE review the different REWARD PACKAGES and SELECT the one you like, and complete your pre-order for the best new sci-fi hero you've never heard of.

PLEASE SHARE THIS PROJECT WITH ALL YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
SAVAGE SASQUANAUT #5 (Wes Hartman - My Fifth Kickstarter Campaign) As a Kickstarter supporter myself, I know what it means to give your hard earned money to new and unknown projects. I have made every effort to minimize the risk to you, the backer. This includes having the issue 100% completed before you even see this page. At my own expense I have paid and received ALL the art from Gab Santos for the entire 6 issues of volume 1. When the campaign successfully ends, with your help, the files will be loaded to the printer when the funding comes in, digital rewards can be sent upon receiving completed surveys, and coloring and lettering can continue on all remaining issues. Issues 1 through 4 Kickstarter campaigns and fulfillment went as smoothly as I could possibly hope for, and so far I have received universal praise on the quality and timeliness of the projects. That's not to say I didn't learn a few things that I believe will better assist in completing and shipping all rewards to everyone. I love this book and I want everyone who takes part of this campaign to love this book as much as I and have a completely satisfied experience on Kickstarter with me and Gab. If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to message me and I will do my absolute best to make this project as rewarding as possible. Thank you for your time and your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi!  Production on the books and materials is progressing as planned, if everything continues smoothly I should be getting the printed books in hands next week.

And since the books are coming soon I am aiming to release the digital rewards either late next week or early the following week. 

Most of the surveys have been completed, thank you.  If you haven't taken the time to complete the survey, I encourage you to do so as quick as you can so that there will be no delay in shipping your rewards out.  I am hoping to start putting packages in the mail by the beginning of July, if not sooner.  (My in laws are visiting soon and I hope to have all the boxes out of the way by the time they arrive).

Good morning!  I'll be brief.
I have approved the digital proof from the printer for issue 5 and printing is under way and the issue 5 ARTIST EDITION was turned in to the printer on Monday.  

If you ordered a T-Shirt from me, I want to make clear that your shirt(s) will be arriving separately from your other pledge items.  The vendor that I am ordering shirts from will print and ship them directly to you.  I have not ordered shirts yet, but they may arrive before or after your other rewards.

updates.update_userinfo: Book is at the printer, fill out those surveys
updates.update_content:
I'm EXCITED to say that the issue files went to the printer first thing this morning and I have made the down payment for production to begin.

From here I should expect a digital proof in 1 or 2 business days, and once I approve the digital proof, the printing will be another 10 business days before it is shipped.  Currently the estimate for books in hand is JUNE 23rd.

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys sent! Digital Rewards Important to answer surveys
updates.update_content:
Hey, crew, all of the surveys from BackerKit have been sent out.  Make sure you check your emails and answer those surveys so I can get everything squared away for your rewards.

Digital only backers
It is absolutely essential you answer your surveys too because all of the digital rewards will be coming to you through BackerKit.  All my previous campaigns, I delivered through the message system in Kickstarter, this time it will come form BackerKit so please fill your info in to get them.

Hi, gang!  Wanted to let you know that BackerKit has sent out the "smoke test" surveys to some of you.  That means, about 5% of you backers will have received the rewards survey from BackerKit, please please please fill them out as quickly as possible.  This smoke test will help me make sure that everything is working as it should for you all before I send it out to everyone.  

I'll keep an eye on how many submit their surveys and if everything is going well everyone else should get your survey in the next few days, sooner if the smoke test is filled out fast enough.

Real quick, I'm sharing that I have received the funds from Kickstarter.  HOORAY!

Today, I shared the issue with new editor Chuck Pineau and my usual issue proofreaders for their review and input to get the final polish on the issue.  I expect to be able to send the issue to the printer next week.

Good morning!  Hope everyone has had a fantastic week and I wanted to give a brief update on production so you all know where everything stands.

Funds, I expect. will arrive in the beginning part of next week.  Stickers for stretch goal are currently being printed and I am looking into getting the mini-print postcards started on production either today or early next week.

updates.update_userinfo: Update Payment info, BackerKit, and KILL COUNT 2
updates.update_content:
Good morning!

A very brief update  that a handful of backers are running out of time to update your payment info for Kickstarter.  Odds are your credit card has expired so KS needs your new info TODAY so your rewards are not CANCELLED.
Thank you, backers, for coming out and supporting the latest installment of SAVAGE SASQUANAUT! You did it!

project_data.project_name: SAVAGE SASQUANAUT 1-5: Bigfoot's lost in space and LOVING it

campaign.story:
Hi. My name is Reese Roper. I was, and am currently- the singer for the band Five Iron Frenzy. Maybe you've heard of us? Probably not. That's okay, because this has very little to do with that. Only that you need to know, that in almost 30 years of recoding vocals, guitars, pianos, and other instruments- having countless iterations of home studios, and having recorded in several world-renowned studios myself- what I have realized is that it is extremely expensive to get a really cool, good-sounding, mic. I want that to change. The technology for microphones has not really deviated much in the last 60 years, and yet "high-end" boutique microphones still cost anywhere from $5000 to $15,000! The materials used are really still the same in all of these microphones, with very little difference in schematics, or production.

What I am offering- is something cooler. Mechanically similar to the Neumann U87, coated in a laboratory-grade, porcelain, powder-coating to make it prettier and more durable. Multi-Pattern, and a decibel reduction switches make this a truly versatile tool for any studio. It comes with a large GOLD-PLATED diaphragm to prevent corrosion, and a LIFETIME WARRANTY. It comes in a custom wood box that you will want to display in your studio with pride. It looks like a Storm-trooper made a baby with a Light-saber. All of this, assembled by hand in my town in the Shenandoah Valley.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Assembling these microphones takes patience and time. We want to get it right.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Powder-coating it in ceramic material... like the Space Shuttle.
Reusability and recyclability
I plan to ship these using recyclable materials. Also, we have a hearty recycling program at the shop.
Sustainable materials
Most of the components from these microphones can be recycled. But, truth be told- these microphones will outlast us all.

support.title: ARCLIGHT MICROPHONE
support.descp:
In Calcium White, with a black ring. Rigorously tested to be compatible with the best, high-end microphones available. Powder-coated with ceramic armor. The gold-plated diaphragm assures low self-noise, high output and the accurate reproduction of even the subtlest sounds, especially high frequency signals not easily reproduced by conventional microphones. Lovingly assembled by hand, in the Shenandoah Valley, and mailed to you in a custom, black, wooden case- shockmount included. Lifetime warranty- if it fails through no fault of your own, we will replace it at no charge.
SPECS:
• Polar Pattern: Cardiod/Bi/Omni
• Frequency  Response: 30Hz-20 kHz 
• Sensitivity:-33/-36/-38dB±2dB (0dB=1V/Pa at 1 kHz)  
• Max. Input SPL: 130dB (T.H.D≤1% at 1 kHz) 
• S/N ratio: 70dB
• Output Impedance: 250Ω±30% (at 1 kHz) 
• Phantom 48v required
