updates.update_content:
Hey, everyone. Thank you for your patience! Here is an update on the progress of the ARCLIGHT Calciums:
1. The circuit boards and internal components on the mics are done!
2. The exterior parts we ordered from a manufacturer in China, and because global shipping is very backed up right now, they won't be in until next week. We will get them powder coated ASAP, and then assemble and test your mics! Sorry for the delay on this.

Our website is now live! You can check it out here:
https://www.arclightmic.com/main
Love,
Reese

Hello everyone! I wanted to thank you all again, so much, for helping this dream to become a reality. Also, to give you an update on the assembly process and your Kickstarter rewards:
First, the good news- The T-shirts and decals are done. Those should go out later this week or early next week to all the backers who got them. Hooray for that, and thank you! We also have all of the parts for the microphones ordered and on the way, so now we will just have to wait for that to powder coat the exteriors and then to assemble and test them.
I'll be sending these out very soon. Hooray for you guys!

Thank you everyone who has supported this project. We made our goal, which I thought was going to be impossible. Thank you so much for believing in this! I will not let you down. This mic is going to be cool.
Love,
Reese

updates.update_userinfo: MIC SHOOTOUT. Arclight Calcium- Queen Vs. ARCLIGHT CALCIUM.
updates.update_content: Here is our baby. Listen to this file of the isolated vocals from Bohemian Rhapsody by Queen- through it, and decide for yourself. As discussed previously, the track was set to the same volume on all of these "shootout" tests. The mic was placed 6 inches away from a Yamaha HS8 monitor (which we found to be a fair representation of an accessible monitor, that faithfully reproduces most sound, in and outside of the spectrum of human hearing), and it was also placed equidistant between the low and high cones. There were no pre-amps used, or any effects. What you hear is just the sound, reproduced by this amazing microphone.

campaign.story:
... Just sit right back and read a tale, a tale of a faithful trip, that started from an intergalactic port, aboard this tiny ship... 



Page 1 by Manu Silva
Page 2 by Manu Silva
Page 3 by Manu Silva
Welcome to the beginning of all things Riptoadz!
Where it all began ...
This adventure started many years ago, while growing up in the small town of Utopia, Texas. In second grade I discovered my love of drawing when my teacher gave me an old, 1940s book about drawing cartoons. That book set the course for years of drawing at home and doodling in the margins of my assignments at school. My world turned green forever when I found the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. Growing up with the cartoon, my mind began to race with characters and stories of my own. I dreamed of someday putting pencil to paper to share my years of imagination with the world. Now is my time, and it feels like I’ve stepped into a time machine. It might be 30 years later, but this is only the beginning! 
Concept art by Matthew Holland



 T I R
The Intergalactic Riptoadz belong to an amphibious race from a planet in a distant galaxy ... far, far away … well, you get the idea. Refugees from a war-stricken planet, the riptoadz hope to find a new home where they can start a new life. They aren't looking for trouble but they won't run away from it either. They pack quite an intergalactic PUNCH when their backs are to the wall. As you’ll soon discover, there’s more than meets the eye when it comes to these tadpolez.
Meanwhile, species throughout the universe are noticing an alarming number of their citizens disappearing mysteriously. As the Riptoadz journey through space, they’ll tangle with the galaxy's most sinister space pirates, Red Beard and his pack of menacing robo hounds. Will they be able to stop his heinous, intergalactic reign of terror? Will they find a new home? Will they survive at all? Back our campaign to help the intergalactic revolution and learn their fate!



 The Intergalactic Creators 
My name is Matthew Holland. I’m the father of two wonderful kids, who I work full-time to support. In my few moments of down time, I love to draw, ink and sculpt my life away. I have teamed up Manu' Silva to bring new life to The Intergalactic Riptoadz.
Emanuel Silva, known in the art world as Manu Silva, is a Brazilian artist rising in popularity among TMNT, Predator and Venom fans for his detailed style inspired by legendary artists like Todd McFarlane, Alex Ross, Greg Capullo and J. Scott Campbell. Other inspirations include Mike Deodato Jr, Gabrielle Dell’Otto, Adi Granov and classic greats such as Jack Kirby, Walter Simonson and George Pérez.
With our powers combined, T I R and the galaxy will never be the same!

Cover B by Manu Silva

 Our Intergalactic mission
Our Intergalactic mission
The mission of this project is to increase awareness of human trafficking, shedding light on a dark scourge that has plagued the human race for centuries. Too many lives have been stolen, too many atrocities perpetrated … all for the sake of human greed and depravity. As we raise awareness, we push toward a future where the darkness of human trafficking fades away. 
Page ? by Manu Silva (wormz)



For the campaign...
We’re planning 32 action packed pages of awesomeness plus we‘re offering special variant covers, as well as signature options. We have also called on comic book artist, Frank Fosco (TMNT UL) and Jason Flowers (Bounty Bullfrog) to help our quest by offering variant covers that will be out of this world! There will be a limited number of original art sketch cards available. There are awesome pin-ups, stickers, posters by some awesome artists and bonus material that will be unlocked as stretch goals are met.  We want to put as much intergalactic swag in your hands as possible. We just need your support to make it happen!
Be the one and join the intergalactic revolution!

Cover art by Manu Silva
 Our intergalactic budget  
The funds will be allocated appropriately to cover the many costs of publishing a comic book of intergalactic proportion. Artist commissions and materials, publishing costs and massive amounts of time don’t just happen by magic. I know, I already asked; apparently, it’s a lot of hard work. And don’t forget the Intergalactic Federation will want their taxes and fees. With your support we will pay their bounty and help the Riptoadz bring balance to the universe! 

Cover art by Manu Silva

Join us for Intergalactic dominance over all tyrants and bullies! 
Cover B b&w by Manu Silva



Original concept art by Matthew Holland
Original concept art by Matthew Holland
Pin up art

Concept by creator Matthew Holland
Concept art by creator Matthew Holland









STAY TUNED FOR MORE AWESOME INTERGALACTIC UPDATES!!!
We have some really awesome villains, heroes and spin-off stories that will be ahead in future doses!!
A special intergalactic thank you to Chris Gage, Emanuel Silva and Wes Roberts. Thanks to each of you for your suggestions and support. Without you guys this would not be possible!! Together we can make a difference in our own galaxy!
BE THE ONE!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Together, Manu and myself believe that we will gain enough family, friend and fan support to get our project funded. The challenges we will face will mostly come from any pandemic related delays in shipping or printing. We have full confidence that we will be able to complete this intergalactic mission on time! This will be a super detailed work of comic book art! Oh, and YOU risk the chance of having your mind blown!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The last 14 hrs. This is not the end!
updates.update_content: Hey Riptoadz family, we are here at the end of the campaign still under half funded.  While this may seem like defeat it is most certainly not. We have learned a few things and have a plan to move full steam ahead.  We will most definitely be launching another campaing very soon after we make some adjustments and also we will be submitting our works to some awesome publishers as well!  So please stay tuned and stay safe. We will be back with a vengence and we will need you to answer the call once more.  Thank you so much for being a part of this journey and we will see you in the near future!

campaign.story:
Hey everyone, and welcome back to our 8th Kickstarter!
Giancarlo Caracuzzo, Artist of Marvel, DC Comics, IDW, Ed. Soleil, Delcourt, IDW Publishing, Wunderman Comics etc, after the success of book "BAD GIRLS 1 & 2, Terror and Monsster, Simon Blood Vol 1, Is on the cloud ",  Presents...
This Artbook (CM 22x 22), new colleciton of  illustrations full color.  The  artistic techniques used  for this book are multiple, watercolors,  acrylics, colored pencils,  inks and digital colors. In this book you  will find the Warriors, Samurai, Ronin, Geishe,  Princesses , Fairy tales, our whole imaginary of Japan world, inspired by the great artists as Hokusai, Utamaro, Kuniyoshi e Harunobu. Miyazaki, Otomo, Tezuka etc.

All the illustrations and  the book are ready, and I will be ready to  send it to all supporters by June 2021, just time to work on the Rewards
Some pledges.....
 I'm aware that in this hard period for all of us it is difficult   to  ask for a contribution, we are living  confused and complicated  days,   but as you read, my artbook is already printed, I ask for a very  low   cost for the pleasure of sharing with you the my little project,  jump  on  board my friends

About Giancarlo
I was born and live in Rome, Italy. I have drawn comics for a long   time, and have worked with several Italian, French and Belgian   publishers ( Dupuis, Soleil, Delcourt, Robert Laffont). In the last 12   years, I have worked with IDW Publishing, Darby Pop, Wunderman Comics,   Image, DC Comics (Jonah Hex, Batman ‘66 ) Marvel (Cable, Atlas,Gorilla   Man, Spiderman, Iron Man and the mini-series Formic Wars ), Wunderman   comics, Heroic Publishing, and The Phantom for Frew Publications
About Flavia
Flavia was born in Rome on 21 June 1991. In 2010, she graduated from  the Roman School of comics as  an illustrator, storyboard artist and  colorist. Since 2010 she has been  an illustrator and colorist, and has  worked with both Italian and US  publishers: DC Comics ( Batman ‘66 )  Darby Pop ( the Indestructible mini-series) Wunderman Comics, Heroic  Publishing, Editions Soleil. She has also worked as an illustrator for  various advertising agencies. As a painter, she has produced two  exhibitions in Rome.

campaign.story:
It's time to print and release the newest volume of the GOLD DIGGER COLOR GOLD BRICK SERIES, which collects issues 226 through 250 of Gold Digger!  If you supported the previous color Gold Bricks, thank you very much, and we hope you support this campaign too. With a load of great standalone and continuity pickup stories, this collection makes a great jumping-on point for any new readers, as well as awesome reading for longtime fans. THESE ISSUES HAVE NEVER BEEN COLLECTED INTO ONE VOLUME BEFORE. Between its black-and-white and full-color issues, Gold Digger is now approaching the 300-issue mark and is going strong!
If you're not familiar with us, my name is Joeming Dunn, and I run Antarctic Press, a small, independent comic company started in 1984. I have personally collected comics of almost every type and genre since 1974, and I can say that during the past 30 years, we have published some of the greatest and best independent comics out there. Our publishing history includes titles like Gold Digger and Ninja High School. The comic industry has changed over the years, so we have started this Kickstarter program to help introduce new projects from our talented group of creators.
Over the years, we have published a number of series. Prominent among these is Fred Perry's ingenious title, Gold Digger, which Fred describes as a mixture of Indiana Jones and Final Fantasy. The idea for Gold Digger was first conceived during Fred's tour of duty in the first Gulf War, and it debuted in Antarctic Press's anthology comic, Mangazine, in 1991. A four-issue miniseries followed in 1992, and a regular monthly black-and-white series followed starting in 1993. The current color series began in 1999 and has continued since then. It is the second-longest-running solo-created title in the industry. In 2013, Fred was honored at Comic Con International in San Diego, where he received an Inkpot Award for his work on Gold Digger.
Over the past years, we have released other Color Gold Bricks as Kickstarter projects. We are now releasing the eighth Color Gold Brick, which features issues 226 through 250 of the Gold Digger series. (This is actually the 10th Gold Brick. More on that below.) If you haven't seen or read Gold Digger, this is your chance to enjoy one of the best and longest-running ongoing series in comics. Like the other Bricks, this one lets new readers join in easily, so you don't have to be shy!
The two earliest Brick volumes, Gold Brick 1 and Gold Brick 2, were black and white. Then Fred began his color series, so Bricks 3-6 were printed in color. Gold Brick 3 was originally printed in limited quantities, and Fred's only reference copy became thoroughly destroyed from years of constant use. Kickstarter was used to make this out-of-print edition available again as Color Brick 1. By this time, the original stock of Brick 4 had sold out as well, so we offered a new printing of that through Kickstarter as Color Brick 2.  However, the original Bricks 5 and 6 were still in stock at the time, so we skipped ahead to produce Gold Brick 7 (Color Brick 5), collecting material not previously available in this format, and have continued the sequence from there. (We know this can still be confusing, so we have a numbering guide at the bottom of this page.)
Since the original printings of Gold Bricks 5 and 6 have since sold out, we'll eventually go back to reprint these other volumes to match the new Kickstarter printings' format. We want everyone to have nice editions. For now, however, in addition to reasons already mentioned, many backers in previous campaigns have asked if we could skip ahead, since they had already purchased the earlier editions. Skipping ahead allows these backers to have a nice, new volume for their shelves. At the same time, we also help backers who missed the earlier Brick offerings way back in the day to catch up via the reprints.
You can actually read the color series up through issue #99 online at http://antarcticpresslibrary.com/ and see what you've been missing.

What are we going to do with the Campaign money?
Plain and simple, we're going to print and ship the Gold Digger Color Gold Brick 8.
The Color Gold Brick is over 600 pages in FULL COLOR. Printing the actual books is the biggest single expense. The first print run of a typical Gold Brick is quite expensive, as most printers require a minimum run to make it cost-effective. We are thus using Kickstarter to assist us with those costs. If the amount seems high, you must remember that we are printing at least a thousand copies of a 600+ page book. Another cost is shipping: First we will have to ship the books from the printer to our offices, and once we get them, send copies to all our supporters and distributors. Several thousand pounds of books represents a significant shipping expense.
Here is a breakdown of our expenses.
Printing: $12,500 (which includes hard and softcover)
Shipping: $3,000 (Sending a 600-page book is costly, especially overseas.  The cost for shipping just one copy overseas is now around $34.)
Fees: $1500 (Kickstarter takes their fees off the top)
Handling/Supplies: $1500 (We have to pay for boxes and pay people to pack those boxes.)
That does not include cost for sending the large PDF files to all the supporters and other miscellaneous costs.
Those basic expenses total $18,500.
So what do you get?
The brick is 6 x 9 inches and will contain issues 226 through 250 of the Gold Digger series. You can see the covers to all 25 issues below.

REWARDS
Here are the rewards we are offering. Some of you may ask why there are not any sketch editions with these rewards as in previous campaigns. Without going into details, Fred is a very busy man and has taken on more responsibilities, both family- and work-wise. At this time, we did not want to burden him with any further work. We hope you understand.
ADD-ONS
We hope to print other Gold Bricks, both earlier ones as they sell out and new ones never before collected. As you know, this volume will reprint 25 issues of the color series, but there are over 200 issues of Gold Digger, and this printing of 600+ pages only covers about 10% of the entire run. Many of the early issues are the ones that are most desperately out of print. Being a small, independent publisher, we are forced to try to keep our cost margins as narrow as possible, and the end result is many of our books sell out quickly and become unavailable. Hopefully, we can use this campaign to help us keep all of our books in print. This is especially important with Gold Digger, since new readers discover the comic every day. We hope to be able to include other items as push goals, which may include getting other Bricks out to you.
NUMBERING GUIDE
Gold Brick #1 (B/W #1) - The first Gold Brick, which collects the first 25 issues of the black-and-white regular series. (Not offered on Kickstarter.)
Gold Brick #2 (B/W #2) - The second Gold Brick, which collects issues #26 – 50 of the black-and-white regular series. (Not offered on Kickstarter.)
Gold Brick #3 (COLOR BRICK #1) - The third Gold Brick, the first to collect the COLOR Gold Digger series issues #1 – 25. (New Printing on Kickstarter ended on January 1, 2014.)
Gold Brick #4 (COLOR BRICK #2) - The fourth Gold Brick, but the second to collect the COLOR Gold Digger series, containing issues #26 – 50. (New Printing on Kickstarter ended on May 16, 2014.)
Gold Brick #5 (COLOR BRICK #3) The fifth Gold Brick, collects issues #51 – #75 of the COLOR Gold Digger series. Currently sold out.  New printing planned for a future campaign, but not yet scheduled.
Gold Brick #6 (COLOR BRICK #4) The sixth Gold Brick, collects issues #76 – #100 of the COLOR Gold Digger series. Currently sold out.  New printing planned for a future campaign, but not yet scheduled.
Gold Brick #7 (COLOR BRICK #5) The seventh Gold Brick, collects issues #101 – #125 of the COLOR Gold Digger series. (First Printing! Kickstarter project ended on December 12, 2014.)
Gold Brick #8 (COLOR BRICK #6) The eighth Gold Brick, collects issues #126 – #150 of the COLOR Gold Digger series. As of color issue #150, we integrated the 50 black-and-white issues into the numbering to emphasize Fred's landmark achievement.  The 150th color issue was therefore published as Gold Digger #200, and the issue numbering proceeds from that point. (First Printing! Kickstarter project ended on August 2, 2016.)
Gold Brick #9 (COLOR BRICK #7) The ninth Gold Brick, collects issues #201 – #225 of the COLOR Gold Digger series. (First Printing! Kickstarter project ended on May 15, 2017.)
GOLD BRICK #10 (COLOR BRICK #8) The tenth Gold Brick, collects issues #226- #250. NEVER PRINTED BEFORE AND NOW AVAILABLE ON KICKSTARTER.
GOLD DIGGER- Publication History- In the beginning, there was an issue of Mangazine, which introduced Gold Digger to the world, and the issue was good. Then there was a 4 issue mini-series that got this joint a poppin'. Lo, there came the regular Gold Digger (Black and White) issues #1-50. Then, when mankind was ready and their fingers grew tired of newsprint stains, Fred Perry and Antarctic Press begat Gold Digger (Color) issues #1-149 on the glossy paper. Many years passed while readers enjoyed those amazing issues, and the world was ready for re-numberification. Thus spake Fred Perry: There shall be a number, and the number shall be #150—no, WAIT!—it shall be... #200, and all the Gold Digger numbering was reintegrated. 50+150=200.  And the world rejoiced, and the numbering has continued ever since! (So, why didn't we include the 4-issue mini-series in the reintegrated numbering? That needed some SPECIAL treatment: GOLD DIGGER: REMASTERED BOOK ONE.  But that is a different tale.)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks inherent in any project. This project has very few risks; the book is already done, and all we just need to do is raise the funds, pay the printer, and get it made. Our biggest risk is that we won't get the funding, and then the book won't be made. We have been printing and releasing books for close to 30 years, so we have a good relationship with our printer and do not anticipate any hiccups. There is always the risk that we won't be able to get the books in on time due to a variety of factors, but again, we do not anticipate that sort of problem. We believe in full disclosure and we will make sure to keep you all updated on the progress of the book and all the incentives. As you can see we have had positive responses to all our previous campaigns and have had no difficulty fulfilling our obligations. The printer we are using for this project is the same one that we have dealt with for many years so we do not anticipate any printing issues.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Kamen America, Volume 3, continues the saga of our heroine as she pursues the identify of her arch nemesis. Charlotte Vanders is a fashionista-turned-reluctant hero who must balance her rising stardom against a world whose principles run contrary to her own: and that's on top of her equally super-human rivals who want to take her down a notch!
Created by Timothy Lim and Mark Pellegrini 
Art, colors, and lettering by Timothy Lim
Written by Mark Pellegrini
First published by Iconic Comics 
Made and Printed in the USA
A sleeper independent hit that debuted in the spring of 2020, Kamen America has grossed more than $150,000 between 2 volumes and 2 platforms and is the flagship character of the imprint company Iconic Comics. It has since appeared in store shelves in a shortened form courtesy of independent publishing company Antarctic Press.
When we last left off in Volume 2, the Kamen Corps was squaring away with the triple threat of Machiavellian agent Niro Lansky, the mud-manipulating Vermillion Masquerade, and the arrogant, armored Kamen U.N. Having successfully teamed up to defeat the rampaging kaiju O-Scar, the Kamen Corps sets their eyes on expanding their grassroots support while looking for a way to take down Vermillion Masquerade for good!
Vermillion Masquerade, Lansky and Kamen U.N. form an alliance in a final bid to ruin the Kamen Corps for good! But an unexpected ally comes to their rescue at the last minute-- will Kamen America and her newfound friends save the day and uncover the secret of Vermillion? And who will emerge victorious in the final showdown between Kamen America and Kamen U.N? Find out in the latest volume of the Kamen America saga!
HARDCOVER BOOKS and ADD-ON REPRINTS
Back Cover by Kumaartsu
Genzoman Bombshell Variant Add-On
We are pleased to have upgraded our 2021 lineup of books to a new hardcover stock, beginning with Volume 3! This new standard feature will ensure the durability and protection of our work, and we are happy to offer this to our loyal readers at no extra cost with this volume. We are also offering premium hardcover reprints of Volume 1 and Volume 2: great for new readers and perfect for those just wanting to complete their collection. Both feature brand new cover art by Hibren!
MASKS
We are pleased to introduce our first line of WEARABLE and DISPLAYABLE leather masks! Made of 100% pure American leather in the heart of Texas, these are one-size fits all masks with soft leather ribbon ties to secure them onto the face. The back of each mask is left unpainted and smooth to allow for breathability while wearing!
Official Kamen America Mask, made of pure leather in Texas
Our model, Brittney, showcasing the mask

ACRYLIC STANDEE
Our best selling acrylic standees are back, this time featuring the current Kamen Corps roster! Art by Timothy Lim and GENZOMAN!
5.75 inch standee featuring Kamen America, Kamen Ramen, and Kamen Comet
ORIGINAL ART
 The very first original art created for KAMEN AMERICA was done by our friend Matthew Weldon: he's back, this time providing you with original, unique art on shikishi board! The highest perk comes with original art on a bigger board, but it's the same great Matthew Weldon art.
Original art by Matthew Weldon
KAMEN AMERICA STATUE
We've created these unique hand-painted statues exclusive to our campaign! Each one is digitally sculpted, printed, sanded, varnished and hand painted: this makes them one-of-a-kind maquettes where no two are exactly alike. Each one will come in extremely secure packing and, it being the highest tier, will come with most of the perks associated with the other pledges!

MORE ADD-ONS
 We are happy to be able to offer add-ons now on Kickstarter thanks to their beta testing program! In addition to the hardcover reprints of Volume 1 and Volume 2, we are also offering an 11x17 lenticular poster with art by Shikari Shambu: depending on where you are viewing it, you will Kamen America's face in various stages of transformation! We are also offering the official theme song of Kamen America, Velvet Thunder, as a physical CD album. Each copy is signed by Sheilava and comes with an exclusive variant sleeve with art by Man Tsang: it contains 3 songs, including the instrumental and lyrics version of Velvet Thunder and an unused track by composer Doug Garrett!
Lenticular Poster by Shikari Shambu
PLAY

Velvet Thunder CD -- Each Signed by Sheilava
Velvet Thunder CD -- Composed by Doug Garrett, Vocals by Sheilava
IMPORTANT: FULFILLMENT POLICIES and PRACTICES
We are proud of our 100% fulfillment rate and are committed to providing quality customer service and an expedient delivery: all of our books are 100% complete at the time of a campaign launch and the majority of our physical offerings are also in-hand. Every package comes with standard tracking, e-mailed to you the moment the label is printed. To ensure best-practices as far as fulfillment is concerned, we ask that you read this VERY CAREFULLY before ordering.
DIGITAL DOWNLOADS
Digital files are sent out 24 hours after we receive our funding, which is typically 14-17 days after the last day of the campaign. These are e-mailed to the address on file and are valid for 7 days. Any extension of this is subjective. 
We will not be mailing out links after 31 days. 
No questions asked, no extensions past this point.
To ensure that you receive the necessary e-mails that contain these links, DO NOT block, filter, or unsubscribe ICONIC COMICS, KAMEN AMERICA, WETRANSFER, or ORANGEDOX. 
New to this year is a tracking function that we have backstage that allows us to see download activity based on the e-mail addresses that the link is sent to. We reserve the right to terminate any current or future download ability based on unusual spikes in downloads coming from certain e-mail address. We are aware that people like to enjoy books on multiple devices, but it is at our discretion to evaluate individually any cases that seem to suggest piracy or link sharing.
SHIPPING
All physical items come with an automatically generated tracking number e-mailed to you once the label is printed. We will offer replacements for any lost or damaged item. We will NOT offer refunds / replacements for books that we track as "DELIVERED", as it is your word against ours that any form of theft has occurred. Should this happen, please file a complaint with your local UPS / USPS / FEDEX provider.
We are not responsible for missing parcels after 3 months from the day they are sent out: that is when tracking information is no longer available to us, and it becomes the customer's word against our fulfillment that a package was not sent. Please read our fulfillment policies very carefully so that there is no confusion later on.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have minimized risks over the last 2 years of crowdfunding by being very transparent with our policies and fulfillment procedures on our campaign pages. We have a dedicated fulfillment team that is 100% committed to the speedy delivery of campaign perks. Our books are 100% finished before launching our pre-order campaigns, meaning you won't be waiting several months or years for your orders: we deliver early or on-time, provided that your surveys are filled out expediently upon the campaign closing.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
PLAY

NINJA HIGH SCHOOL exploded on the indie comic scene in 1987 and was the   first original American manga series to make a big hit. Following the   adventures of Jeremy Feeple who is suddenly being chased by a ninja named Itchy-Koo and an alien princess named Asrial in the town of   Quagmire. Later his younger brother Ricky would pick up the mantel. For 175 issues it is one of the longest running OEL(Original English  Language) manga to exist and has  influenced many. So much so that fans  and readers began to submit  stories based on the NINJA HIGH SCHOOL  characters and story situations.  This lead the creator of NINJA HIGH  SCHOOL, BEN DUNN, to begin to  collect these stories into annuals or  YEARBOOKS. Thus began a 20 year  tradition.
Now for the first time ever, these stories are being collected in  what  will hopefully be a series to collect all the various stories that  take  place in the NINJA HIGH SCHOOL universe. Inside this collection are   the talents of many fans and readers. Some who have gone on to have   incredible comic careers.
This is a must for any NINJA HIGH SCHOOL or manga fan.
PLAY

campaign.story:
🤯🚨 WE DID IT! 🤯🚨 THANKS TO YOU ALL! 🤯🚨
We hit our INITIAL GOAL, which means:
The project ‘comes to life’ & EVERYONE will get the rewards they backed!
 WWN can RELAUNCH our publication by hiring some NEW STAFF! 
PLUS, we still have 3 DAYS LEFT before this thing is all over!!!
If we can get to the STRETCH GOAL of $60,000, we’ll usher in the triumphant return of...
 😡 ED ANGER 🤬
Thanks so much for your support!! Our newsroom is AMPED.
*NEW REWARDS ADDED* See below for details.
 PITCH A STORY TO WWN - Now an ADD-ON ITEM for $50.00!
 WWN COLLECTIBLE GUITAR PICK (see below) is UNLOCKED!
 NEW Bat Boy & Manigator action figures are GOING FAST! 
 BIGFOOT CROSSWORD PUZZLES digital stash is UNLOCKED for EVERY BACKER! 
*THE PROJECT ENDS ON FRIDAY AT 5:00PM*
*WEEKLY WORLD NEWS ACTION FIGURES*
We teamed up with Retrogimmick to create extremely LIMITED EDITION Bat Boy & Manigator HANDMADE action figures. 
Figures are an ADD-ON ITEM ONLY - LIMITED TO 10 OF EACH. 
NEW FIGURES ADDED! 
Black & White Newsprint Variant Bat Boy
Candidate Bat Boy
CHOOSE ANY $15.00+ REWARD & ADD-ON THE ACTION FIGURE DURING CHECKOUT
*OR*
ADD-ON to your CURRENT pledge of $15.00 & above by:
Clicking the BLUE "Manage My Pledge" button
(Re)Selecting a reward
Adding-On items on the next screen
👏 THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT! 👏 
Choose Your Favorite OR Get The Whole SET!
 GRAB YOURSELF THE POPULAR SUPERFAN PACK!
WWN SUPERFAN PACK INCLUDES:
 CHOICE of Classic WWN Cover Poster (4 to Choose From) [13x19 size]
 CHOICE of WWN T-Shirt or Hat
 Bat Boy Face Mask
 YOUR NAME PRINTED in the WWN Greatest Covers KSR Special Edition Tabloid
 YOUR NAME ADDED to the "WWN Greatest People" list on WWN website
Printed Copy of WWN Greatest Covers Special KSR Edition Tabloid
 Bat Boy/Bigfoot 2020 Digital Campaign Poster
Digital WWN Zoom Backgrounds & Wallpapers
Digital “I Supported WWN Kickstarter” Certificate
All Updates & Backers Only Content from WWN
*REWARD ALSO AVAILABLE FOR THE COMPLETE SET OF POSTERS*
 *PLUS EVEN MORE NEW REWARDS*
Customized Weekly World News Cover Images with YOUR FACE 
 YOUR NAME included in a future WWN Story 
 PITCH A STORY to Weekly World News: ADD-ON NOW for $50.00! 
Grab a ticket to an online conversation with WWN Editor-In-Chief, Greg D'Alessandro (done in small groups) & PITCH YOUR STORY IDEA to WWN! 
YOUR IDEA could end up in a future edition of Weekly World News.
HELLO, NEWS LOVERS!
We know you want NOTHING but the truth from the WORLD’S ONLY RELIABLE NEWS SOURCE, the Weekly World News.
The truth is that we need your help to successfully RELAUNCH the WEEKLY WORLD NEWS. You may remember us from the tabloid section of your supermarket checkout lane and with your support, we can BRING BACK THE WEEKLY WORLD NEWS - better than ever!
Before we can return WWN to the end of every grocery store aisle, we need to simply START by bringing WWN back online FULL TIME, as we work our way up to regular print editions.
Your support will help us print a SPECIAL KICKSTARTER EDITION of the Weekly World News GREATEST COVERS (1979-2020), as well as HIRE essential new staff members to better usher ourselves into a new era of reliable news!
We considered letting a massive media conglomerate shower us with millions of dollars, but that’s not the Weekly World News way! We’ve ALWAYS spoken directly to our readers, so we’re reaching out to everyone who has loved Weekly World News for decades, as well as those who have never heard of us (but can’t wait to jump on board the truth train).
Our Kickstarter project is helping to raise funds for a proper Weekly World News RELAUNCH. We’re using funds solely for content creation and web design, allowing us to hire:
(2) WWN Writers
(2) WWN Graphic Artists
(1) Web Designer
Ever since that day in 1979, when Bigfoot burst through the offices of the National Enquirer and demanded more coverage, the Weekly World News has delighted readers around the globe by breaking stories about:
L.A. Jetpack Officers
An asteroid named Nibiru heading for Earth
 Kim Kardashian’s exploding butt
The beginning of the Gootan alien invasion
 ...AND SO MUCH MORE!
  Many people think we shut our doors in 2007, but the truth — as you’d expect — is much stranger. We did have to become dormant for a wee bit of time; though not unlike so many other publications, ours simply ran out of money.
Malcontents say we closed, but you can’t stop passionate journalists from telling stories the world needs to know!
For more than 40 years the Weekly World News has covered stories the mainstream media has ignored, suppressed, or were afraid to take on. Stories that capture the imagination, that stir the soul, that allow people to wonder, to dream — and, at times, to scream!
With a record number of people feeling lost, confused, and yearning to know why Pluto has switched places with Venus - NOW IS THE TIME TO RESTORE THEIR COMPASS!!!
If you want the FULL HISTORY from “those who were there,” read all about it in Mental Floss: BAT BOY LIVES! AN ORAL HISTORY OF WEEKLY WORLD NEWS
Weekly World News has published more than 100,000 articles and introduced the public to hundreds of characters. These are stories of discovery — stories that teach you about the world(s) around us, that cause you to look deep inside, that make you ask yourself…
What the HELL is going on here?
No other news outlet has broken more stories about:
Aliens
Cryptids
Ghosts
The Paranormal
The Reincarnated
The Outerworldly
The Interdimensional
The Mysterious
The Unexplainable
 ...and of course, Page 5 Honeys!
  Not to mention countless conspiracy theories, biblical prophecies, and unique health cures!
Weekly World News published its first issue in October 1979, and for decades, legions of readers have relied on us to keep them informed about:
Bat Boy
The Lake Erie Monster
Bigfoot Hooker
P’Lod the Alien
Manigator
Ph.D. Ape
Elvis
The Abominable Beachman
Gluten Killing the Dinosaurs
Alien Headhunters
...and THOUSANDS of other stories
At the height of our popularity, Weekly World News had a print circulation of 1.2 million copies per week and reached tens of millions of consumers. 
One fateful day, a merry band of misfits took charge of Weekly World News and started to bring it back to life! To date, we’ve worked tirelessly to get the website fully operational, and we even secured Hollywood deals for an upcoming podcast, a TV series, and a game show.
But Weekly World News has always been about our EDITORIAL CONTENT.
You can’t be the best guacamole on the planet without using the best avocados, can you? If you’re not sure, ask little Jamie —
This is Jamie, a very tiny baby found in an avocado.
We know that you want to back this campaign just because you love Weekly World News:
But maybe these rewards will help you entice friends and family to join you?
Maybe you have a two-headed uncle or a three-legged aunt who can’t get enough news about mutants!
Or maybe your grandfather, who lived in a refrigerator for two months, saved enough to be a high-level donor, while he was chilling out?
With your generous support, we can RELAUNCH the Weekly World News!
We are locked in a cage with the Tooth Fairy, ready to make Weekly World News the only place for reliable news once more; but this project can only happen if we meet a minimum goal of $50,000.
 Kickstarter is an "ALL OR NOTHING" platform, so if we don't raise $50,000 dollars by the end of the campaign, NO ONE gets charged and the return of WEEKLY WORLD NEWS falters. 
🚨 WE CAN’T LET THAT HAPPEN 🚨
At the $50,000 level, we can start by adding the developmental staff that we need to RELAUNCH Weekly World News and EVERYONE who backs the project will get the reward package they chose!
If you're unfamiliar with how Kickstarter works, click here and read all about it. 
Bat Boy sports his own face mask on the campaign trail (Pictured here at a rally in a Wyoming cave) - ADD ONE TO YOUR KICKSTARTER REWARD PACKAGE FOR JUST $10.00! -
Check out the full list of rewards along the right hand side of the project and see below for more information!
Bat Boy/Bigfoot 2020 Campaign Poster Image
ALL REWARD ITEMS LISTED BELOW *ALSO* come with these additional items:
(1) Printed Newspaper Copy of WWN KSR Exclusive Tabloid 
 Bat Boy/Bigfoot 2020 Campaign Poster (11x17 - Digital Print File)
Digital WWN Zoom Backgrounds & Wallpapers
Digital “I Supported WWN Kickstarter” Certificate
All Updates & Backers Only Content from WWN 
$20.00: Weekly World News Greatest Covers - Kickstarter Exclusive Print Edition
A KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE, black & white newsprint collector's edition, Featuring WWN's greatest cover stories (1979 - 2020). This 48-page, LIMITED EDITION tabloid publication will be the centerpiece of your estate!  

Selection of WWN shirts and hats available to those who pledge.
$30.00: YOUR CHOICE of Weekly World News T-Shirt OR Hat
WWN Shirt Graphics + Kickstarter Exclusive Shirt graphic.
$50.00: KSR Exclusive T-Shirt + YOUR CHOICE of Weekly World News T-Shirt OR Hat
Show the world that you support WWN and get your choice of a WWN T-Shirt design, including this Kickstarter backer-exclusive “I Kickstarted Weekly World News” image. Available absolutely NOWHERE else!
Get 4 Masks and Free Entry for 2 to the site of Bat Boy's Discovery!!!!
$45.00: Bat Boy Masks + Admission to Lost World Caverns (Site of Bat Boy's Discovery)
Outfit yourself with 4 stylish Bat Boy Masks + TWO self-guided tour admissions to the Lost World Caverns in Lewisburg, WV. The Caverns are a vast wonderland of stalactites and stalagmites -  a magical place for young and old, kept at a constant 52 degrees year-round. Be sure to keep your eyes peeled for Bat Boy!
This is a reward any Bat Boy fan would eat bugs and pay $45 to add to their collection and includes:
(4) Bat Boy Face Masks
(2) Self-Guided Tour Tickets to Lost World Caverns in Lewisburg, WV
This campaign merchandise will garner respect in every community!
$100.00: Complete Set of LIMITED EDITION Bat Boy/Bigfoot 2020 Campaign Merchandise
Priceless heirlooms to be sure! Reward includes:
 BB/BF 2020 Campaign T-Shirt (Your Choice of Size)
 BB/BF 2020 Campaign Hat
(2) BB 2020 Campaign Bumper Stickers
(2) Large BB 2020 Campaign Buttons
(2) Small BB 2020 Campaign Buttons
Rare - Out of Print Weekly World News book
$150.00: LIMITED TO 50 BACKERS - Ultra RARE Weekly World News Book
A 256-page compendium of our greatest stories wrapped up into a very stylish, hard to get and OUT OF PRINT book. You can't be a real WWN fan if this isn't in your library!
 $5,000.00: Tony n' Tina's Wedding Performance 
Up to 400 guests will interact directly via ZOOM with Tony & Tina, our characters, & break out into separate rooms for private encounters with the bride, groom, or their families & friends. The 90-minute event will be action-packed using the latest technology to bridge the gap between audiences & the characters.
SPECIAL WEDDING GUESTS: Bat Boy, Ph.D. Ape, Bigfoot Hooker, & The Lake Erie Monster. PLUS you get a Weekly World News T-Shirt & Hat!
The folks in our WWN Newsroom want to support (via Zoom), so you can CHOOSE from the following experiences OR scroll below to see how YOU CAN JOIN THE WWN NEWSROOM!
A stand-up comedy event with our investigative reporter Tammy Pescatelli 
A psychic reading from Mel Doerr (who's predicted presidential elections & Super Bowl outcomes for 40 years)
A private concert of favorites & jazz standards from resident troubadour Sal Donato (who's been singing the news since the '80s)
 A LIMITED EDITION WWN character portrait from Chris Zahner, our resident portraitist
 OR how 'bout a one-on-one with WWN Editor-In-Chief, Greg D'Alessandro, to learn how things get done in the newsroom & discuss YOUR IDEAS for Weekly World News! 
$75.00: Tammy Pescatelli Stand-Up Zoom Show Ticket
 $100.00: Tammy Pescatelli Zoom Show Ticket PLUS Zoom Meet & Greet Event + Signed Photo 
 $250.00: Private Zoom Session w/WWN Psychic Mel Doerr
 ALSO INCLUDES CHOICE OF WWN SHIRT OR HAT 
 $375.00: 1 hour Zoom Session w/Weekly World News Editor-in-Chief Greg D’Alessandro 
 ALSO INCLUDES CHOICE OF WWN SHIRT OR HAT 
 $400.00:  Private Zoom concert with WWN's resident piano man/troubadour, Sal Donato 
 ALSO INCLUDES CHOICE OF WWN SHIRT OR HAT 
$600.00:  LIMITED EDITION WWN Character Signed Portrait - Painted by Chris Zahner
 LIMITED TO 1 EACH of your 5 favorite characters, like the one of Bat Boy above (first-come, first-served!)
 ALSO INCLUDES CHOICE OF WWN SHIRT OR HAT 
$1,000.00: Become a WWN Regional Editor/Reporter
Become a pro bono regional WWN contributor, bringing us compelling stories from your area for six months (possibly more). Plus we'll deck you out in WWN cred to help you gather and contribute story ideas, hot tips, and advertising/sponsorship opportunities. Reward includes:
Title of WWN Regional Editor for YOUR REGION for 6 Months
 YOUR NAME on WWN Masthead as Regional Editor
 WWN Business Cards & WWN Email Address
 YOUR CHOICE of Weekly World News T-Shirt or Hat
$3,000.00: Join WWN Editorial Advisory Board
Some people spend their whole life trying to earn this honor, but for a LIMITED TIME ONLY (and a mere three grand), you can join the WWN editorial advisory board and have direct input into our coverage, our business, and our future.
Advisory board members will participate in monthly meetings that touch on all aspects of our reporting and business. You will also receive personalized business cards and be included on all key developments throughout the year. Reward package includes:
Seat on WWN Editorial Advisory Board for 1 Year
 WWN Business Cards & WWN Email Address
 YOUR CHOICE of Weekly World News T-Shirt or Hat
Funding our Kickstarter means that we will be printing a LIMITED EDITION KICKSTARTER SPECIAL EDITION of the Weekly World News, instantly a PRICELESS COLLECTIBLE.
This is a ONCE IN A LIFETIME chance to get your message/story/logo/brand/product offering into the most important compendium of reliable journalism!
We'll send you the specs & you design the print ready file, but WWN has final approval of ad. Every advertising reward package listed below also comes with the following items:
(1) Printed Newspaper Copy of WWN KSR Exclusive Tabloid 
 Bat Boy/Bigfoot 2020 Campaign Poster (11x17 - Digital Print File)
Digital WWN Zoom Backgrounds & Wallpapers
Digital “I Supported WWN Kickstarter” Certificate
All Updates & Backers Only Content from WWN 
The advertising packages of $1000.00 or MORE also include YOUR CHOICE of Weekly World News T-Shirt!
$150.00: A HALF-PAGE ad in Weekly World News Greatest Covers Special Edition
$250.00: A FULL-PAGE ad in Weekly World News Greatest Covers Special Edition
$1,000.00: WWN Social Media Sponsorship
For six months, we’ll give you or your organization prominent, regular exposure on one of our social media channels: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, Firework, or Pinterest.
Limited to one sponsorship per channel, with channels assigned on a first-come, first-served basis.
$1,500.00: Your very own PAGE 5 HONEY in WWN
Showcase the amazing internal or external beauty of your significant other in our upcoming Weekly World News – Greatest (Cover Story) Hits collectible tabloid and on our website and social media.
Submit photos and background on what makes them beautiful and badass, then let our writers do the rest! We will set aside all pages ending with 5 for these tributes. 
$2,500.00: YOU or YOUR BRAND Featured in a WWN Story!
For generous supporters at this level, the WWN reporting team will “find the story” that puts you or your brand into print on Weekly World News. (As always, our editor-in-chief has the final say on what goes on our digital pages.)
We’ll also throw in broad social media distribution of the story and provide you with a digital version for framing or other purposes.

$5,000.00: WWN Newsletter Sponsorship
Prominent sponsor exposure on Weekly World News’ email newsletter, which is “pushed” into the inboxes of thousands of diehard readers and fans each month.

$10,000.00: Extra! Extra! They Will Read All About YOU!
*WWN Website Sponsorship – Our Highest Level!!*
Prominent homepage sponsorship of the Weekly World News website for less than 6 cents per minute! Your logo or banner ad will be featured “above the fold” on the WWN website 24/7 for four months, plus regular social media reinforcement and the possible creation of WWN-themed swag with your logo for sale in our online store.
At this critical moment, when the world is at WAR WITH THE TRUTH, the Weekly World News is THE publication for independents, free-thinkers, and dreamers.
Weekly World News is a national treasure, a meaningful part of the American zeitgeist and culture for the past 40 years.
WE NEED YOUR GENEROUS SUPPORT TO MAKE IT THRIVE ONCE AGAIN!
Weekly World News is for people and mutants of all kinds, especially those who know that “Seven United States Senators Are Aliens."
We are but a small band of intrepid, rabidly enthusiastic, highly over-caffeinated writers, editors, and artists; chasing down groundbreaking stories, like “A Florida Man Divorced His Washing Machine to Marry His Toaster.”
We go where the FACTS lead us! 
We’re on a bold journey through Hell’s Sinkhole, through Napoleon's Wormhole, time-traveling through challenges great, small, and microscopic as we climb to the top of Media Mountain!
Weekly World News is for those who understand there is more to this world, that there is a reality behind our reality…
Are we living in a simulation?
Is the world flat?
Does yam pudding cure baldness?
If all goes well, we can get Weekly World News back into print and back onto the supermarket magazine shelves. In 1574, Nostradamus predicted that we would be the dominant news publication from 2020 until 3030…
 Let’s prove him right — AGAIN! 
The world needs Weekly World News now, more than ever!
WWN was the pioneering “alternative” newspaper — without us, there would be no The Onion, Hard Times, Cracked, Reductress, Waterford Whisper News, The Babylon Bee, The Daily Show, Full Frontal with Samantha Bee and so many others.
David Byrne’s movie True Stories was based on Weekly World News tales.
We’ve been mentioned in countless films and TV shows, and our illustrious fans include Steven Spielberg, Howard Stern, Seth Rogen, Anderson Cooper, Stephen Colbert, Johnny Depp, and all the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.
It’s time for the ORIGINAL, the FIRST, the BEST to regain its full voice and regain its hallowed place in society!

Ph.D. Ape has crunched the numbers and concluded that there are approximately 23.75 million people who know about (and love) Weekly World News. 
Weekly World News is also popular around the globe, with a rabid following in Great Britain, India, & Australia. We even have fans in Japan, where a version of WWN was translated & sold for years. We're in Brazil, where there seem to be a large number of alien headhunters who read Weekly World News while shrinking heads!
The mere mention of Weekly World News always brings a smile to someone’s face.
Weekly World News is YOUR publication, in which you can actively participate. 
This is a place for citizen journalists, for investigative reporters who share our vision, our values and our unique view of the world.
We WANT our readers to be actively involved in Weekly World News — sharing stories, videos, reports, and your tales of alien abductions and those horns on your head! 
We intend to keep our doors open to all readers and seekers of the truth, and we hope to continue to receive ground-breaking submissions everyday.
Not only will a successful project put Weekly World News BACK ON THE MAP, but it will help Lester Caine get out of his basement and back on the beat where he belongs!
EVERY SINGLE BACKER helps us send a clear message to the mainstream media - “We’ve got you scooped on ALL the WILDEST, WEIRDEST stories of the day!”
Thanks for reading.
We hope you'll join us in bringing back the WORLD’S ONLY RELIABLE NEWS!
❤️ Weekly World News Newsroom
 CLICK for Facebook 
 CLICK for Instagram 
 CLICK for Twitter 
 CLICK for YouTube 
 CLICK for WWN Website
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
1) The Gootans are trying to take over the earth, but luckily the Zeebans are working with us to defeat them, so we should be okay.

2) A gigantic asteroid might be headed for Timmy Johnson’s house in Butte, Montana, and it may wipe out the rest of the planet with it. But Ph.D. Ape is working on an “asteroid-killer,” so there’s hope.

3) A gigantic swimming dinosaur has been found in the South Pacific, and some baffled scientists believe that he has the ability to drink up ALL the ocean water on the planet. Earth without oceans — now that could be a real problem.

Other than those pesky little challenges, we've carefully priced out all of our expenses and printing costs. We’ve arranged for the logistics of reward fulfillment. 

We know exactly how much work will be required to get Weekly World News relaunched. We can do this! All we need is the funding to finish the job. 

Thanks for believing in us!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.descp: Half-page ad in the Weekly World News Greatest Covers (1979-2020) limited-edition collectible tabloid. Get your message/story/logo/brand/product offering into this HIT publication.

support.title: FULL-PAGE AD IN "WWN GREATEST COVERS"!
support.descp: A full-page ad in the Weekly World News – Greatest Covers (1979-2020) limited-edition collectible tabloid. Get your message/story/logo/brand/product offering into this HIT publication.

support.title: PRIVATE ZOOM WITH PSYCHIC MEL DOERR
support.descp: Get your very own Private Psychic Zoom Session with our amazing staff psychic Mel Doerr (Mel knew you would want a private session!). A one-hour, one-on-one virtual session with the most gifted psychic in the galaxy. He has accurately predicted the weather, fashion trends, and fast food fads for 40 years!

support.title: YOUR NAME Included in a WWN Story
support.descp:
Reward includes everything listed below:
INCLUDES:
YOUR NAME Included in WWN Story
Set of ALL 4 WWN Classic Cover Posters
Choice of WWN T-Shirt OR WWN Hat
Bat Boy Face Mask
YOUR NAME Printed in WWN Greatest Covers KSR Special Edition
YOUR NAME ADDED to "WWN Greatest People List" on WWN.com
Printed Copy of WWN Greatest Covers KSR Special Edition Tabloid
Bat Boy/Bigfoot 2020 Digital Campaign Poster
WWN Zoom Backgrounds & Digital Wallpaper Pack
Digital "I Supported WWN Kickstarter" Certificate of Achievement
All Updates + "Backers Only" Content from Weekly World News

support.title: ONE-HOUR PRIVATE ZOOM w/EDITOR-IN-CHIEF
support.descp: A one-hour private Zoom session with Weekly World News Editor-in-Chief Greg D’Alessandro. Pitch story ideas, discuss articles and learn the “how-to” of WWN.

support.title: PRIVATE ZOOM CONCERT W/ SAL DONATO
support.descp: Private zoom concert with WWN's resident piano man/troubadour. Sal Donato has been "singing the news" since 1980. He's written a dozen "pandemic songs" with Boyce Day in the last few months as well. Our resident piano man will play the songs of your choice for you and/or your family - Sinatra, Billy Joel, Bocelli, Beatles, jazz standards - and, of course, the Weekly World News theme song!

support.title: SIGNED CHARACTER PORTRAIT
support.descp: Your choice of an Exclusive Weekly World News Character Portrait painted by our very own Staff Portraitist - Chris Zahner. A one of a kind portrait of your favorite character (first come first served) like the one pictured below of Bat Boy.

support.title: SOCIAL MEDIA SPONSORSHIP
support.descp: WWN Social Media Sponsorship. For six months, we’ll give you or your organization prominent, regular exposure on one of our social media channels: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, Firework, or Pinterest. Limited to one sponsorship per channel, with channels assigned on a first-come, first-served basis.

support.title: BE A WWN REGIONAL REPORTER
support.descp: WWN regional editor / reporter. You become a pro bono regional contributor, bringing us compelling stories from your area. Plus your name on the WWN masthead as the editor for your region and WWN business cards with your own email address, to help you gather and contribute story ideas, hot tips and advertising and sponsorship opportunities.

support.title: PAGE 5 HONEY!
support.descp: Your very own PAGE 5 HONEY in WWN. Showcase the amazing internal or external beauty of your significant other in our upcoming Weekly World News – Greatest Covers collectible tabloid and on our website and social media. Submit photos and background on what makes them beautiful and badass, then let our writers do the rest! We will set aside all pages ending with 5 for these tributes.

support.title: YOUR BRAND FEATURED
support.descp: You or your brand featured in a WWN story. There’s advertising and then there’s news — and for generous supporters at this level, the WWN reporting team will “find the story” that puts you or your brand into print on Weekly World News. (As always, our editor-in-chief has the final say on what goes on our digital pages.) We’ll also throw in broad social media distribution of the story and provide you with a digital version for framing or other purposes

support.title: JOIN THE WWN ADVISORY BOARD!
support.descp: Some people spend their whole life trying to earn this honor, but for a limited time only (and a mere three grand), you can join the WWN editorial advisory board and have direct input into our coverage, our business, and our future. Advisory board members will participate in monthly meetings that touch on all aspects of our reporting and business. You will also receive personalized business cards and be included on all key developments throughout the year.

support.title: WWN NEWSLETTER SPONSORSHIP
support.descp: Prominent sponsor exposure on Weekly World News’ email newsletter, which is “pushed” into the inboxes of thousands of diehard readers and fans each month.

support.title: TONY n' TINA'S WEDDING PERFORMANCE
support.descp: An online ZOOM performance of this hit interactive show. Tony and Tina are BIG fans of Weekly World News. The performance includes the ceremony, reception, direct interaction with the characters, live music, and lots of dancing. Up to 400 guests will interact directly with our characters, break out into separate rooms for private encounters with the bride, groom, or their families and friends. The 90-minute event will be action-packed using the latest technology to bridge the gap between audiences and the characters. SPECIAL GUESTS at the wedding: Bat Boy, Ph.D. Ape, Bigfoot Hooker, and The Lake Erie Monster!

support.title: WWN WEBSITE SPONSORSHIP
support.descp: Prominent homepage sponsorship of the Weekly World News website! Your logo or banner ad will be featured “above the fold” on the WWN website 24/7 for four months, plus regular social media reinforcement and the possible creation of WWN-themed merchandise with your logo for sale in our online store.

updates.update_userinfo: Any Outstanding Rewards Issues for WWN Kickstarter??? - Please email us at info@weeklyworldnews.com
updates.update_content:
Please provide as much info as possible for us to research the situation (and make sure that you have responded to our Rewards Survey).    
To get us the fastest response, please email us at info@weeklyworldnews.com - as we are on Kickstarter with any regularity at this point. 
Please provide your name & address and KS email or backer # so we can find you - and let us know the items that you have not received (as they have been shipped from different locations/shipments).
We think we are very close to done on all rewards - but if that's not the case let us know!!

Dear Kickstarter Backers - 

Thank you for your patience and support!   We are getting close on completing fulfillment of all Kickstarter awards and that has put a big smile on WWN's own Ass-Backwards Man!

Dear and Patient WWN Backers -

While WWN is very quick to cover the most important breaking news, we have been slow in getting rewards into the hands of our followers - and in our communications on the process. 
We apologize for this but have learned a lot from the process - and remained committed to getting each and every backer the rewards they are due.  (The 53-odd backers that have not responded to the survey or emails over the past 5 months - well we officially can no longer promise that we can get you exactly what you selected - but we will work to make you happy if and when you get back to us.)

campaign.story:
Now up for Pre-Order on IndieGoGo
Thanks to over 400 believers the Kickstarter campaign is funded! But if you missed it here or want to still tell your friends about it, the book can still be pre-ordered on IndieGoGo, as well as some of the other rewards. Please click HERE to go to the page, and please keep sharing the news by sharing the link: https://bit.ly/simoneandajaxgogo
Fun! The world needs more fun these days, and "Simone & Ajax" are back in 4 all-new, wacky adventures. The collection, titled "Lemmings and Tigers and Bears! Oh, My!," is available in both print and digital editions, brought to you by Eisner and Inkwell-award winner and Hugo and Harvey-nominee creator/writer/artist, me, Andrew Pepoy. With over 30 years in comics, you may know me better for my work on Fables, The Simpsons, The X-Men, Red Sonja, Doctor Who, Archie, Sonic the Hedgehog, and many more comics for DC, Marvel, IDW, Dark Horse, Archie, and others. However, my favorite thing I've ever done is my own creation, "The Adventures of Simone and Ajax." Simone, a fun-loving, 20-something girl, and her best pal, Ajax, a small, green dinosaur, first appeared 30 years ago and have since appeared in many comics and been nominated for the Harvey Award for Special Award for Humor. My true comics love is Simone & Ajax. I'm very excited to make new tales of them, and I'm asking for your help to do that. Described by a reviewer as "...like the best issues of Cerebus, and a mood that harkens Bone," and by a reader as "...the look of an Archie comic but the sensibilities of a Marx Brothers movie," in this 128-page book there will be tales of pirates... 
...the Old West...
 ... vampires and werewolves, and the always popular "hardboiled" Ajax, Private Eye...
The covers for digital issues #3 and #4
 ... plus lots of lemmings! 
 Of the book's 128 pages, over 100 pages will be new comics, along with a collection of other Simone & Ajax artwork, such as covers and Christmas cards, some never seen by the general public, all wrapped in a new cover. As of the launch date, all the new comics are written and thumbnailed, about 60% are drawn, and over 50 pages are colored, with digital colors supplied by the colorist of the previous series, Jason Millet (Archie vs Predator). While a few images are here on this page (and I'll be adding more as finished), I want you to have a better idea what you're getting, so you can read previews of some of the stories at the Simone & Ajax webpage by clicking HERE. 
 I need your help to get us over the fun-ish line, so I can pay Jason (He has mouths to feed!), pay for printing, and get it out to you connoisseurs of fine and fun comics. Thank you in advance for your support in any form. A message of support is wonderful! I really need help getting the word out, so sharing this on Facebook or other social media among your friends and even the enemies you think would like it would be a huge help. But the most direct way you can support me and my comics making is to pledge! I have a number of levels and rewards for you to choose from. I know times are tough for many, so anything will be greatly appreciated. Want to send a buck or two to just support the cause? Thank you! Want the digital edition? Thank you! Or get the standard paperback? Thank you! There are also Mystery Boxes! Every box will contain the new book, a variety of other books/comics/etc. that I love, and some kind of art drawn by me, with one person getting a published pin-up worth $200. 
Left: Just some of the books and comics I have set aside for the Mystery Boxes. Right: Some of the roughs, sketches, and art that will be in every Mystery Box.
 There are art rewards, where you can get a drawing of a character of your choice or even the original, hand-drawn art for one of the covers of the 4 digital issues. I have never sold a piece of published Simone & Ajax art in all the 30 years of the series, so this is a very rare chance to get not only Simone & Ajax art, but a cover at that! 
 Or want art of dinosaurs of a different kind? I have art from my recent Dinosaucers mini-series, and you can choose from a random interior page or a specific cover.  
Examples of interior "Dinosaucers" pages by Andrew Pepoy, sent randomly, available as rewards.
 And now new Art Rewards added! My last two "Archie" covers! My last "Doctor Who" cover and "Katy Keene" pin-up! "Die Kitty Die" Pages pencilled and inked by me! And more!
Want a more personal experience? I'm offering one-on-one, via video,  portfolio reviews, where I'll go over your work with you and try to help you to be a better artist. Or if you're in the Chicago area, or willing to travel here, let's have lunch and talk comics or whatever! Want to get a combination of rewards not listed here? Just message me, and let's see what we can make happen. All cover art purchases and some other art purchases get their books with a signature and doodle (see reward descriptions). If you wish to add a signature or signature/doodle to a physical reward level that doesn't already include that, you now have the option to add-on those after you choose your reward. The add-on option will appear, and you may add the signature for an additional $5 or signature and doodle for $10. I'll deliver to you the 4 digital issue downloads along the way, so you have the fun comics to read while waiting for the finished book. The 1st issue is done, so I hope to have that PDF to you about a month after the campaign ends and another issue roughly each month after that.
If we meet our first goal, I have several stretch goals in mind. The first couple will help get you a better book (upgrade to hardcover for all physical backers at no extra cost to you!) and then some other extras and bonuses, like prints, stickers, and more! I also have some surprises during the campaign for what I'm calling incentive goals, so let's see what fun extras we can do by meeting and beating the goal.
If you have any questions at all, I'm here to answer them because I want you to feel good about choosing to help me. I know I'm asking something of all of you, to put your faith in me and in a book you can't yet get your hands on, but I hope my 30 years of reliably making comics will help you trust me to finish and get this to you as soon as possible. We all know the world needs more fun, so I thank you in advance for helping me bring some jokes, silliness, lemmings (lots of lemmings!), and adventure to you and others. Simone & Ajax thank you, too! 
Andrew Pepoy has worked for U.S., Canadian, British, and French publishers on hundreds of comics on such characters and titles as The Simpsons, Fables, Batman, The X-Men, Iron Man, Star Wars, Wallace & Gromit, Scooby Doo, Betty & Veronica, Lanfeust, Uncle Scrooge, and many more over the last 30 years. In 2000 Andrew redesigned Little Orphan Annie and drew the newspaper strip for the next year, and in 2005 he brought his knack for retro glamour with a modern twist to writing and drawing a revival of the classic Archie Comics character, Katy Keene. Since 1990 he has written and drawn many stories of his own Harvey Award-nominated creation, The Adventures of Simone & Ajax, which has been collected in book form by IDW and Andrew's own imprint, Spicy Tomato Studios. Nominated several times, Andrew won an Eisner Award in 2009 and has also won an Inkwell Award and been nominated for the Harvey and Hugo Awards. He lives in Chicago. His recent work includes drawing a Dinosaucers mini-series for Lion Forge, inking the 50th Anniversary graphic novel adaptation of the The Beatles' Yellow Submarine for Titan, inking various Simpsons comics for Bongo Comics, art for MAD Magazine, a run as guest artist on the Dick Tracy newspaper comic strip, inking and drawing Die Kitty Die for Astrocomics, and drawing covers for Doctor Who, Archie vs. Predator II, Red Sonja, Lady Death, and other titles.
Jason Millet (project colorist) is an illustrator, storyboard artist, and comic artist. He has provided storyboards and concept art for films and television for NBC-Universal, Sony, Disney, Fox, HBO, and Amazon among others. He has also produced a wide range of artwork for a long list of advertising clientele and publishers. He resides in Chicago with his lovely wife and daughter. Kickstarter Profile.
Design help from Danielle Reynolds at DMR Creative Group.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If 2020 has taught us anything it's that we can't predict what weird thing will happen next. I've tried to plan for what contingencies I can with the help of many more-experienced Kickstarter people. I have dreamed of making this book for many years, so you can be sure I will do my best to get it finished and in your hands on time, but if bumps in the road happen I will keep you informed.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Digital First Issue
support.descp: A DRM-free PDF of the first (of the 4 issues) only. No physical rewards or other digital rewards or stretch goals.

support.title: The Complete Digital Edition
support.descp: A DRM-free PDF of the entire book, as well as any digital stretch goals. No physical rewards.

support.title: The Regular (but fun!) Book
support.descp: The physical paperback book, as well as all physical and digital stretch goals, plus the 4 digital issues of the series and the complete book PDF as released.

support.title: The Book... SIGNED
support.descp: The physical paperback book, signed by Andrew Pepoy, as well as all physical and digital stretch goals, plus the 4 digital issues of the series and the complete book PDF as released.

support.title: The Book... SIGNED with DOODLE
support.descp: The physical paperback book, signed by Andrew Pepoy, with a quick doodle or either Simone, Ajax, or a Lemming (at random), as well as all physical and digital stretch goals, plus the 4 digital issues of the series and the complete book PDF as released.

support.title: Dinosaucers page + Book
support.descp: Get a signed page of original art by Andrew Pepoy from the recent "Dinosaucers" mini-series. Pages chosen at random. You won't know what you get until you get it, but it'll be worth the surprise! Please see examples photo on campaign page. Pages are 11x17 in., ink on bristol board. Plus you get the physical standard book, all digital rewards, and all physical and digital stretch goals. Art and book may be shipped separately.

support.title: Mystery Box! Ooooooo!
support.descp: Every box will contain artwork! United States only, because of shipping. You get the standard Simone & Ajax book, plus a plethora of goodies. Each mystery box will include a drawing by Andrew Pepoy. It might be a loose sketch, maybe a page thumbnail or cover rough, perhaps a finished drawing, and one random box will get a finished/published pin-up worth $200. In addition, every mystery box will include other comics by Andrew, plus other items. Some will include comics by others, Archie comics and digests, graphic novels and comics collections, vintage paperbacks, pulp reprints, and other fun things that Andrew likes and hopes you will, too. Each box will contain the $30 book and at least $50 of other items.

support.title: Retailer Level!
support.descp: Retailers, get 5 copies of "The Adventures of Simone & Ajax: Lemmings and Tigers and Bears! Oh, My!" at 40% off cover, shipping in U.S. included in price. For other amounts or for non-U.S. retailers, please message me and we'll figure something out. Thanks! Stretch goals not included.

support.title: Portfolio Review + Book
support.descp: I've always treasured a helpful portfolio critique, where useful tips are given, not where you're just told what's wrong. I'll bring my experience of 30+ years in the comics biz, you bring your art, and we'll meet, via video, to go over your work and see what we can do to help you along to your goals. Plus you get the physical standard book, all digital rewards, and all physical and digital stretch goals.

support.title: Commission Sketch + Book
support.descp: Pick your favorite character, and I'll draw it in ink in black & white, sometimes with grey marker added, on 9x12 inch bristol board, like I would if we met at a convention. If you pick Simone you get a free 2nd figure, as long as it's Ajax! ;) Plus you get the physical standard book, all digital rewards, and all physical and digital stretch goals.

support.title: Lunch with Andrew + Book
support.descp: Do you live in the Chicago area or are willing to travel? We would agree on a restaurant somewhere in my neighborhood, Wicker Park, in Chicago, and I'll take you to lunch. We’d talk about whatever we wanted, especially if you have certain things you want to chat about, ask, whatever. It’s your time. I’ll do my best to make things fun! And I hope it’s safe to do this soon, but we’ll have to wait a bit if it isn’t.

updates.update_content:
Hey, everyone!
Simone & Ajax love Kickstarter not only because it helps make new comics of them but because they (well, me, actually ;)) can back other great comics projects. So, while you're patiently waiting (Thank You!) for me to finish the Simone & Ajax book, here are few current Kickstarters I'm backing:
Kid Beowolfby Alexis Fajardo: I've enjoyed Alexis' work for many years, and this all-ages adventure looks to be lots of fun. Ends 6/25. https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/lexfajardo/kid-beowulf-the-tarpeian-rock

Hi, everyone!
I hope you're all doing well these days! I know some of you have been wondering how the Simone & Ajax book is going. While things got a little further delayed, work has sped up of late and pages are being drawn. I appreciate your patience and am trying to get this book done and to you ASAP. It's taking much longer than anticipated, but I hope you'll find it worth the wait. I'll be keeping you posted.

Hi, everyone!
I'm happy to say that I just sent out the download link for "The Adventures of Simone & Ajax" #3 to all backers who should be getting it. If you don't see an email link for it, please check your spam folder or sign into Kickstarter and check your messages there. I hope you enjoy it! Looking forward to hearing what you think. 
In the meantime I'm working away on the last part of the book and am looking forward to getting you all the fourth issue and soon after the complete book! And so back to the drawing board!!!

updates.update_userinfo: The Ringo Awards! Simone & Ajax Need Your Help!
updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone!
I hope you're enjoying what you've seen so far from the Simone & Ajax book. If you have, I'm asking for your help to get the digital issue of The Adventures of Simone & Ajax #1 (and me in general) nominated for the Ringo Awards. Anyone, professional or fan or anyone, can make nominations now through June 23rd, but the sooner the better, at https://ringoawards.com/

Hi! Another quick update: I've now finished pencilling #3! And there's a small preview below. I can't show you too much, since I don't want to give away the story before you get a chance to read it properly... which will be soon! With all 24 pages pencilled, 19 inked and lettered (and the remaining 5 letters/inks in the works), and 15 colored, it won't be long before you have it digitally. I'll keep you posted!

updates.update_userinfo: Simone & Ajax love other fun Kickstarters!
updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone!
We've had a sudden cold snap this week here in Chicago, so I'm staying in and working hard on Simone & Ajax. You can get a little peek at some perilous pencils at the bottom of this update. 
But as much as I like making fun comics on Kickstarter, I love backing fun comics here, too, and want to see great projects meet their goals and happen. I've backed over 100 comics Kickstarters, and there are a couple campaigns happening right now that I think some of you might enjoy:

Time for a quick update! Work continues on the Simone & Ajax book. I'm working away at drawing new pages, while Jason Millet is coloring all that I've finished. You can now see the first 6 pages of story 3, "Mosnter Mia," on the Simone & Ajax website by clicking HERE. And while you're there, please sign up for the Simone & Ajax/Andrew Pepoy newsletter at the link on the bottom of each page or by going HERE. I recently sent out my latest newsletter, and while there are over 400 backers for this book there are only 150 people signed up for my newsletter, and I'd like to keep you posted on all that I'm doing, not just this book. Thanks!

Hi, Everyone! I hope you're all getting through this winter okay. We've had more snow here in Chicago in the last couple weeks than I've seen in several winters. Work continues on drawing Simone & Ajax. As I'd mentioned, I'm far behind where I'd like to be, and I'm sorry for that. I hope the extra effort I'm putting into these pages will help you still be happy with the final book, even if getting it to you a bit later than I hoped to. I'll be keeping you posted on progress. 
On the plus side, the first colors on "Monster Mia" are now coming in from colorist, Jason Millet, and he's doing his usual great job. You can see the first 2 pages below. I'll soon be posting the first 6 pages to own website, , so stay tuned for that.

Hi, Everyone!
Things keep moving for Simone & Ajax here at Spicy Tomato Studios despite me coming down with strep for a 2nd time this winter! So, I lost yet another week of work on the book due to this latest bout, which is not helping get it into your hands, but I'll keep doing the best I can. Not sure with how hermity I've been due to Covid that this keeps happening, but I'll do my best not to make it a strep trilogy.

I hope you're all doing well! There will be a bigger update about the progress of the book, with new Simone & Ajax art previews, as well as your download link for the second issue of Simone & Ajax, coming your way in the coming days. However, this update is to give you backers first shot at some new art available. As you know, after the Kickstarter ended I moved the campaign over to Indiegogo. Please click here  to go to it: https://bit.ly/simoneandajaxgogo. While those Indiegogo backers won't get the prints and other exclusives you Kickstarter backers will, they can still get what art rewards that weren't snapped up. I'm going to be adding some new art rewards to the Indiegogo page soon, but before I do that I want to give you Kickstarter backers first shot at them. I'm adding 4 pages from the special and 1 pin-up for all from Astrocomix, and the cover for Atomic Action Comics' upcoming #3, featuring . Please see below for images of the art, prices, and more info. If you'd like to add this art to your pledge, please message me directly here on Kickstarter, and I'll get you payment info. There's only one of each, so first to ask gets it. Thanks, as always, for your support!

campaign.story:
In 2013 Jim Lawson started a magical adventure with a girl named Dragonfly, a turtle named John, and a dog named ketch. They crashed on what appeared to be prehistoric earth. We quickly learned that this is no ordinary world. With no memory of who they are or where they came from, they must travel through this magical place full of mysteries and threats. Almost 10 years later, the adventure continues. Follow our 3 heros as they journey through different worlds, fighting new threats while trying to discover the truth about who they are and how to get home. 

Here’s a little sneak of one of the page’s.
We are very excited to bring you our first book in the bew Dragonfly series. 
Almost 2 years ago I acquired the IP from turtle legend Jim Lawson. Now we have a team full of great talent. Chris Vance is doing all the art for Dragonfly. I knew from day one I had to bring Chris on board. Once I had the artist down I needed a colorist. Ive alway loved Beejay Hawns art. So I asked her to join the team. With Chris’ art and Beejay colors, you’re going to get a beautiful book. Dragonfly #1 is going to be 24 pages in full color.




Here’s how to add on covers. * click on “manage pledge” click “change pledge” adjust the amount. And hit “confirm” Covers A, B, and D are $10 each. Cover D and the complete series trade are $15 each
 Once you’ve added a cover or more send me a message through Kickstarter telling me what cover or covers you’d like. 



Lets look at the team!



Check out these covers!
Cover A
Cover B
Cover C
Cover D
The design is still not final.



Now this one hurts lol. I was originally not going to put this cover up for sale. I’ve decided to put it up for sale to help us with our book. Someone is going to get a special piece. 



 Also dont forget!!! all day one backers get this 11x17 print
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I’ve set the shipping date to March. We hope to have it done before that. With this crazy world we could hit speed bumps. Also Covid definitely brings a new challenge with shipping. there could be delays with shipping and or delivery issues. Chris will begin working on the page’s and sending them off to Beejay right after the kickstarter. There’s always a chance of delays and we’ll be keeping everyone up-to-date along the journey.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
