updates.update_content:
Howdy Friends-
Just a quick little update. All the books are printed and are in the studio now- it’s time to start fulfilling orders and rewards (a few went out last week). I just want to make it known that I am entirely a one man operation- everything that you get has been personally handled by me and me only. Because of this, it takes me time an I’m expecting that I will be mailing out packages for the next 2 weeks. Please be patient and know that I will get to your package during that time and that it should be arriving in your mailbox by the end of the month, I would think.

Hey Everybody—
This is a long overdue update. Sorry about that- it seems like I’m a little spun around lately.
Let me fill you in on where I’m at with the Box City Wallops comics. The solo issue is at the printer right now. Within the last hour, I approved the proofs for the book so really now all to do is to wait for the things to show up. From what they told me it’s a couple weeks turnaround time.

...as I write this. Last week the campaign ended in a glorious way- meeting it’s goal and beyond. I certainly should’ve sent out an update to all my backers thanking them at the time but I’ve been a little...distracted lately. This is that- a few days late.
Thank you all- I think you’re really gonna like the new books. In the latest news, I’m having a local small business print the TURTLES2030 comic and I will be seeing a proof tomorrow. No direct contact though- all the files and communication has to be done online. The finished books will be left on the front porch of the printer’s. I’m a real big fan of face-to-face so this is weird but no big deal really, I suppose. These are now the times we live in...

We did it!
Last night The BCW kickstarter crossed the line and became fully funded! That's great news- it's always a little scary to launch a project and hope that you that you have something that people will respond to. 2 weeks in now (to the day) we launched- and to have its goal met at the middle of the campaign says a lot about you the backers. Thank you for supporting me and helping get the word out.

campaign.story:
PLAY

PLAY

A retired vigilante has 24 hours to prove that he's still got what it takes to save his family, and himself. THE OPPRESSORS ISSUE ONE!
A retired vigilante has been captured and imprisoned on an island called "The Crate". He soon realizes that he's not alone. In order to escape he's going to have to fight his way through an onslaught of prisoners he put there. He has 24 hours save his daughter and prevent his own execution!
An action packed 22 page black and white comic! Written, drawn, and created by Dylan Andrews!


BATLANTIC STUDIOS
My name is Dylan Andrews, I am a designer, artist and comic book creator. I have been working professionally for almost 20 years in the field of publishing. I have done seven successfully funded kickstarter campaigns for my comic book ARCHIVE The WarHood Odyssey. I started reading comics when I was 5 years old, and I’ve always wanted to use my knowledge of art, design, and publishing to create my own comic books.
I am so happy to be part of the vibrant comic book creating community in Portland Maine. I love the over the top chromium age 90s comics from my youth and I want to bring back the excitement and energy that those comics had for me to a modern audience.
Here's a video showing WARHOOD ZERO! An 8 page full color sketch cover comic book available in some pledge reward levels!
   https://youtu.be/978H2Ixrupk  
PLAY

Here's a video showing the unboxing of my last creator owned series ARCHIVE The WarHood Odyssey! Trade paperback collections of VOLUME ONE AND TWO are available in some pledge reward levels! 
 https://youtu.be/6gkMPxT4fgY 
PLAY

campaign.story:
STRETCH GOALS! FOR ALL BACKERS WITH PHYSICALLY SHIPPING REWARDS!
After that comes our NEXT STRETCH GOAL REWARD - THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN #300 HOMAGE SHI: WOTW #1 25TH ANNIVERSARY PURE LINE VARIANT COVER! 
SHI’S BACK! Exclusive cover by Billy Tucci
BLACK FRIDAY SPECIAL - REMARKED NOIR PRINT!
Kickstarter Exclusive Cover - SHI: Return of the Warrior!!!!!!!
There I was… 
Armed with a portfolio holding the very pages in this book and storming the floor of the 1993 Comic Con International in San Diego…
I was anxious.  I knew no one, but even though my heart was pounding through my chest at this “one shot” at comic book fame, I held a strong conviction that I could somehow scratch out a living in this fantastically creative industry.  Like many a budding cartoonist at this biggest of all conventions, I stood in long lines and when it was my turn to show my wares, opened my book hoping the bored and hung-over editor would awake from his stupor and look up at me wide-eyed like he’d just made a great discovery…  And offer me a job. 
STRETCH GOALS!!!
  (Please note: Stretch goals are distributed per backer)
Problem was, that aside from Lady Death creator, Brian Pulido (who graciously offered me a pin up), no one was interested.  From the “Big Two” all the way down to the smallest of publishers, all turned me down -- every single one of them.  To say I was heartbroken would be a callous understatement, but I was undeterred.  I remember thinking to myself, on that long flight back home to New York, about a life of illustrating licensing products, or even going back to designing children’s wear.  Perhaps I could go back to the National Guard.   Either way, I had to do something as I was incredibly broke and way behind in my rent.
I put on my Sony “discman” (remember those?) and removed the portfolio from the aircraft’s overheadstorage bin.  Listening to Kitaro’s Kojiki, (which was the soundtrack I crafted up the “Way of the Warrior” story arc) I began thumbing through the book, critiquing each and every panel and determining which pages were good and which had to be redone.  My mindset was one of defiance as my train of thought was  “I’m not going to forget these pages and come back in six months with new material” like I had been instructed by the editors.  I will keep them, improve upon them and move forward with “my story”… the story of Ana Ishikawa and her monogatari titled, “Shi.”  I was going to self-publish comic books.
Billy Tucci - Creator
And that, pretty much, is how it all started.  Of course the next six months were utterly painful, but so exciting, as I delved into researching - just how in the hell does one “self-publish?”  This was before the internet, so I hit every library, read every book and bothered every retailer who would speak to me, trying to figure out just how to do this.  All the while, I worked freelance design by day and sharpened the Shi pages by night.   I “employed” two great friends, co-writer Peter Gutierrez and designer Barry Orkin, with my ever-suffering wife (then ever-suffering girlfriend), Deborah to refine the script and define the artwork.  There was much aggravation, missteps, late hours and fear – at one point I almost sold half the creation to a pair of predatory business “partners”, but that’s a story for a different day.  There were also triumphs -- none so gratifying as March 23, 1994 – the day, “Shi – The Way of the Warrior #1” shipped to comic shops across North America and Europe, making the anxious drama that seemed to daunt its creation every step of the way all well worth it.
As they say, from that day forward, things have never been the same.  And it’s all because of my friends, family, retailers and most of all, you – the reader.  Especially those of you who, for some reason or another, chose my book among hundreds that day in 1994, and for that I am forever grateful.  
SHI: Way of the Warrior #1, 1994
So join us for the first new Shi graphic novel in 15 years  ...  A story in which a comic book character has grown up in real time. ..  A story that is literally 25 years in the making and one we hope you will love reading as much as we have loved making.
Thank you… #SHISBACK!
Billy Tucci

SHI’S BACK!!!!
SHI “Amazing Spider-Man #301” Homage Cover by Billy Tucci
Crusade Comics is so excited to bring you the debut crowdfunding campaign for our all new 48-page graphic novel Shi: Return of the Warrior! 
Nigen-Sei Cover by Billy Tucci
In this story over a quarter century in the making we now find our heroine Ana Ishikawa 15 years removed from when she last graced the pages of a comic book. Ana is divorced from her husband, disgraced NYPD detective Peter DeNyse and now lives a peaceful, quiet existence raising their teenage daughter Hotaru.
Teenager Hotaru Ishikawa and her mother, Ana
SHI: Return of the Warrior, Interior
Most importantly, her warrior days far behind her…
But that all changes when Dr. YOU (a character that will be named after one of our backers via a special pledge level) brings the terrifying news that Masahiro Arashi has escaped from a New York City Mental Institution. Her former antagonist, now suffering from dementia has regressed back to his younger more violent self and is vengefully obsessed with the one person responsible for his incarcerated existence… Ana Ishikawa!
SHI: Return of the Warrior, Interior page
Manhattan is once again gripped in fear as a series of gruesome copycat Shi Killings resurface – with the order of victims proving ever closer to Ana. A desperate Ana must now, alongside Dr. You, seek out and stop Arashi before he can fulfill his murderous destiny… a destiny whose road ends with her own daughter Hotaru.
The maddened Masahiro Arashi
As Doctor You and Ana get ever closer, he confesses to her of Arashi’s twisted and dangerous obsession with the young Ana’s secret warrior persona, SHI, the living embodiment of death.
Worse still, the maddened Arashi is convinced that everyone: nurses, orderlies, janitors and especially the man treating him is in love with the lithe mistress of the underworld (Yomi). 
Dr. "You" (to be named by one of our backers!)
Ana is mortified that the doctor is fully aware that she is indeed a murderess and knows that if ever exposed would rightly be the end of her world. But You assures her secret is safe and even though his own life is in danger, he promises to take it (due to both professional and personal reasons) “to the grave.”
SHI: Return of the Warrior, Interior
But the grave just might be waiting for them all. For Ana will realize that measured acumen only goes so far in protecting those you love and, once again, the lioness within Ana will resurface to take up her trusted naginata, transform the hunted into the hunter, and unsheathe… The Return of the Warrior.
SHI: Return of the Warrior, Interior
In Return of the Warrior, Shi creator Billy Tucci is joined by co-writer Steven Peros, co-artist Ricardo Silva, colorist HI-FI Colour Design, designer Mindy Lopkin and superstar cover artists Amanda Conner, Paul Mounts, Wes Hartman, Conny Valentina and Mike Renzine. 
Our Troops
Special Guest Cover Artists!
Cover by Amanda Conner

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are so grateful to the OUTSTANDING fans Shi has had these last 25 years and are so very appreciative of how patiently you all waited for the next chapter in the saga. Because of YOU, this graphic novel is already in production! But we need you to help us see it to completion! Please share, tweet and recommend SHI to new readers and collectors, so she can be bigger and better than ever! Thank you in advance for your generosity, loyalty, and dedication!!!!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
HAIKYO KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE LAUNCHES TODAY!
Crusade Comics’ Shi: Haikyo, the sequel to the critically acclaimed, Return of the Warriorlaunches today, January 4th at 8pm EST (5pm PST) on Kickstarter.
After the terrifying events ofReturn of the Warrior, Ana Ishikawa must now save her teenage daughter Hotaru who’s been kidnapped by a murderous “Shi” copycat killer. But to do so, she’s forced to ally herself with her lifelong enemy, the manipulative Masahiro Arashi. But what if it is all a ruse leading Ana into a deadly trap set by the Yakuza Oyabun?

Dear Return of the Warrior Backer!
I hope everyone is enjoying the first weekend of 2021. New Year's is a time to renew. A time for rebirth and a fresh new start. Deborah and I have been working hard on the Shi: Haikyo Kickstarter page (you've might have noticed some changes going on with it,) so that when we launch the campaign in a little over 48 hours on Monday, January 4th at 8pm, EST it will be ready down to the most minute detail.

updates.update_userinfo: HAPPY NEW YEAR! SHI: HAIKYO LAUNCHES IN THREE DAYS!
updates.update_content:
Friends,
Out with the old and in with the New Year! Thank you all for your faith and support in Shi, Crusade Comics and me during the very trying, (to say the least) 2020.
Onward we move towards a bright new world full of amazing possibilities starting with Shi: Haikyo launching in just three days, Monday 8pm, EST.

campaign.story:
From Blood: A psychological action adventure thriller!
Patient 27 has been locked away at the Grove Mental Institution for years. No one knows his real name … no one knows what secrets he’s forgotten about. The only thing the staff knows is that he is an invincible monster to be avoided at all costs. After Patient 27 lashes out in a violent rage, Doctor Reese a new psychologist has a break through … then all hell breaks loose.
Together, Patient 27 and Doctor Reese begin a quest to unlock the secrets of the past and to understand why he seems to be indestructible. It’s a race across the country as they try to stay one step ahead of the men looking to turn 27 into a weapon, but can 27 ever be more? It’s an action packed voyage of discovery that you won’t want to put down. 
 Originally conceived as a black & white mini-series, From Blood is now a full color, perfect bound graphic novel, and we need your help bringing it to the world. Everyone has been working hard to get this book finished and with your support we can reward our team for their hard work and of course pay to print it.
Take a peek behind the cover ...
 We are offering three different versions of the From Blood graphic novel to readers and collectors as well as a special version just for retailers and resellers.
 The “Early Backer Cover” was only be available for the first 24 hours of the campaign, the “Standard Cover” is the “open edition” and the“Blood Foil Cover” will be limited to a print run of 60 units, maximum.
Order 25 or more units and a special edition of the From Blood Graphic Novel will be produced exclusively for your store! It will feature a Larry Watts cover with your store’s logo printed on our main character’s shirt. We will promote the books being available at your retail location through our website and social media accounts. These books will only ship to confirmed physical business addresses.
The From Blood Creative Team
 Almost Complete
At the launch of this Kickstarter, the Graphic Novel is nearly complete with all the writing, pencils, lettering and covers complete. Victor Muyo Jr. is more than just about halfway through adding his colors to the project. Meaning we are very close to having a deliverable product.  
The Rewards
 Just Added Reward Tier: The Cosmic Sampler includes digital samples of four of our books! This digital reward will be added to ALL backers who pledge $6.00 or more.
 The Money
We are running this campaign very tight to keep the reward tiers reasonable. The printing of the book will be a massive cost for us, so that is where the bulk of the funds will go. The rest of the money is going to pay the colorist who is diligently working to complete the project on time. Any other moneys raised will go to the original creative team and possibly help start funding the next project.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the third project we are funding through Kickstarter, and the first two were both successfully funded and delivered. The Project is currently 97% complete, all that’s left is the coloring and that process is currently 40% complete, we expect the book to be completed by the end of this campaign.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello,
Just dropping this update to let you know that the Deep Space Tragedy: Black Light Free Fall Collectors Boxed Set is funding right now on Kickstarter. Deep Space Tragedy is the story of a teenage robot rock band on the run! On tour, the band travels to the planet Cog where they quickly become embroiled in a battle for freedom. But can they rock hard enough to save the day? Will they have to make the ultimate sacrifice to bring freedom to the galaxy? Find out in this epic tale told across four issues by writer/artist Mike Wagganer!

Hello,
I just wanted to let everyone know that the From Blood: The Complete Series Kickstarter ends TONIGHT at 10:00 PM (eastern) but there is still time to back this project and claim some great rewards including digital comics, the entire series printed, original production artwork and so much more.

If you missed your chance to support From Blood on Kickstarter, now is the time! The final chapter is ready, and the full series will be available for the FIRST TIME in full color. You will be able to get From Blood: The Complete Series, the entire story of Patient 27 in three chapters. This epic final From Blood Kickstarter launches Tuesday May 12th, 2020, we hope that you will join us for the complete From Blood saga.
CLICK HERE TO GET A REMINDER AT LAUNCH

updates.update_userinfo: You can still get From Blood!
updates.update_content: Hello,

Greetings,
We are closing in on the final hours of the From Blood: Chapter One Kickstarter … as a reminder if you backed the previous From Blood graphic novel campaign … your pledge did NOT automatically transfer to the new Kickstarter. Those old pledges were all canceled when that campaign was terminated. Just wanted to put that out there in case some folks thought that it was automatically transferred. I don’t want you to miss out this time around.

Greetings,
I told you it was gonna happen on December 1st and at 12:01 AM ... the From Blood Chapter One Kickstarter went live!
CLICK HERE TO CHECK IT OUT!
As a backer of our previously canceled graphic novel Kickstarter … this new campaign just might interest you. We have taken the book and broken it into three separate chapters to make the project more appealing and affordable to potential backers. Most of the same tiers from the original have been mirrored over to the new campaign. If you wanted some original production art … that is available. If you wanted a Zach Bassett custom sketch, that’s over there as well only now it will be on a limited From Blood sketch cover … pretty cool. The foil and Kickstarter exclusive covers are there as well.

updates.update_userinfo: So Now We’ve Come to the End of the Road …
updates.update_content: This Kickstarter was not as successful as I had hoped for, though we came close … the prize was not meant to be ours. we did have over 70 backers and I am grateful for each and every one of them. However this is not the end of From Blood … we will be breaking the graphic novel into three separate acts or chapters in the form of single issues. The first 32 page issue is scheduled to begin funding on December 1st through Kickstarter. It will be a lower goal with lower priced tiers to hopefully bring back our previous backers and maybe find some new ones. We will notify everyone when the project launches through an update on this campaign as well as through our various social media channels. It will be a fast Kickstarter, only 15 days … we hope to be able to get several of the rewards delivered before the holidays, but that all depends upon the speed of the printer. Either way, thank you for your support thus far and I hope everyone will continue with us on this journey come December 1st.

updates.update_userinfo: We’ll get by with a little help from our friends …
updates.update_content:
Happy Monday and Happy Veterans Day,
Taking a hard look at the From Blood Kickstarter and the way things are trending ... it looks like we might be taking things down to the wire. But we are fortunate enough to have some great friends who have stepped up to help us reach our goals. Recently we passed a "benchmark goal" of 50 backers and with that goal we added a special digital bonus comic The Dusk County Chronicles issue 1 from our friend Joel Rodriguez, meaning that all of the backers who will receive a reward (digital or physical) will receive the PDF of that incredible horror comic.

updates.update_userinfo: Back from Daytona and Back to the Grind
updates.update_content:
We are back from the Daytona Beach Comic Book Convention, it was an incredible experience. We made some new friends and reconnected with some old ones. We picked up a few backers while we were away, but we still need more, if we are to make our goal.
In our last update we added a new benchmark goal of 50 backers, if we reach 50 backers then all of those backers (who pledged $6.00 or more) will receive a BONUS digital comic - The Dusk County Chronicles #1 from Metal Ninja Studios. We currently are just SIX backers away from reaching that benchmark and we could sure use help getting there. We believe in this project and we are confident that we will reach all of our goals big or small, so please back this project if you haven’t already and please share it with your friends and followers on social media.

updates.update_content:
We are entering the final hours of the SAVAGE SASQUANAUT issues 1-5 campaign, it ends TOMORROW NIGHT, Friday April 30th at 10PM Central! So if you haven't made your pledge yet now is the time to do it.  All issues are available in case there are any issues or covers you missed, so don't hesitate to order the ones you need for your collection.

We're only a couple backers away from passing the most backers I've ever had on a campaign, it would be fantastic to make it the best funded campaign as well.

Thanks to all of the backers on the campaign, the the next stretch goal has been UNLOCKED, so everyone with a physical reward tier will receive an all new Sasquanaut sticker absolutely free!

updates.update_userinfo: Issue 5 has 11 days and counting, Stretch goals, and podcast
updates.update_content:
Good morning. I hope you had a terrific weekend!  The Savage Sasquanaut issue 5 campaign has 11 days remaining.
This morning I've received the latest round of letters from McLain to review and make any last minute changes to.  Getting these final edits done will allow me to send issue 5 to print as soon as the funds from Kickstarter are transferred about 2 weeks after the campaign ends.

Stretch Goals Announcement

That's right, my friends, Sasquanaut is coming back at ya on Kickstarter for the rest of April. Go snatch yourself a copy, or four, and maybe pick up one of the awesome t-shirts I'm offering this time.  Have a great week.
ISSUE 5 CAMPAIGN HERE

Last night's interview on PopXP went well I believe.  I had fun, and Russ Leach's project ONLY DEATH CAN SAVE US looks pretty rad.

But the point of this update is to announce the newest addition to the FUNDLE BUNDLE.  My friend, the great Billy Tucci, is offering up the digital pdf of his latest graphic novel SHI: RETURN OF THE WARRIOR!

updates.update_userinfo: PopXP Interview and the FUNDLE BUNDLE
updates.update_content: Tonight I was scheduled to appear on PopXP YouTube channel (formerly Crowdfunding Comics) to discuss all things Sasquanaut with my buddy Billy Tucci and Nile Scala who host the show.  This has been rescheduled until tomorrow night!

updates.update_userinfo: Forgot to mention that issue 4 campaign is now LIVE!
updates.update_content:
A friend pointed out that I did not put an update on here that the latest issue of SAVAGE SASQUANAUT is indeed live, and at this point has raised over half the goal.
Many of you have already found the new campaign and backed it, thank you so much, and for those who have not been able to make your way over, here's the link to the campaign.
SAVAGE SASQUANAUT ISSUE 4

updates.update_userinfo: Savage Sasquanaut issue 4 goes live next week on September 21st!
updates.update_content:
CLICK HERE TO GET NOTIFIED INSTANTLY WHEN THE CAMPAIGN LAUNCHES
Next week on SEPTEMBER 21st the latest campaign for SAVAGE SASQUANAUT issue 4 will launch on Kickstarter!

updates.update_userinfo: 80% funded and a new original art tier
updates.update_content:
Hi!
Hope you had a terrific weekend, other than minding the Kickstarter and chasing the rugrat it was pretty quiet for us fortunately.
As of this update we are currently sitting at just a couple dollars short of 80% of the goal. I would absolutely LOVE to hit our goal by the end of the week (or dare I hope sooner)!

updates.update_userinfo: Issue #3 Campaign is Live and on it's way to hitting the goal!
updates.update_content:
Good morning!
I hope this update finds you well and having a fantastic week!
You read the headline right!  The 3rd issue of the legendary Bigfoot's adventures in space just went live a few moments ago and is already gaining ground to hitting the goal!
ISSUE 3 CAMPAIGN CLICK HERE

Happy anniversary and May the 4th be with you!
One year ago today, Savage Sasquanaut issue 1 was successfully funded!  Being that it's the anniversary I wanted to once more take a moment to say THANK YOU for your incredible support!  This would not be possible without you!
Currently we are closing in on the launch of the issue 3 campaign on Tuesday MAY 26th, so please mark your calendars once again as I present to you the halfway point of the first volume of Savage Sasquanaut. I'm immensely proud of this series, and absolutely cannot wait to get the latter half of the series into your hands.  There is some truly great work by Gab Santos on art, and some pretty big thrills if I do say so myself.

project_data.project_name: SAVAGE SASQUANAUT Issue 1 & 2: Bigfoot's adventures in space

campaign.story:
Sentinel is an ongoing science fiction series released in individual 24-page (min) issues. It's a full-color, standard-size (6.625" x 10.25") floppy comic.  The first issue had 20 pages of story. Issue 2 and beyond will have 22 pages of story.
For this campaign, you'll be helping to fund the production of the artwork and first print run for Issue 2. Issue 1 is already complete. 
It's set in a world similar to Roddenberry's Star Trek, but this ain't your granddaddy's Trek. There's action and adventure, set in a complex and realistic universe, with a three-dimensional characters who are solving mysteries while trying to uphold democracy and preserve peace in our small corner of the Milky Way. 
You can expect a mix of salty humor, West Wing-esque debates, fast-paced adventure and confrontations with deadly enemies. The world is built out with diverse cultures and a rich history, but more than anything, it's the characters who will hook you in. They're so much fun to write — even I want to see what happens next.  
There are depictions of graphic violence and a few naughty words. No nudity. Recommended for ages 16 and older.
If you're just joining us, you can catch up easily by backing at a level that includes a digital or physical copy of Issue 1. 
Things you will learn in Issue 2: Saras has a party trick.  The enemy will be revealed. You'll get to know a bit more of the world, and more of the main characters will be introduced.
Our story follows the crew of an insignificant fleet ship called the OAA Redstone, crewed by misfits in the space-based society known as the Orion Arm Authority, which has been at war with a savage alien superpower called the Ajex Imperium for nearly 30 years.  
A jaded reporter (also an alien refugee trying to earn her Orion citizenship) named Saras Vedi gets embedded on the Redstone after an attack sets in motion an investigation into a new threat to the space-faring republic. 
Over time, she learns the ship is crewed by members of marginalized alien species trying to earn their Orion citizenship, not unlike herself. Reluctant to take the assignment at first, she soon learns the uniqueness of the ship’s crew is its greatest strength. 
Meanwhile, the crew tries to figure out the origins of a mysterious human child. And looming in deep space is a legendary danger that could threaten to destroy both Orion and the Ajex.
Issue 2 picks up right where the first issue left off, and continues the first six-issue arc "All Roads." 
Saras fights to protect those who can't protect themselves, and a new enemy is revealed. Readers will also be introduced to new characters who serve aboard the Redstone.
BACK EARLY: Backers who pledge within the first 48 hours will receive an exclusive patch! 
Here are the first few pages of Issue 1.  
I'm Ryan Lessard, the creator and writer of the series. A longtime resident of Manchester, New Hampshire (shout out to my home store Double Midnight Comics!), I've been a local reporter for several years, and one time I got an award for investigative journalism. This is my first comic book. So far, I've written the first six-issue arc and I have outlined the next two arcs as well. And that's just the beginning! There are lots of surprises coming and I'm excited to share them with you. 
Jethro Morales is the penciler and inker. He's a professional artist who has done work for major Dynamite titles and several other indie projects. He also has the voice of an angel. Check out some of his work at jetzun.deviantart.com. He lives in Manila, Philippines
Dash Martin is the colorist and a fantastic artist in his own right, having worked on several titles including some work for Marvel. You can check out his work at dashmartin.com. He partners often with Chris Campana (who is making the variant cover for SENTINEL #2) on books like First World, The Adventures of Parker Reef and Campana's latest book Chosen, which has a  Kickstarter here. Dash lives in Tallahassee, Florida.
Adam Wollet is the letterer.  A writer as well,  Adam is the co-creator of Kingdom Bum (Action Lab), and his lettering work can be found in books from Image Comics, Heavy Metal Magazine, Action Lab Entertainment, and others. Adam is from Jacksonville, Florida.  
Some more pages from Issue 1.
If you want to follow the SENTINEL series as it comes to life, please show your support by backing this campaign and sharing it with your friends!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any delays are likely to be due to unforeseen complications with the production or printing process or the timely delivery of reward merchandise. 
These potential challenges would only result in delays and would not affect the ultimate delivery of rewards if fully funded.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello friends,
We are in the final stretch to get the third issue of SENTINEL funded! 
With only 15 hours left, we still need to raise a little less than $1,700.
If you haven't backed it yet, this is your last chance. If you have, please share the link with your friends.

Hello everyone!
If you're seeing this, it's because you backed a previous campaign for SENTINEL. If you've already backed SENTINEL #3, thank you so much! (Don't forget to share it with friends and help spread the word!).
If you haven't yet, this is the last week of the campaign! So don't miss this opportunity. The campaign ends on May 10.

updates.update_userinfo: New Art Collector reward (Ed Smith 1) unlocked!
updates.update_content:
Hello folks!
The second Art Collector reward is now live!
Today we are featuring an original pinup by artist Ed Smith, which appeared (with colors by Dash Martin) in the back pages of SENTINEL #2!
Only one lucky backer will be able to get their hands on this work for the discounted price of $190. Don't miss this opportunity!

Hello folks!
I'm very excited to announce the first of many original pinup art rewards is now live!
The tier is called "Art Collector" and today we are featuring an original pinup by artist Chris Vance, which appeared (with colors by Dash Martin) in the back pages of SENTINEL #2!
Only one lucky backer will be able to get their hands on this work for the discounted price of $190. Don't miss this opportunity!

updates.update_userinfo: Last chance to get First 48 Patch!
updates.update_content:
Hi folks!
So many of you have already turned out for the first day of the SENTINEL #3 campaign that launched yesterday. Thank you!
If you haven't backed it yet, you have a little less than 24 hours left to qualify for the rare First 48 Patch. Only the backers who pledge a physical tier within the first 48 hours of the campaign will get the special patch in their package. So don't wait!

Hi friends!
The Kickstarter for the 3rd issue of SENTINEL is now live!
Check it out here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/ryanlessard/sentinel-3-the-ship-is-leaving-the-station
The first 48-hour backers will get a "First 48" patch on top of the regular rewards.

Hello good people,
I am pleased to announce that, save for a handful of international orders, everyone's books have been mailed out. Hopefully you all get yours soon. 
When you do, I'd love to hear from you. You can post pictures and selfies on Instagram and tag me at @rlessa00 or use the hashtag #sentinelcomic. And after you read it, let me know if you enjoyed it.

Great news: I've just sent the digital rewards to all of you who qualify. Please check your email inbox (including spam folder) for a message from OrionNewsService@gmail.com. 

You should have a link to both Sentinel #1 and Sentinel #2 PDFs on Google Drive. Send me a direct message and let me know if you encounter any technical difficulties.

Hey everyone!
Great news: The comics are printed and have been shipped to me. Now I just need to package everything and send it to you guys, which I will get started on right away.
If you need to update your address, go ahead and do that now. And if you still haven't filled out your survey, please do that like yesterday.

Hey everyone,
I just sent out a newsletter, in which I yell the word "SURVEYS!" repeatedly like a madman, unveil a new shiny variant cover -- Oooooh, Aaaaah -- and blather on needlessly about the copious media I've been consuming lately.
Check your junk folders for this latest dispatch, or just click that fancy link up there... also, right here. Magic!

campaign.story:
FROM THE ENCYCLOPEDIA OF SUPER-VILLAINY:
A PLOT SO SINISTER:
Kid Nefarious is a central character in the Gladstone’s School for World Conquerors Universe. Over the next year we have six Gladstone’s School for World Conquerors one-shots planned by guest creative teams. If these are successful, then we expect to do more. 
The Gladstone’s one-shots are going to be printed in the United States which will give us a faster turnaround and delivery time.  While the Hardcover books from China are beautiful, the wait from printing overseas has been holding us up.
We need to get Gladstone’s out more regularly to our audience.
Once the first round of one-shots are printed, our strategy will be to hire more popular creative teams that already have a built-in audience to draw attention to our series and to build up our readership numbers. 
If you are new to the Gladstone’s School for World Conquerors Universe you can sign up for our mailing list and download a digital copy of our first 200 page graphic novel titled ‘Super-Villainy 101. 
The Kid Nefarious One-Shot is 32 pages and is written by Ryan Schrodt, illustrated by Matthew Weldon, colored by Rodrigo Aviles and lettered by Patrick Brosseau. The book is finished and ready to go to the printer. 
KID NEFARIOUS ONE-SHOT DESCRIPTION:
After a failed test, Kid Nefarious is threatened with expulsion and given a second chance from Headmaster Ironsides.
Kid Nefarious must now embark on a wondrous quest he never signed up for...
As a Superhero and the protector of the halcyon city of Sunnybrook. 
KID NEFARIOUS ONE-SHOT PREVIEW PAGES:
REWARD ITEMS TO GET NOW:
Kid Nefarious One-Shot
Gladstone's School for World Conquerors Volume 1 Hardcover
Gladstone's School for World Conquerors Volume 2 Hardcover
Gladstone's School for World Conquerors Book 3 Hardcover
Gladstone's School for World Conquerors 3 Book Set (Slipcase availability limited only while supplies last).
THE THREE BOOK SET:
About Gladstone's School for World Conquerors:
Gladstone’s School for World Conquerors is a Young Adult Graphic Novel series by Armand Villavert & Mark Smith about a top-secret academy for the children of the world's greatest Super Villains to learn their trade.
Ever wondered if Super Villains go to school? Ah, you assumed they were born with their special skills. Think again, in Gladstone’s School for World Conquerors we find ourselves amidst the pinnacle of higher learning for the next generation of villains and masterminds honing their craft.
The school curriculum includes the usual suspects of “public speaking” and “biology and chemistry,” and yet that’s only superficial child’s play. Classes like “unleash your hypnotic potential”, “intergalactic battle strategy”, and “ancient relics, spells & mystical arts” are added stressors for straight-A students like Kid Nefarious and Mummy Girl.
Mock battles are unleashed to test their skills with the latest tools of the trade such as “orbs of tranquility” or “grim reaper’s breath.”
Join Kid Nefarious, Mummy Girl, Martian Jones, The Speed Spectre, Ghost Girl, Man O' War, and the infamous Skull brothers unearth the School's and their parent's hidden past.
Praise for Gladstone's:
"Mark Andrew Smith and Armand Villavert’s tween superhero ongoing stood out as the kind of title Marvel or DC wish they had, but would never be possible at the Big Two. A superhero dramedy set at a school for aspiring supervillains, the series is founded on the concept that the ongoing war between heroes and villains is faked, putting a new spin on the parent-as-supervillain metaphor.
The students are waking up to the reality of their world, and the reader discovers with them, learning the dense mythology of Smith’s story while experiencing the thrill of Villavert’s kinetic artwork. Best of all, Gladstone’s is a title appropriate for all readers, with characters that look and sound like kids, but a plot that any superhero fan can appreciate." - AV CLUB
"Mark Andrew Smith’s tween-supervillain team is similar to the Runaways in that each member is pulled from a different corner of the superhero genre: a mummy, ghost, alien, etc. Smith’s story puts a new spin on the super-school concept that has already been tried in films like Sky High and Zoom. Armand Villavert’s sleek artwork would translate well to computer animation, and Smith’s clearly defined yet whimsical cast makes Gladstone’s a great fit for a studio like Pixar. The chance of a creator-owned superhero team launching a big-budget animated feature is slim, but if The Walking Dead can become the highest-rated show on cable, there’s always hope." - AV CLUB
More Praise for Gladstone's:
Smith’s writing is fast-paced and warm, his characters rich enough to resonate with all ages of reader, and the character design and outsider edge of surreality recalls Peter Milligan‘s X-Statix, and likewise Villavert’s pen explores the same subverted pop-art style of Mike Allred, albeit with the stylised touch of a Saturday morning cartoon." - Sci Fi Now
And even more Praise for Gladstone's: 
"We've been championing Gladstone's by Mark Andrew Smith and Armand Villavert since issue #1, but the last couple of issues have seen the series hit an early stride. In this installment, Smith plays with an enticingly fun and interesting take on superhero comics, challenging the notion of a hero's constant victory of his nemesis and how that would affect a child that is being educated in the ways of villainy.
Watching Kid Nefarious and friends discover their parents losing over and over again in the pages of comic books (which are banned from Gladstone's, for these obvious reasons) is amazing. Gladstone's never talks down to kids and remains all-ages accessible. Better yet, they just might learn something about the tropes of superhero comics in the process.
Gladstone's continues to impress, so if you've been neglecting this series for some oddball reason, it's time to stop doing so. You're missing out, and everyone's going to make fun of you for it." - IGN

campaign.story:
UPDATE! STRETCH GOAL STICKERS ADDED! See more in Update #8!
Heard about Mad? Sad? Don't be! Get GLAD with this new two volume collection of rarely seen art by two of their greatest illustrators done outside their work at Mad magazine. The books are a treasure trove of rare humor comics mostly unseen for over 30 years from the pages of Mad's #1 competitor, Cracked magazine. They are curated by two folks with Cracked bona fides, Mark Arnold, author of the definitive two volume history of the magazine If You're Cracked, You're Happy!, and Mort Todd, the former Editor-in-Chief of the magazine during one of its most creative periods.
The comics presented are from the 1950s and 1960s during the title's early years and while John Severin and Jack Davis were at the top of their game as creators. There are TV and movie parodies, tons of celebrities, along with satire on current events, trends and culture of the era.
Mark Arnold provides an informative introduction to The Comedy of John Severin and comics historian Bhob Stewart, author of The Life and Legend of Wallace Wood, has an in-depth overview of the career of the artist in The Comedy of Jack Davis. Both books feature an afterword by Mort Todd reflecting on Severin, Davis and the magazine's legacy. The Comedy of John Severin is a 108 page volume and The Comedy of Jack Davis is 104 pages, all in glorious vintage black & white!
The books feature a gorgeous array of their work, showcasing the many mediums they work in, from pen and ink, wash, guoache, duoshade paper, zipatone and color paintings as they applied it to tweaking a variety of amusing topics.
REWARDS
To help supplement publishing and distribution of these volumes (available in print and digital), other rewards are offered to those who support this project. They include prints, post cards, T-shirts, signed copies of Mark Arnold's two volumes of If You're Cracked, You're Happy!, and, what might be the most desired collectible of the true fan, a painter's cap just like the magazine's mascot, Sylvester P. Smythe wears, complete with the 1950s title logo.
T-Shirts!
The Sensational Sylvester Painter's Cap!

updates.update_content: We really appreciate your contributing to The Comedy of John Severin and Jack Davis Kickstarter! Let us know if you haven't received your notifications for digital copies! Thanks!

updates.update_userinfo: Digital Copies now available to the public!
updates.update_content: If you missed out on getting advance limited edition copies of The Comedy of John Severin & Jack Davis, the digital books are now available to the public at http://morttodd.com/comedy.html! Limited Edition print editions are still being mailed and will be available to the public soon!

We're mailing out all the rewards during the month of October. As there are 111 backers, this will take some time. We mailed out to 30 backers last week and 30 yesterday, so we're getting there. The people who are receiving hats will be the last ones to be mailed out, so please be patient.
All the printed and manufactured rewards are coming in and will be sent out soon, folks!

We'll soon be shipping the books, stickers and other rewards, but we're still waiting for mailing information from a few of you! Please check the surveys sent out for you to fill out so we can commence the fun!
Much like this unfinished portrait of Bardot by John Severin, our project will be unfinished until we hear from you! Thanks to all who did promptly respond!

Thanks to all of you from all of us for making The Comedy of John Severin & Jack Davis Kickstarter a success and for meeting the stretch goal! To paraphrase Oprah, "You get stickers and you get stickers and YOU get stickers!" Digital rewards will be sent out in a couple weeks as the books and other rewards are being manufactured. Thanks again!

Only have until 5 PM EDT today (Aug 5) to reach the stretch goal so everyone gets free stickers! As of the moment it only $245 left to get to ultimate stickeryness, so let your friends who like funny stuff know! Thanks to everyone for participating and helping out!

Cracked would do some wacky movie parodies that Mad wouldn't touch, until their several editors checked box office scores. Cracked ran by the seat of its pants, doing satires of movies they liked, including this one with Toshiro Mifune and Lee Marvin called Hell in the Pacific. It had some animated John Severin art and you'll find it in The Comedy of John Severin!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Thanks to everyone who is considering supporting DRAWING BLOOD VOLUME 2.

The script for the graphic novel is more than 3/4 completed, the art team and I are designing characters and Ben has already started drawing DRAWING BLOOD, as you'll see in the video, and all over this campaign.

If we can get fully funded, we have every expectation that we can get the book done on schedule and get your perks on the way as promised. Naturally, there is always the possibility of getting slowed down by the unforeseen: someone might get the flu, we might find ourselves having to change printers, etc. Whatever happens, we will strive to honor any and all commitments to our supporters. The graphic novel/trade paperback won't be ready until 2020, but our supporters will get the first chapter, the equivalent of a 22 page comic, by digital delivery September 2019.

I started out in independent publishing, making comics out of my living room and getting them directly to the readers, and it feels good to be back. We're all very passionate about this project, about telling this story of Shane Bookman, and your help means the world to us. Aside from contributing, anything you can do to help us spread the word on social media – posting on Facebook, Tweeting, and reaching out to like-minded collectors will help us make this project a reality.

In a lot of ways, for all its darkness, DRAWING BLOOD is a love-letter to a life in comics, and comics themselves. We can't wait for you to read VOLUME 2. We promise to keep you updated throughout the campaign, on Kickstarter, in update emails to our supporters, and through social media. And you can always check up on what's going on here: www.facebook.com/drawingbloodcomic or follow any of the team on Twitter.

Thanks for reading and thanks for your support! We couldn't do it without you, and we're so excited to bring you more DRAWING BLOOD!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Happy Holidays! We got you a little something...
updates.update_content:
Hey, all... just wanted to remind you that the combo package of Drawing Blood Vol.1 trade and the NEW RRRR Adventures 40 page special is still available for download for ONE MORE DAY! Try this link!
https://we.tl/t-cvAl1p6gze
To be clear: when Volume 2 is completed, you WILL be receiving the RRRR Adventures special in a print copy with your Volume 2 trade. This is just a little holiday present to tide you over...

Hey, gang! David Avallone here. Settle in. I've got a lot to tell you. 

Sorry for the long silence, and for the delays in getting you your comics. We appreciate your incredible patience with us.

I don’t want to turn this update into one long apology, but I also know that no one reading this update has had the 2020 they expected to have, and that goes for your DRAWING BLOOD team as well. We’ve all been through a lot, and it’s not quite over yet. On top of the plague, the effect it had on the comics’ industry, the election chaos… we keep getting served up extra heartaches. Just last week, Kevin’s friend and comics legend Richard Corben passed away. The hits keep on coming… and we’re all human here. This stuff slows us down and gets in our way, even as it breaks our hearts.

As you know, or have guessed, the Year of the Plague has cancelled all comic conventions, and that’s a big source of income, especially for artists. (People, sadly, have less interest in buying sketches from writers. Crazy, right?) Because of that, all of our plans for this year got scrambled and scrubbed… and as you might imagine, that had an impact on our schedules… and our finances.

So Drawing Blood has sometimes had to wait for a bit while we work on other things, to replace that lost income. At least some of the other stuff we’ve been working on is pretty awesome… more on that at the end of the update.

Sweeping all that tragedy aside… this is where we’re at right now. The Plague Year has thrown everything into chaos. But the work IS getting done.

I’ve wrapped up all the scripts for Drawing Blood: Volume Two, and Ben isn’t too far behind me. He’s done all the finals on Chapter 5, some on 6, and all the roughs on 7. I can’t wait for you to see it: you all know how talented Ben is, and for my money this is his very finest work yet.

Hey there DB backers!
Sorry for the radio silence for a bit - it's not because we don't love ya.
We've all been cranking away at Volume 2, as well as (per usual) a few other things. I'm very bad at math, but I'd say DBV2 is about 70% there. We're only waiting on a couple little things to finish off the digital issue 5 (the 1st of 4 issues making up V2) we had meant to send to all you backers long ago. So I'm hopeful that will be your way soon. Rest assured, we're taking great care to make sure this is the absolute best work we're capable of right now, and we wouldn't deliver you anything less.

Hello all! 
Ben Bishop here with a QUICK update! 
I know I speak for myself, David and Kevin when I say it was SO great seeing some of you at NYCC this past week! What a wild show! It meant the world to hear how excited you were for the next incredible installment of the Shane "Books" Bookman saga!
What an incredible incredible month it has been...

updates.update_userinfo: THINGS ARE GETTING EVEN MORE RADICAL...
updates.update_content:
Only $5,733 until every backer getting DRAWING BLOOD VOLUME 2 will also get Kevin Eastman's RRRR SKETCHBOOK for FREE!
So that's 2 FREE books on top of whatever you pledged! But only if we hit it!

What a morning! 
We're really catching some momentum in our LAST 19 HOURS as we keep cruising towards that final  stretch goal of $125K to unlock the FREE 45+ page RRRR SKETCHBOOK from Kevin Eastman!
Kevin thought you might want to get a closer look at WHAT exactly we're talking about unlocking for everyone...
Check it out below, straight from the man himself!

campaign.story:
The Haunted Cowboy is an all-new, original graphic novel centered around the murder of Wild Bill Hickok in Deadwood, Dakota Territory circa 1876.
Rusty Grainger is a 15-year old resident of Deadwood. He goes to school and works in the Livery with his Uncle Jim, the only family he has left since his mother's death several years earlier. Rusty has a crush on a local girl named Abigail and he is a target of bullies, due to his red hair and awkward ways. 
More than anything, the teenager idolizes Wild Bill Hickok and wants to follow in the famous gunman's footsteps, performing as a trick shot artist in traveling shows when he gets older. When Rusty meets his idol, Wild Bill takes an instant shine to the lad.
The next day, Wild Bill calls Rusty to the saloon to talk. Rusty arrives just in time to see Jack McCall gun down his hero. Overcome with grief, Rusty calls out the murderer in an effort to avenge his idol but fails miserably.
Later that day, the ghost of Wild Bill appears to Rusty to say how much he appreciated his attempt at taking out McCall. The spirit cowboy vows to teach Rusty how to be a gunslinger so they can finish what he started and take down McCall to get justice for his murder.
This 55-page western is written by Scott Young, penciled by Fernando Ruiz, inked by Kim DeMulder and features a cover by Tom Mandrake!  What more could you ask for!
All money pledged will go directly to production, printing, shipping and all assorted supplies to get the book from our imaginations into your hands! 
Pencils for the cover of The Haunted Cowboy Graphic Novel by Tom Mandrake!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All three creators of the Haunted Cowboy (Fernando, Kim and Scott) have run successful Kickstarter campaigns in the past so with our combined knowledge and experience, the risks should be minimal. The script is complete so Scott is available to respond to questions or help coordinate the campaign while Fernando and Kim are hard at work creating the pages. We should be at least half way done by the time the campaign ends. We've set a date far enough away to ensure the book is completed before it's been promised. Then it's simply a matter of getting it printed and shipped. 
With the 3 of us pitching in, it should be relatively painless.

I have every faith that this Kickstarter, and the 3 of us running it, will meet its challenges with grace and aplomb. You can believe in us! We're ya Huckleberrys!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Check out the finalized version of the incredible cover by Tom Mandrake!
It was just added to the campaign!
Thanks!

Just wanted to let everyone know that in the past week we've added two new pledge tiers!
The Bronco Buster level gets you a pen and ink portrait done by Kim DeMulder from any photo you supply (along with the Haunted Cowboy graphic novel)!
The Lone Star level gets you a full color "Archie-fied" portrait as Fernando Ruiz draws you as one of the Riverdale gang (along with the Haunted Cowboy graphic novel)!

Thanks to everyone who has contributed and helped spread the word.
After 2 weeks, we are at edging up on 20% funded and lagging behind but we have plenty of time to make a push! If you want to see this project come to fruition, we still need your help!
Keep sharing, liking and getting the word out. The Haunted Cowboy is alive!

campaign.story:
Savage Sasquanaut #1 Kickstarter Exclusive Paolo Pantalena Cover
Check out these sweet variants! Choose which covers you want to take home!
pronounced SAS-KWA-NOT
SAVAGE SASQUANAUT #1 (of 6) is a rocket fueled sci-fi action adventure comic about the  legendary bigfoot carving a path of chaos across the galaxy.  Join him as he high jacks a starship from the largest intergalactic super power, the Aurellian Empire, and that's after he organized a prison break with the outlandish new friends to escape the clutches of a maniacal Empress all in the hope to find a way back to Earth.
The entire series can be described as a mashup of STAR TREK and BUCK ROGERS starring Jack Burton from BIG TROUBLE IN LITTLE CHINA as bigfoot.  That's Sasquanaut in a very  broad nutshell.  
There is over the top action, stunning visuals, humor, intrigue, love and betrayal, everything a good book needs!
 ***Check out this FREE preview download of issue 1 right now! SAVAGE SASQUANAUT PREVIEW*** 
Check out the first 5 pages of issue 1
Stretch Goal 1 is unlocked! Every physical reward backer receives a mini-print postcard not included in the print set.

Bigfoot enthusiasts.
People who love Star Wars, Star Trek, Firefly, and Farscape.
Fans of Conan the Barbarian (especially if you ever wished he went into space).
Fans of action, humor, and stunning artwork!
Collectors of high quality independent comic books from a long time industry veteran and a phenomenal brand new talent.
 SS#1 contains 24 story pages (20% more than Marvel and DC)
All printed copies are in standard American comic size and printed on high-quality glossy paper.
All backers will also receive the Savage Sasquanaut #1 Digital PDF copy
SS#1 has 4 limited Variant Covers available.
There is also an extremely limited ARTIST EDITION where the entire issue will be printed in the original black and white line art (no coloring) for the true art aficionados. 
4"x 6" mini-prints/postcards
Higher pledge levels include collectible hard enamel pins
Cover A is the first of a 6 part collectible cover mega poster image
Issue 1 Cover A conjoins with issues 2-6 into a mega poster CLICK TO VIEW FULL POSTER
You want this don't you?
Limited 1.25 inch hard enamel pin and a DRM-free high resolution PDF of the issue
Own the story as artist Gab Santos drew it in glorious black and white line art with the exclusive ARTIST EDITION
Set of 5 mini-print postcards!
Get a digital coloring commission!
Do you have a comic you are working on and need someone to cover your cover?  Or maybe you just bought an amazing commission from your favorite artist and would like to have a one of a kind full color print made.  With the YOUR ART COLORED reward tier Wes Hartman (me) award winning colorist who has worked with everyone from Marvel and DC to Dark Horse and Aspen and beyond, on artists like Billy Tucci, Tyler Kirkham, Mark Silvestri, Dave Finch, Mike Zeck, Mark Bagley, Walt Simonson, and too many more to name! So many of the biggest and best artists have been colored professionally by me at some time by and YOU CAN BE TOO!  You provide a high resolution file to me that I will then work my magic on and send you back a ready to print full color image!  
An example of one of the covers being colored.
Check out the video below for a TIME LAPSE video of coloring a cover from the upcoming SAVAGE SASQUANAUT #2. 
PLAY

WES HARTMAN - Wes  is an award winning comic book colorist, and a small press comic book creator and editor and creator of the Sasquanaut comic. He has spent the last 15+ years working with the biggest and best talent at Marvel, DC, Dark Horse, Aspen, Dynamite, etc. and has had his work featured in TV, film, and video games.  Some of his previous creations and credits include Moon Streak, Sky Sharks, Gears & Bones, Pirates vs. Ninjas, and more.
GAB SANTOS -  John Gabriel Santos “Gabouwness” is an Illustrator and Character Concept Artist who was born and raised in Manila, Philippines.  Ever since he was a kid he loved to create his own little paper games. That is why when Digital Art was introduced to him in college he realized that he really wanted to pursue art as a career even though his degree is in Information Technology. Gab usually does character designs, cover illustrations, but sometimes he also does fan art, comics, and even card games.  He really loves to read comics, play classic video games like Pokemon, and card games like Magic the Gathering, Yu-Gi-Oh, Hearthstone and more. Those are his biggest influences.  He is fond of making robot designs and mechanical/sci-fi/fantasy/apocalyptic themed illustrations because he finds it cool to draw what the world would look like in the future. He said that art is what he loves to do and that is why he works hard to improve, not only for himself, for the people that love and support him every day. 
****UPDATE!  First full review of Savage Sasquanaut Issue 1 is available now from READING WITH A FLIGHT RING!  CHECK IT OUT HERE****
" This is a great new unique idea and it’s executed extremely well. I like the writing with the story & plot development, pacing and characterisation alongside this really killer comic style interiors. " ---Reading with a Flight Ring
Moon Streak is a title previously co-created / co-written by Wes
GEEKS WORLDWIDE FULL REVIEW
READING WITH A FLIGHT RING FULL REVIEW 1
READING WITH A FLIGHT RING FULL REVIEW 2
Milestones Unlocked and 100% Funding Met!
Click the link to sign up for the newsletter and stay current with all developments on your favorite sasquatch.
 Follow the link embedded in the image above to be part of the the newsletter for Wes Hartman and Savage Sasquanaut and stay up to date on any and all the latest developments in your new favorite series.  
Wes says:
"I stumbled across an EP of a band I had never heard of, with a picture of a gorilla in a space suit on the cover and the title of the record read Sasquanaut I did two things: I laughed my butt off and then started a search. I scoured the internet for month for a story, a comic, a novel, cartoon, game, ANYTHING about bigfoot in space because that idea excited me in a way like Star Wars and X-Men did for me as a kid. I needed to read, no to EXPERIENCE this story. But I couldn't find it anywhere and I was bummed about it. That is until I FINALLY realized (slower than I'd like to admit) that this was the comic I've been born to create! Somebody needs to tell the story of bigfoot in space. The ultimate outcast, hunted his whole life in the forests of Earth now finds himself lost in space, that's too rich of an idea to pass up. 
I've spent most of my youth growing up living in the worlds others have created because as a kid who often felt out of place, comics like the X-Men really resonated, Elric of Melnibone was transformative, Star Trek was this utopia where everyone belonged, and Star Wars was just cool.  Even with all the powers, costumes, strange worlds and settings the characters and emotions always struck a chord with me in ways non genre fiction never has and when I felt alone these stories helped me connect and understand that there were others out there like me. 
Now I think this zany tale of bigfoot lost in space can provide for others, as well as myself, an immense universe full of limitless potential for joy and exciting and fun stories like all those that I have always have and still enjoy."
What's a bigfoot article without tabloid style newspaper?
Because I wanted to star in a super awkward video! (sarcasm)
I am coming to Kickstarter to raise funds for a large print run of Savage Sasquanaut #1, at least 1,000 copies.
The first issue is 100% completed and ready to go to print, and to further prove how invested I am in Sasquanaut, the scripts were written and Gab has already completed penciling and inking issues 2-6. 
Kickstarter has proven to be an amazing venue for getting new creative ideas into as many hands as possible, and I would love your support to bring this story to life.
Cost Breakdown
Why participate in the Kickstarter, why not wait until it is in stores?
There are exclusive benefits available only to those who support this campaign, notably the Kickstarter exclusive Paolo Pantalena variant cover and the sweet hard enamel pin.  
While 1,000 copies sounds like a lot, it's pretty small, and with Kickstarter pre-orders and convention appearances it will sell out!  I also cannot promise that the book will be in a store near you and pre-ordering here through Kickstarter is the best way to absolutely guarantee you will receive your copy.
What happens if you exceed your goal?
If more funds are raised than requested first things first I will use extra money to make this issue and rewards even better with the planned stretch goals like increasing the page count to include the origin story of Sasquanaut drawn by international superstar artist Tyler Kirkham.  
***Check out this FREE preview of issue 1 right now! SAVAGE SASQUANAUT PREVIEW***

First things first. THANK YOU!  Thank you for checking out my project.  You being here and showing interest in something that I have spent several years trying to put together and out into the world means the world to me.  You all are making my dreams come true supporting this work and I cannot express how much this means.
This is the FIRST of many more projects to come!  We are in an amazing new golden age for independent and self published comics, and it is all driven by  wonderful people like you who support passion projects, like this one, even though you may never have heard of it or of us creators.  Again thank you.
Volume 1 of Savage Sasquanaut is 6 issues long. This is just the first issue, artwork is already completed for issues 2-5 and with your supporting this project, these issues will come out one way or another.   I aim to use this project an Kickstarter as the foundation for taking control of and focusing my creative energies into my own projects and dreams and as much freelancing to make other people's dreams come true.  This is happening because of you, thank you.   
If you have not already, PLEASE review the different reward packages and SELECT which one you would like to purchase and complete your pre-order for the best new sci-fi hero you've never heard of.
AND PLEASE SHARE THIS PROJECT WITH ALL YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY!
One of the potential stretch goals is including in the issue the Sasquanaut origin story drawn by superstar artist TYLER KIRKHAM
 After we hit our initial funding goal of $5500, I have started planning a few follow up stretch goals that can be unlocked, one of them is adding in this 3 page origin story that Tyler Kirkham (Spider-Man, Action Comics, Deathstroke, and more).
At $6,000 funding every physical reward will include this extra mini-print postcard!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
SAVAGE SASQUANAUT #1 (Wes Hartman - My First Kickstarter Campaign)

Before launching this campaign I have made every effort to minimize any risk to the backer as I know, as a Kickstarter supporter myself, what it means to ask you to support a new project with your hard earned money.

Part of this effort was to make sure that the first issue is 100% completed, and to emphasize how serious this is, all line art for the remaining 5 issues has also been completed by Gab Santos. 

When the campaign successfully ends, with your help, the files can be loaded to the printer when the funding comes in, digital rewards can be sent upon receiving completed surveys, and coloring and lettering can continue on all subsequent issues.

I have been in touch with several printers and have chosen to use Color Vision for the first issue upon the campaigns completion.

I have assisted and been associated with other Kickstarter campaigns before, but this is my first campaign that I am running and I have made every effort to learn and prepare myself for this endeavor from discussing and surrounding myself with peers who have been successful in running campaigns as well as attending The ComixLaunch Course for creating successful Kickstarter campaigns.

I love this book and I want everyone who takes part of this campaign to love this book as much as I and have a completely satisfied experience on Kickstarter with me and Gab, so as soon as issue 2 is completed we can offer it to you as well.

If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to message me and I will do my absolute best to make this project as rewarding as possible.

Thank you for your time and your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
That's right, we are entering into the last weekend of the Sasquanaut issues 1-4 campaign as it will end Monday night.  If you haven't jumped on the latest campaign yet, time is running out to pledge on Kickstarter.
Sasquanaut 1-4 Campaign is HERE 

We are almost at 200 backers, 211 backers is the most I've ever had on a campaign and I would love to break that number this go round.

Last night's interview on PopXP went well I believe.  I had fun, and Russ Leach's project ONLY DEATH CAN SAVE US looks pretty rad.

But the point of this update is to announce the newest addition to the FUNDLE BUNDLE.  My friend, the great Billy Tucci, is offering up the digital pdf of his latest graphic novel SHI: RETURN OF THE WARRIOR!

Tonight I was scheduled to appear on PopXP YouTube channel (formerly Crowdfunding Comics) to discuss all things Sasquanaut with my buddy Billy Tucci and Nile Scala who host the show.  This has been rescheduled until tomorrow night!

campaign.story:
HI, I'M BEN BISHOP.
You may know me from the original AGGREGATE Kickstarter campaign back in 2015, or DRAWING BLOOD with Kevin Eastman, or my book, NATHAN THE CAVEMAN, or my work on the TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES, or maybe you don’t know me at all!
I came to Kickstarter in 2015 with a dream to once again get back to writing and drawing stories that were all my own, and you all showed me with your support that you wanted that too. The amazing part was, because of Kickstarter and the crowdfunding structure, so many of you helped shape what the story actually became, lots of you, and your CATS, were actually IN the book. I didn’t want to just make my comics alone... 
I wanted to make them with all of you. ♥
With your support, through Kickstarter pre-order pledges and social media shares, I’ll be able to once again, hunker down to draw, print, self-publish and ship out this epic 200 plus page sequel, THE AGGREGATE BOOK 2. 
Check out all the awesome rewards and ways that you can not only get the book, but be a part of it, by being one of the very first to help make THE AGGREGATE BOOK 2 a reality.
Here are some of my favorite...
 See all the guest artist originals and prints HERE.
I’ll never be able to adequately thank you all enough for once again helping me to tell this story, but I CAN use your enthusiasm, and support to make the best damn book I’m capable of and deliver it directly to you, the ones who showed up to the party early and made the whole thing possible.
To add...
◊ AGGREGATE ISSUE #0  --- Increase pledge by $10 USA / $20 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
◊ AGGREGATE BOOK 1 --- Increase pledge by $25 USA / $45 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
◊ ISSUE #0 & BOOK 1 DIGITAL PDFS --- Increase pledge by $10 EVERYWHERE.
◊ ADDITIONAL AGGREGATE BOOK 2 --- Increase pledge by $25 USA / $45 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
◊ AGGREGATE BOOK 2  CHRIS JOHNSON COVER --- Increase pledge by $40 USA / $60 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
◊ AGGREGATE BOOK 2 MATEUS SANTOLOUCO COVER --- Increase pledge by $40 USA / $60 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
◊ AGGREGATE BOOK 2 KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE COVER --- Increase pledge by $50 USA / $70 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
◊ ANY PRINT --- Increase pledge by $10 USA / $20 EVERYWHERE ELSE PER PRINT.
◊ A SHIRT --- Increase pledge by $30 USA / $40 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
◊ A PUZZLE --- Increase pledge by $50 USA / $60 EVERYWHERE ELSE PER PUZZLE.
◊ A MINI FIGURE --- Increase pledge by $90 EVERYWHERE.
◊ MP3 SOUNDTRACK --- Increase pledge by $10 EVERYWHERE.
◊ KEVIN EASTMAN METAL PRINT --- Increase pledge by $20 USA / $40 EVERYWHERE ELSE.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is technically my 4th Kickstarter, my 1st being THE AGGREGATE, my 2nd, (although it wasn’t under my name) DRAWING BLOOD, and my 3rd, NATHAN THE CAVEMAN. I am very responsive to messages, comments and questions and will make myself available to answer any concerns whenever they arise.
 
DEADLINE: 
I believe I’ve given myself a realistic amount of time to draw over 200 pages, hire a colorist, put the book together, print, and ship the book and all rewards. I greatly underestimated the budget and timeline on THE AGGREGATE BOOK 1, but still found a way to bring it to life. With BOOK 2 I’m being careful to not do that again, and to be realistic with the time and money these books take to make. That being said, sometimes unexpected things happen, and I am very appreciative of backers that understand those situations. I was lucky to have had zero complaints from AGGREGATE BOOK 1 supporters, as they understood I was working on the book every single day. I promise to NEVER leave anyone in the dark as to what’s going on with the progress of the project. If something comes up, you will be well in the loop. This estimated deadline of March 2021, of course doesn’t factor in the addition of any possible unlocked stretch goals like added pages, variant covers, or AGGREGATE APPENDAGES, which of course could potentially extend the workload.
 
PRINTING: 
Over the last several years, I’ve developed a great relationship with an amazing printer right here in the USA, who I’ve used many times now, with a mind blowing quick turnaround. Once the book is completed, I have no doubts about the quality of the printed final product.
 
SHIPPING: 
Shipping is going up every single day in different areas, and the rules are always changing. I’ll be shipping books media mail when possible to keep the domestic prices as low as possible. Unfortunately media mail is not an option for international packages. Here is the cold hard (sad) truth. A single copy of this book will weigh at least 2 lbs. The minimum cost for a single book to go first class outside the USA is $23, 2 books is $48, and 3 books is now priority at $68! So my shipping costs are real. I lost a lot on previous campaigns by underestimating shipping costs and am trying really hard not to do that again. I want to make the book available to all you international supporters though, so the option is available for almost every reward tier, but I felt I needed to let you know that the high shipping costs are the actual prices.
 
Please feel free to reach out to me with any questions you may have. I take crowdfunding very seriously and would never risk ruining my reputation on a project I didn’t believe in or didn’t 100% think was possible to fulfill. 
 
Thank you for being a part of THE AGGREGATE BOOK 2 and making it possible for self publishing creators like me to JUST MAKE COMICS and deliver them direct to the readers with a platform like Kickstarter.
 
-Ben Bishop
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
