updates.update_userinfo: Will you Choose to become the HERO?!! Gladstone's School for World Conquerors has 1 Day LEFT!!!
updates.update_content:
Hello Hero in training,

The Gladstone's School for World Conquerors Double Features has one day remaining on Kickstarter to push through and to reach the finish line. We are currently at 75% of our fundraising goal and we need your help!

This is your chance to become a hero today by pledging to support a series about a top-secret Super-villain academy so we can tell more stories in the Gladstone's universe.

Pledge now to get it before time runs out. The clock is ticking, will you answer this call to adventure?!

updates.update_userinfo: Just one week remaining for the Gladstone's School for World Conquerors Double Features!!! Gladstone's is counting on your support!!!
updates.update_content:
We've been working diligently on Gladstone's School for World Conquerors Double Features this past year. Gladstones is the story of a top-secret academy for the children of the worlds greatest super-villains. We have been working on this project since 2009.
Recently we opened up the Gladstones Universe for other creators to play and the result is this super fun series of one-shots featuring the main characters of Gladstones.
**Can we count on your pledge?**

updates.update_userinfo: An announcement from Gladstone's Super-villain Academy: Gladstone's Double Features
updates.update_content:
This is the creative team here at Gladstone's super-villain academy.

We are excited to announce that our Kickstarter for the Gladstone's double features is now officially live.

What are the Gladstone's Double Features?

We have invited various guest creative teams to work in the Gladstone's School for World Conquerors Universe.

The one-shots feature the Skull Brothers, Martian Jones, Ghost Girl and Mummy Girl and you can pick them up here: 

-Headmaster's Smith and Villavert

Merry Christmas and happy Hanukkah. We at Gladstone's School for World Conquerors wish you world dominating success for 2020 and the upcoming decade!
Thank you so much for your love, encouragement and support. It will be the roaring '20s in just a few days and a new decade! Wish you the best and all good things!
Here is a link to our blog and you can see we're up to huge things in 2020:

updates.update_userinfo: Shaking the tree for international orders. (Also new characters previewed here below)
updates.update_content:
Gladstone's family. We are in the final 20 hours remaining to fund the Kid Nefarious one-shot. We are still  $2,500 away from our funding goal. If we make it, this is great news for the health of our little universe. 
We are doing well and we have about 60 first time readers who have pledged.  This is great for our growth and as far as increasing our readership. 
We'll be able to pay the colorist and the letterer for the next upcoming one-shot which is the Skull Brothers.  You can see Khoi Pham's work in progress on his cover (Sweet tactical gear) as well as some pages by Marcelo Di Chiara. We're able to build this universe brick by brick with your help. Please click on the link below, share and tweet, and get the word out. Thank you for being on this journey with us.

updates.update_userinfo: The final 20 Hours Remaining for the Kid Nefarious one-shot!!! (Also all new Skull Brothers First Look)
updates.update_content:
Hi Gladstone's Crew! 
Just wanted to message you to say that there are about 4 days left to fund the Kid Nefarious one-shot. It's going to come to the wire and I hope that we don't have to cancel the stories we have planned. We've worked really hard on these so please help get the word out and show your support. 
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/gladstonessschool/kid-nefarious-one-shot

updates.update_userinfo: 4 Days left to fund Kid Nefarious
updates.update_content:
Our Kid Nefarious one-shot is now 60% funded with ten days remaining. Pick it up, help us fund this and make sure you share on social media. We're creating an amazing world brimming with super-villains and superheroes brick by brick. This is a vital stage of the building process. 
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/gladstonessschool/kid-nefarious-one-shot
This unbelievably fun one-shot is written by Ryan L. Schrodt and illustrated by Matthew Weldon.

updates.update_userinfo: Our Kid Nefarious one-shot is now 60% funded!!!
updates.update_content:
Hello Gladstone’s Family!
This is Armand and Mark and we’re proactively shaking the tree to see if you received your books. The US orders should have arrived about now. 
If you have any issue or did not receive your book or want to know the status of it please email Armand and myself at: armandvillavert@gmail.com and mandrewsmith@gmail.com and we will immediately get back to you with the status of your books.

updates.update_userinfo: Shaking the tree on US orders for Gladstone’s Book 3
updates.update_content: The Kid Nefarious one-shot is 24% funded and just under 3K. We're doing our best to raise 12K to pay for production costs such as art, script, coloring, lettering, as well as for printing and shipping costs. As I write this we have 126 backers and we're going to need about 500 backers to reach our goal. Armand is hard at work right now on finishing the Martian Jones one-shot which is the last of the one-shots aside from a 40 page story written by Venom co-creator  David Michelinie. Armand is having the time of his life drawing these and let's get this one to do well so that Gladstone's one-shots can become a regular thing.

campaign.story:
UPDATE: 100% FUNDED IN THE FIRST WEEK!
We did it! I can't believe how awesome this community of ska fans is. I'm overwhelmed with gratitude. You guys are the best!
Not only did we hit the initial goal in the first week, we've been blasting through our stretch goals, too. We're onto the $100K LIMITED EDITION VINYL SOUNDTRACK goal (see below). Thanks to the generous support, the project now includes:
THREE NEW SKA T-SHIRT DESIGNS - Every T-Shirt reward package now comes with a choice of shirt design, including an EXCLUSIVE "Pick It Up!" design by the incredible Parker Jacobs (Yo Gabba Gabba, GoGo13, The Aquabats!)
TWO HOURS OF BONUS CONTENT - (More stories, extra footage, outtakes, etc.) will be included with ALL Blu-Ray, DVD, and digital versions of "Pick It Up! Ska in the 90s"
A CELEBRITY NARRATOR! - Thanks to you we are currently casting for a celebrity narrator to really help get this movie to the mainstream.  
SKA SHADES - Every backer choosing a reward valued at $50.00 or more will now receive a pair of fresh "Pick It Up!" ska shades, with lettering by Parker Jacobs, included in their reward package!
GUITAR PICK - Every backer choosing a reward valued at $20.00 or more will now receive a "Pick It Up!" guitar pick included in their reward package. Vote now on the design!
multiple t-shirt options available
***
Can't decide on just one T-Shirt design for your package? Don't worry, cause now you don't have to choose! CLICK HERE to find out the details on how you can ADD ADDITIONAL T-Shirts and Blu-Rays or DVDs to your reward package for just $25.00 EACH, plus SKA SHADES, PICKS, VINYL and MORE!
You will get to choose your original shirt design, size, and confirm your shipping address AFTER the project ends via Kickstarter survey (Projected for August 2018).
NEXT UP: $100,000 STRETCH GOAL
  If we hit $100,000 we will be creating a LIMITED EDITION VINYL SOUNDTRACK featuring bands from the movie. There are some caveats, so please click below to read more, but our goal will be to put together a rad '90s ska compilation type soundtrack with some never-before-available-on-vinyl tracks! 
CLICK HERE FOR MORE INFO ON THE VINYL GOAL
Vinyl is LIMITED in quantity (800 Black/200 Smoke) and available to Kickstarter backers before anyone else AND we will ONLY press vinyl (both Black & Smoke colored) if we reach the $100,000 stretch goal. Backers who have already pledged $125.00 or more will receive (1) copy of the soundtrack on black vinyl in their reward packs (Theatre poster reward tier and above).
See the graphic below for additional stretch goals, which will become clearer as we get closer to each goal.
Now onto the project story...
Pick It Up!
A documentary on the rise in popularity of ska music in the 1990s, often referred to as the "third wave" of ska.
Were you the kid who took up trumpet or saxophone in high school hoping your band would get to open up when the touring ska band came to town? Or were you the girl sporting the checkered dress at prom, hoping the DJ would play any song you could skank to? Maybe you were you the preppy kid that didn't quite fit in with the metal heads or the gangsta' wannabes, who finally heard a catchy upbeat on the college radio station and had to learn what this style was? Or were you the younger sibling that was filled with sadness when the 90s were over and the third wave ska bands you wanted to see live were no longer touring!
Well, if this is you, we are making your movie! 
This documentary aims to tell the story of how the genre of ska evolved from its original form in Jamaica in the 60s, through two-tone in Europe in the 80s, into an entirely new sound in the 90s and became wildly popular all around the world for a brief moment in music history. You'll hear the stories from the early years of some of the most well loved bands including No Doubt, Fishbone, The Toasters, Let's Go Bowling, Operation Ivy, and Skankin' Pickle, as well as how the rise to fame occurred for the radio success stories The Mighty Mighty Bosstones, Reel Big Fish, and Save Ferris! 
We are traveling around the world, interviewing the bands, promoters, record label executives, fans, and others who participated in building the ska scene in the 90s. This documentary showcases the DIY nature and challenges of the scene all over the world and relives how the push into the spotlight changed everything for these previously obscure bands and the genre in general. Making this film in a similar DIY, independent manner feels fitting given the nature of how the ska scene grew in popularity from its underground roots over the years. 
Our goal is to tell this story as accurately as possible from as many points of view as possible. Ska in the 90s had a very different culture and scene in New York as compared to Orange County, or Tokyo for that matter!
Thank you so much for getting us past $75k
Who's in it?
We still have a long way to go to finish this movie, but here are some of the bands we've interviewed members of so far:
Reel Big Fish
Less Than Jake
No Doubt
Save Ferris
Hepcat
Goldfinger
The Aquabats
The Mad Caddies  
Fishbone  
Sublime  
Kemuri
Buck-O-Nine
The Toasters
Dance Hall Crashers
Let's Go Bowling
The Pietasters
Skankin' Pickle
MU330
Tazy Phillipz (the Ska Parade)
The Skatalites
Spring Heeled Jack
Suicide Machines
Mustard Plug
The Porkers
The Hippos
Big D and the Kids Table
Voodoo Glow Skulls
Five Iron Frenzy
RX Bandits
The Specials
Tokyo Ska Paradise Orchestra
and more...
We need your help!
Being passionate fans ourselves, we are attempting to make this film in a DIY manner, and as such, we have no big studio support or any real private funding whatsoever. Until now we have been self-financing this project and have run out of funds to complete the movie in the way we feel it needs to be completed. That's where you come in, because we have heard your voice and you love ska! You want these stories to be told! 
Your support, large or small, will go a long way towards getting this movie out into the world!
Want to do more to help?
Share this page now on facebook, instagram and twitter with the hashtags #skamovie and #pickitup.
The Rewards:
We have a lot of the standard fare for a Kickstarter movie... You can get a digital copy, or a BluRay copy of the film, Your name in the credits, buttons, stickers, t-shirts, even exclusive posters being drawn (Image coming soon!) by the incredible Steve Vance (Less Than Jake's "Hello Rockview", Mystery Science Theater 3000)...  All kinds of goodies.  
We will also be releasing some LIMITED REWARDS of signed memorabilia from some of the bands involved and other cool RARE ska stuff, like the 1996 Less Than Jake promo stickers that were all claimed in the first weekend! Follow us on social media to know when more #Noskalgia becomes available!
Thanks for getting us to $30k so quickly!
Ska Shades now included in ALL reward packages $50 and up!
SOLD OUT - Thanks, Early Birds!
So keep an eye out on this page for those rewards and visit skamovie.com to join our mailing list and learn about contests and other Pick It Up! news.
The Crew:
Director - Taylor Morden has been playing trumpet in ska bands off and on for over 20 years.  He has directed several award-winning short films and, after the success of his previous feature documentary, Here's to Life: The Story of the Refreshments, Taylor is returning to the ska world to help bring these stories to the masses.  
Producer - Rei Mastrogiovanni has been playing ska music for over 20 years.  Since 2005 he has been working in Japan in music and television.  Aside from his solo projects and bands in Japan, he has worked with American ska legend Angelo Moore (Fishbone), Mexican ska giants Maskatesta, and Japanese female pop-ska group Oreskaband.
Associate Producer - Jason Hockney Zeimet is a walking “3rd Wave Ska Encyclopedia” who has worked on several music-related documentaries including “No New Kinda Story: The Story Of Tooth & Nail Records” & MxPx’s “Best Life Series”. His favorite ska record is Slapstick “Lookit.” He owns a nearly-infinite number of Ska records on Vinyl, & is a feature writer for Modern-Vinyl.com.
Associate Producer - Leanor (AKA "Jeff the girl") Ortega Till has been a female pioneer in the Ska Punk community for over 20 years! As the saxophone player for Denver, CO's Five Iron Frenzy she was the only female on the acclaimed 'Ska Against Racism' tour during the height of the third wave ska movement. In addition to being a multi-talented musician, writer, & charismatic interviewer, her connections in the ska community have proved invaluable to the production of this movie.
Writer - Heather Augustyn literally wrote the book on ska.  In fact, several books on ska, all available at skabook.com
Cinematographer - Noah Mucci has an uncanny ability to recognize story and react to it quickly with a cinematic eye. His recent work on ICARUS (Academy Award Winner: Best Documentary 2017, Emmy nominated) is just one example of that.
A Note From The Director:
Ska is what got me into playing music. Music is what got me into making videos, which led to films. Now film making has brought me back to ska.  Playing in ska bands throughout the years has taken me around the world and introduced me to some of the most amazing people and most of my lifelong friends.  
For some people ska (especially from the '90s) is viewed as silly or novelty music, but for me it means a lot. As cliche as it may sound, growing up as a band geek, discovering ska music changed my life. Which is a story I've now heard from countless other people both musicians and fans.  Even when "The Impression That I Get" hit the mainstream and was in heavy rotation on VH1 it always seemed like ska music was for the outsiders, the geeks, and the weirdos.  Like it was music that was just for us.  Which is part of why so many people still love it today.  
So far, making this movie has been an amazing experience! I hope that when the movie comes out and you get to hear these stories that we have been gathering it will give you a whole new appreciation for the music and the bands that meant so much to so many of us!
Sincerely,
-Taylor 
Pick It Up! Facebook
Pick It Up! Instagram
Pick It Up! Twitter
#skamovie #ska_movie
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Making a feature length music documentary takes a lot of work and has a unique set of challenges. 

- Going through dozens of hours of interviews to find the best way to tell the story.
- Tracking down and restoring archival videos and photos that may have been lost or damaged over the years.
- Licensing and clearing music and video clips that are owned by countless different record labels and corporations.
- Finding distribution and marketing for an independent film.

All of those are surmountable challenges for sure, but it takes a lot of work by a lot of people to get there.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
ONE DAY LEFT! Click both links below to see the latest updates and add-ons for our FINAL DAY!!!!
https://kck.st/2spzHbM
https://kck.st/2xEkZm0
This year's FREE COMIC BOOK DAY edition of DKD leads up to this new series!
Kitty Ravencraft returns!  The last time we saw her, her new comic book series was a huge success and she was once again the talk of the comic shops! Kitty's sleazy publisher managed to get a Hollywood film deal based on her series, but she soon found herself in danger once again! So much so, that she gets shot and killed by a mystery killer! Who would do this? And why? The story continued in this year's Free Comic Book Day special, "DKD: I Love You to Death!" In that book, we see Kitty move on to the great beyond, with a bit of a snag. Will she end up in Heaven or Hell ? And that's where this series begins! 
A lot of Kitty's old crowd returns! Little Satan, Derek, and of course everyone's favorite kid corpse, Dippy the Dead Kid will be back. And there's new faces like Big Debra and God herself! We'll see Kitty go on trial, taking a visit to Heaven AND Hell... then going on a mission from God to seek out her killer! And when you see who her killer is, you will be SHOCKED! But where will she end up? And what will happen to her killer? Find out in the wackiest, funniest Kitty story yet!
Dan's "Angelic" cover for issue #1
Fernando's "Devilish" cover for issue #1
After 2 successful DKD series, we are more committed than ever to put out good, fun comics! We want to surpass each series by kicking it up a notch in terms of story and art. And we are still inspired to have a series that reminds us of the fun comics we liked to read as kids. Comics that you don't have to buy 72 issues of a multi-story arc to enjoy! Now we enter a new realm of storytelling as she enters the afterlife! And there's more fun and satire the ever!  Our kickstarter fans have been a close knit family to us, and we value your input too!  We hope we can count on our very loyal and generous fans to make this the best DKD series ever!
We hope to follow the basic model of our first two series,  with a four issue storyline that we will initially release as individual PDF issues. As before, each individual issue will feature twenty pages of original story and art plus fashion pages, funny ad pages, pin-ups, variant covers and other added material. We will be handling the bulk of the writing and drawing ourselves but much of this additional material may be completed by some of our talented friends and colleagues in the comic industry. Later, these issues will be collected into one softcover trade paperback and as per our last campaign, our goal is to collect enough funding to be able to make the softcover trade into a hardcover with a dust jacket.
Dan's cover to #2 is a bit handsy
A "bewitching" cover for issue #3
Once again, we are planning on a number of stretch goals to make this project better and better. We are hoping to add bonus material such as an additional exclusive story by the one and only Gisele Lagace,  and beautiful spreads  by the awesome J Bone. In addition to these fun additions, we've got some really cool stuff planned! If other goals are met, we hope to do a Die Kitty Die HALLOWEEN special and a DIE KITTY DIE COLORING BOOK .And our ultimate goal is to do a Kitty figurine! Fingers crossed!
We'll also be "adding on" extras along the way, that you can add to your pledge . Our first add-on are the 2 previous hardcover editions of "DIE KITTY DIE". Then we'll be adding on things like prints, books, original artwork and other goodies. And there is a little instruction graphic below, explaining how to add on to your pledge.
Fernando's Fiery Cover for issue #2
Fernando's Cover for issue #3
An interior page by Fernando!
An interior page by Dan !
Kitty will look so pretty sitting on your shelf!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Since our first incredibly successful Kickstarter campaign 3 years ago, Die Kitty Die has enjoyed a lot of good luck. The reception to our first Die Kitty Die book has been hugely successful , and DKD has been picked up by Chapterhouse Comics to be published in single issues and distributed to retailers world wide!

We'd like to point out to everyone that despite this great good fortune, producing Kitty still falls to us. We still produce the series through our own imprint, Astrocomix. We creatively control everything. This is what brings us to Kickstarter. We can't do it alone. As you might imagine producing four complete issues of original story and art takes a lot of manpower and resources. We have our impressively talented team of inkers, letterers, colorists and others that we must hire and pay. We also have other costs such as printing, shipping and many other miscellaneous expenses that we need to cover ourselves. We can't do this without the very generous help of our very kind and loyal fans and supporters. We were deeply appreciative and touched by the phenomenal amount of support we were shown throughout our first campaign and even afterwards. Making an independent creator-owned and driven project like Die Kitty Die has been our dream since long before either of us ever got into this business. We couldn't make that dream happen without your help.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Define the Line - a comic book that is revolutionizing sexual harassment training to empower individuals to create workplaces that are harassment free.
Join an empowered community that is daring to Define the Line.
"Define the Line" is a workplace harassment training tool in the form of a comic book to help train, educate, and empower employees, managers, and business owners to create workplaces that are harassment free. 
Within the pages of Define the Line employees, managers, and owners will have checklists to know what next steps to take. Included in the pages we'll have self-checks and evaluations to ensure everyone knows how to Define the Line for themselves and others.
simplyHR LLC, cofounders, Tina Todd and Nikki Larchar, have over 15 years of experience helping business owners go through the process of investigating harassment claims. Inspired by real-life accounts, "Define the Line" will highlight some of the most frequent and common types of harassment in the workplace. 
With 1 in 3 women ages 18 - 34 reporting that they have experienced workplace harassment, traditional training methods aren't working. 
With 6 different scenarios within "Define the Line" readers will be witnesses to harassment in varying levels of severity. Each scenario will show:
How we naturally respond to harassment (freeze up, ignore it, etc), 
How we can be confident and define the line when it's crossed, and
What co-workers (our greatest heroes) can do to help create workplaces that are safe and secure for everyone. 
Employees and harassers come in different shapes, sizes, and genders. We are working with Moriah Hummer the comic book artist for Flat Track Furies to create characters that showcase just how wonderfully diverse our workplaces are. 
Human Resource gurus, Nikki Larchar and Tina Todd, guide readers through the scenarios and provide best practice information throughout in order to help employees understand what next steps they should take.  
Human Resources guides: Nikki and Tina
"Define the Line" will not only be a way to educate employees and employers but will also empower individuals to work together to create workplaces and organizations that are free from harassment. 
It was a dark and stormy night... Okay, it was a slightly above average Tuesday, and we were sipping on margaritas, because as some well-informed person on the internet somewhere once said, "no good story every started with having a salad."  
As the second round of margaritas made their way to our table, we began brainstorming about how we could make harassment training more interesting. And then, something fascinating happened. Stories of each of our own individual experiences with harassment started to emerge.  
Unsolicited storytelling started to happen EVERYWHERE. As we met with other business owners, community members, and friends, we began to hear their narratives. Their stories ranged in level of severity, but all had a common thread. There weren't any resources to help educate on what to DO if you're harassed or if you see someone else being harassed. 
And we were like... wait, WHAT?  
Being the HR nerds that we are, we began doing research. Like LOTS of research. And you know what we found out? There aren't very many studies on harassment training (interesting...). The few studies that have been done had some fascinating insights: 
And alas, the Comic Book idea was born! With so many tools and resources being offered in only a digital format, there is something magical about having a physical book. Something that you can flip through, that you can go back to as a reference, and that's different from the rest of the training, online modules, and videos that we are constantly bombarded with. Something you can refer to not only in a work setting but anywhere! ANY TIME!
We need your help to print the first 500 copies and pay our wonderful artist Moriah Hummer!
Budget for Define the Line
 1.  The "Define the Line" Comic Book
Six varying scenarios will bring to life different workplaces, relationships, and characters. Within each scenario we'll show:
a situation and how we naturally respond (freeze up, awkward laugh, ignore), 
then we'll rewind the scene to see how we can define the line when it's crossed, and 
we'll rewind one more time to see how we as co-workers can step in and define the line for others.
2. "I Define the Line" stickers
Stickers are great for showing off how awesome you are. 
Concept art of Define the Line sticker
3. Define the Line Harassment Workbook
Includes everything you need to roll out Define the Line as your sexual harassment training within your organization. What you'll get in the digital workbook:
Trainers Handbook - outlines best practices for training, provides you with guiding questions for discussions, 5-minute opening activities, and 10-30 minute enrichment activities,
Evaluations and Group Checks - to ensure that everyone understands and is ready to define the line,
Harassment Investigation Kit - Investigation checklist (to keep you organized), Workplace Grievance and Complaint Form, Workplace Investigation Interview Questions (what to ask the accuser, witnesses and accused), and the Workplace Investigation Final Decision Document.
4.  Name on the  "We Help Define the Line" Page
Your name (or business name) included on the inside of the comic book for all to see. (Bragging rights included). (**below is a concept art created by Nikki, it will most certainly look MUCH better once Moriah puts it together for us)
Concept art - will be much cooler when Moriah does it ;)
5. Company Logo or Business Name as a Sponsor
Your business name or company logo prominently showcased on the back cover as a sponsor of "Define the Line." (Bragging rights included!)
We are so excited to announce our partnership with SAVA. If you have experienced harassment in the workplace or sexual assault, SAVA provides resources, support groups, and a toll-free crisis hotline.
We're collecting real stories of workplace harassment to help us better identify what types of harassment happen most frequently and to help us create realistic and impactful scenarios. Submit your story anonymously by clicking the button below.
Hello there! We are Tina Todd PHR-CA, SHRM-CP and Nikki Larchar SHRM-CP co-founders of simplyHR LLC. Nice to meet you!
Outtakes - DIY photo shoot one week after starting simplyHR
We started simplyHR a human resources consulting firm dedicated to educating small businesses on the employee rules and regulations that impact their business in August of 2016. We are the definition of a bootstrapped start-up, which means we have yet to take out any loans or grants to operate our business. 
While creating simplyHR Basics - A handbook for employers (now available as an online resource) and with each creation of a customized Employee Handbook we've come to understand the value of setting deadlines, getting feedback, the power of revision, and that a detailed timeline can move any project along.
Our goal at simplyHR has always been to find ways to make Human Resources simple, easy and FUN. With a collective 15+ years of experience working in Human Resources, we are no strangers to the boring, cheesy, down-right painful-to-watch harassment training videos and online modules. 
Define the Line will be the tool we wish we had when we were conducting workplace harassment training.
We are excited to empower organizations to create safe a secure workplaces for everyone.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
"Define the Line" is our first attempt at creating a comic book. We have assembled a group of comic book writers, artists, enthusiasts and a community of people passionate about the project to help us throughout the project. There may be foreseeable challenges in the future, but we promise to keep all of our backers in the loop. While creating a comic book is a new adventure for the simplyHR LLC team, we are no strangers to creating, publishing, and distributing content and books. 

We have previous experience with setting deadlines, creating content and releasing our book (simplyHR Basics - Handbook for Employers). 

As business owners, we are aware that projects are going to have some bumps along the way (it's just what happens) but we feel confident that we can tackle any challenges that come along.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Two years ago you made a dream become a reality.
updates.update_content:
On this day 2 years ago, you took a chance on an idea. You decided that the way we train individuals on sexual harassment in the workplace needed to change. And from that impact and determination, the comic book Define the Line was created. You rallied behind us, showed us that the "crazy idea" we had wasn't so crazy, and that our world was ready for something new.
A lot has happened in the last 2 years. And we feel incredibly grateful to each and every one of you for your contributions and dedication to sparking change in your organizations, on your teams, and in the world.

updates.update_userinfo: The Define the Line proof is here!
updates.update_content: PLAY

updates.update_userinfo: Define the Line is off to the printers!
updates.update_content:
Hello, Amazing Backers! 
Today we all get to do a lil' happy dance!
Define the Line Comic Book and Trainer's Guide are complete!

updates.update_userinfo: It's beginning to look a lot like Christmas...
updates.update_content:
Hi wonderful backers!
We hope that you're November is off to a great start and that you're already listening to your favorite holiday music. Nikki has already started singing holiday songs, so needless to say, Tina is now looking at investing in industrial-grade earplugs.

updates.update_userinfo: A sneak peek, an update, and a reminder
updates.update_content:
When we first embarked on the journey of creating a comic book sexual harassment training, we were anxious to witness peoples reactions to the idea. We feared that people would ask us, why a comic book, in that demanding, prove your value kind of way. It did happen a few times, but we didn't let it shake us. In reality, the question we were greeted with most frequently was, "what can I do to help?". It has been overwhelming (in a good way) to witness our closest family and friends, as well as complete strangers, support Define the Line.
We appreciate all of the pledges, social media shares, support, text/emails to keep us motivated, and everything in between. Words can not express how truly honored we feel to be surrounded by so many people who are supportive of Define the Line, and most importantly, the mission of the project.

project_data.project_name: Define the Line - Comic Book - Sexual Harassment Training

campaign.story:
THANK YOU FOR AN AWESOME KICKSTARTER!
The Few and Cursed will be back on Kickstarter in the Fall for issue #5! Be sure to sign-up for our newsletter so you don't miss it!
If you missed the Kickstarter and want to put in a LATE PLEDGE (or Pre-Order) visit our online store on BackerKit:
----------> CLICK HERE TO PRE-ORDER <----------
Or feel free to follow me right here on Kickstarter and be notified when the new book goes online by hitting that nifty "Follow" button right up there on the left hand side of the page just below my profile picture.
You can also find me on the following social networks:
The Few and Cursed on Facebook
Felipe Cagno on Facebook
Felipe Cagno on Instagram
The new chapter in The Few and Cursed saga funded on day 1 in less than seven hours! Backers kept the momentum going and for the first time in the series we've surpassed 1.000 Backers!! \o/
The campaign also went on to unlock EVERY PLANNED STRETCH GOAL INCLUDING CARDS, BOOKMARK, CHROMIUM COVER UPGRADE AND EVEN A BONUS COMIC:

Not to mention the Bonus Stretch Goal celebrating YOU, the Backer! As we chased after this important milestone it was only fair to celebrate it in style:

The Redhead will ride again... see you all in the Fall!
WHO IS THE REDHEAD?
SURVIVOR. GUNSLINGER. CURSE CHASER.
Welcome to The Few and Cursed's 5th Kickstarter.
FIFTH KICKSTARTER?
Yes, Fabiano Neves and myself (Felipe Cagno) started working on The Few and Cursed back in 2016 and we've always relied on Kickstarter to find an audience for the indie series.
So far we've released The Crows of Mana'Olana Parts I - III and the spin-off anthology book Chronicles of The Few and Cursed.
We're now looking for your support to print The Crows of Mana'Olana Part 4 and to continue growing our fan base.

TELL ME MORE THEN, WHAT IS THE FEW AND CURSED?
Sure thing! The Few and Cursed is a creator-owned comic book series about people trying to survive a world where most of the water was just gone overnight in a mysterious apocalyptic event.
Seventy years of pain, suffering and sorrow has gone by and whatever morality mankind had is no more. The world has become a wicked place where the weak doesn’t stand a chance. What little water left is now a commodity used as currency, giving the Devil one heck of a post-apocalyptic playground for his creatures, minions and curses.
But for every darkness there is also always light - and among the few and cursed are those willing to fight to bring balance to the lands: the Curse Chasers.
NICE, THAT'S COOL. SO THE REDHEAD IS--
--a Curse Chaser, right.
People have opened up to evil curses and the supernatural to survive this wretched world and it's the Redhead's job to go from town to town putting an end to them.
 WAIT, EVIL CURSES? SUPERNATURAL?
Yep, monsters, legends, demons, folklore, etc. The supernatural. The world is full of it and that simply won't do. Chief among cursed creatures are The Crows of Mana'Olana.
CROWS OF WHERE?
Mana'Olana - a small town in the Honolulu Mountains region (what was once Hawaii). That's where the bedtime story about giant Crows that kidnap children in the silent of night comes from. Oh and while they are taking the kids, they also shred the grown-ups to pieces.
The Crows are not very friendly... they are quite scary actually and exactly the sort of folklore Red loves to investigate and stop it.
The Few and Cursed is the ideal book for any Western, Adventure or Supernatural fan!
THAT SOUNDS AWESOME! AND HOW MANY ISSUES ARE PLANNED?
The Crows of Mana'Olana story will be told in six (6) issues - each with 32 fully colored pages in standard comic book format 6'625 x 10'25.
The first three have already been published thanks to the amazing support of many of you guys and we plan on kickstarting the final three in 2018 - starting with this one.
The Few and Cursed: Crows of Mana'Olana - Parts 1 thru 3
A quick synopsis for newcomers:
Issue #1 introduces the Redhead to readers as we get to see her chase a local Indian myth, the Tsilkali, a giant snake preying on the small town of Mountain Ville, California.
In Issue #2 we follow the Redhead to the border of San Andreas and see her first meeting with a 94-year old survivor of The Reaping, Jebediah Younger. They team up to cross the Pacific after the Crows of Mana’Olana and learn how real they really are… and how dangerous.
In the next installment of the series, Issue #3, the Redhead and Jebediah finally make it to Mana’Olana. In a flashback story, readers will experience firsthand what the Redhead is truly capable of.
Last but not least, Issue #4 features the very first big battle with the Crows in Mana'Olana. We also go deeper in Red's fatherly relationship with Jebediah and unravel some of his background.
THOSE SNIPPETS WERE GREAT BUT HOW ABOUT SOME REAL PREVIEWS FROM EVERY ISSUE?
You guys rule here and your wish is my command ;)
Sample pages from issue #1
Sample pages from issue #2
Sample pages from issue #3
Sample pages from issue #4
We are about 2/3 into the production of issue #4 meaning there will be a quick turnaround for the delivery \o/
WHAT ABOUT THE CHRONICLES OF THE FEW AND CURSED? WHAT IS THAT?
Good question! The Chronicles of The Few and Cursed is an anthology featuring short stories by top artists set in the same universe.
The book collects 8 stories - including two new Redhead tales - for a total of 96 fully colored pages and was produced both in softcover format and hardcover (more details below!)
With Chronicles we were able to explore the four corners of the world and how different cultures deal with the lack of water.
Visit a Persian city overtaken by horrifying Daevas, raid a tomb in Egypt after the Eye of Horus and get lost in a shark cemetery in the Australian outback.
Sample pages from The Chronicles of The Few and Cursed
Meet the team of artists behind Chronicles:
Luke Ross, Luis Guerrero, Pedro Mauro, Marco Lesko, José Luis, Andrew Dalhouse, Arthur Medeiros, Tiago Barsa, Geraldo Borges, Vinicius Townsend, Felipe Watanabe, Natália Marques, Sam Hart, Wesllei Manoel, Adriano Di Benedetto, Walter Pax & Marcio Menyz.
The world of The Few and Cursed goes a lot further than the Old West!
ALRIGHT, ALRIGHT. THAT BRINGS ME TO THE BIG QUESTION: REWARDS. WHAT YOU GOT FOR US?
*You can add the Kickstarter Exclusive edition or any other item listed below to any tier, please scroll down to ADD-ONS for details.
Our main dish is obviously The Few and Cursed #4 in either one - or all - of our variant covers:

Once again, let me say this special edition will feature the Kickstarter logo and will be produced as PRINT ON DEMAND meaning we will only print as many books as sold on this campaign.
We also have two exclusive Stretch Goals to this edition: the Metal/Holofoil cover upgrade and a new collectible back cover art.
Harvey's art in a previously released promo piece! Yeah, we're going all in for the Kickstarter EXCLUSIVE cover art!

A few things to keep in mind:

Card #5 preview by Nicola Saviori, which was printed with a HOLOFOIL finish!
SO ALL OF THE STUFF ABOVE IS ALSO AVAILABLE AS ADD-ONS, HOW DOES THAT WORK?
Yes, we've set up a few good options to the right that will cover most of the stuff we've shown so far but you can always add extra items to your pledge and built a custom rewards package:
Add up the total of your choices (plus shipping if it applies)
Click "Manage Your Pledge" in the upper right corner (green button)
In the next screen (pictured above) add the total of your Add Ons to your pledge amount in the lower right button "Change your pledge". You don't need to change the tier you've selected
You are done! Later you'll get a backer survey or direct message from to double-check your extras

FELIPE CAGNO - Writer & Editor
I'm 34 years old and I have been working pretty much exclusively with comics since 2013. I have a background in film making, got my Master's degree at Chapman University and wrote and directed my first feature-length film in 2012, A Bullet With No Name.
My first comic book series was The Lost Kids: Seeking Samarkand epic adventure. It was an adaptation of a feature screenplay I wrote while at Chapman and working at producing companies like Arad Pictures, Weed Road and Misher Films.
Trying a different approach to comics, I came up with the short narrative challenge "321": comic book stories with 3 pages, 2 characters and 1 twist ending. The 321: Fast Comics series was kickstarted right here in 2015, and featured stories from every genre you can think of with a myriad of top-name artists attached to them.
On top of The Few and Cursed I also have another creator-owned series in the works, Classified, a spy thriller. Earlier this year I completed two original graphic novels. Too Good to Be True is a dramedy about a wannabe comic book artist that meets his inspirational Hollywood crush.
Choices: A Hero's Tale is a graphic novel about a young guy that wants to be the world's first real superhero. It's inspired by the comics from the 50s and 60s when superheroes were just fun.
Recently I also got the opportunity of writing a Planet of the Apes short story for comic book app Madefire and Fox. Last but not least I'm currently working on the sci-fi drama Adagio which was the recipient's of a prestigious grant in Brazil in 2017.
FABIANO NEVES - Artist
Professionally working as an artist since he was nineteen years old, Fabiano was first published in the US in 2000 with Xena Warrior Princess. He then went on to work for Marvel, DC, Dark Horse and Dynamite among other publishers.
A talented colorist as well, Fabiano has done both interior pages and covers for Xena, Marvel Zombies, Red Sonja, Robocop, JLA’s Vibe and Constantine among many other titles. The Few and Cursed represents Fabiano’s first creator-owned project.
DINEI RIBEIRO, TIAGO BARSA & MARCIO MENYZ - Colorists
Our amazing team of colorists has met tremendous success at Marvel, DC Comics, Dynamite, Zenescope, Boom and other publishers.
Dinei Ribeiro - currently working with Ed Benes at DC on titles like Harley Quinn, Green Lantern and Trinity (Batman, Superman and Wonder Woman) - heads the team by overseeing art direction and color palettes while tackling as many pages as his schedule allows it.
Marcio Menyz has been working steady at Marvel on books like X-Men Gold, Luke Cage and others while also coloring Frank Cho's Skybourne for Boom.
With us since issue #3 is newcomer Tiago Barsa. He's been our main guy and has been surprising us with every page he carefully crafts it. His credits include work for Ape Entertainment and Ed Benes Studio.
DEYVISON MANES - Letterer
One of the best letterers in Brazil, Deyvison has built an impressive body of work over the past couple of years and is slowly tackling more and more titles for the US comic market.
He's been with The Few and Cursed since the beginning and has also done every other book Felipe Cagno ever published. He is also a crafty writer and has his own creator-owned sci-fi book - Justiça Sideral.
THAT'S ONE HECK OF A TEAM! WHAT ABOUT SOME OF THE PIN-UPS I'VE SEEN AROUND THE WEB AND HERE TOO, WHAT'S UP WITH THOSE?
Pin-Up by Stjepan Sejic & Clonerh
Because we've used Kickstarter to fund past issues and had some awesome support to always go well beyond our initial goal, we were always able to include a Gallery of Guest Artists where we commission some amazing names to share their version of the Redhead.
As issue #4 has already been successfully crowdfunded in Brazil, I'm happy to announce our line-up of Guest Artists:
Roc Upchurch
Stjepan Sejic & Clonerh (pictured above)
Mauro Fodra
Felipe Marchioni & Luis GUerrero
Betsy Peterschmidt
From left to right: Felipe Marchioni & Luis Guerrero, Mauro Fodra, Roc Upchurch
EVERYTHING SOUNDS GOOD! WHAT ABOUT YOUR BUDGET AND SHIPPING, CARE TO TALK A LITTLE ABOUT THEM?
Fabiano and I are all about 100% transparency and we believe you deserve to know where your money is going to.
All of the money raised by Kickstarter will be used towards four things: Production, Printing, Shipping and Fees.
Here’s a breakdown of our costs:
- Production - $4,227.00
- Printing - $2,733.00
- Shipping - $2,500.00 (rough estimate based on previous campaigns)
- Shipping supplies - $300.00
- Fees (10% Kickstarter) - $1,072.23
- Other costs including travel, ISBN code, etc - $962.34
Total - $11,794.57
Any additional funding over our goal will first cover whatever is left from the above and all the extras like collectible cards, pin-ups, magnets, etc and production of future books of The Few and Cursed saga.
I'm also substantially raising our shipping supplies budget to give our Shipping process yet another upgrade.
We already pack and mail our rewards using hard cardboard photo mailers plus dust-free clear plastic bags and comic book sized card-boards.
*** For higher tiers or packages with extra books we will use Easy-Fold Mailers and bubble wrap:
*** We also ship our prints using thick cardboard mailer tubes:
Our primary goal is to entertain you and release the series entirely through Kickstarter. It all starts with YOU and YOUR support so thanks so much for sticking with us.
If you have any questions or inquiries please send me a message or shoot an e-mail at cagno100@gmail.com
THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR CHECKING US OUT AND HOPEFULLY PLEDGING \o/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be my 8th Kickstarter campaign, 20th crowdfunding if you count my experience with a similar platform in Brazil, and by now I can say I have a pretty good handle of what to expect prior, during and after a lengthy campaign.

I love crowdfunding, it's an excellent opportunity to get in direct touch with readers and fans. If you have any criticism, feedback or question, I'm always around whether it's through Kickstarter's inbox or at cagno100@gmail.com

I'd like to point out the book is pretty much done, all that is left is to ready the print files and actually go to print. By the time this Kickstarter is done the book will already have been released in Brazil.

We might need some extra time to produce the extra items unlocked through Stretch Goals but other than that, we're good to go!

The delivery schedule shouldn't suffer any delays except due to extraordinary circumstances (like monsoon season in Asia or being held up in customs, yeah, it could happen).

My biggest challenge is always shipping. I'm always looking for ways to make your packages arrive as safely as possible and in a timely manner. It's not easy... I've actually made friends with my local post-office dealing with such a difficult logistic but I feel I've made improvements and there is always room for growth.

For this campaign I plan on streamlining the logistics for some of our higher-end reward tiers offering prints instead of original art. Everything will be ready for shipping by July 2018.

All in all I'm glad you are here and thanks so much for backing!

Best!
Felipe
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
My name is Mary Bellamy. I'm a professional comic book creator and licensed artist who has worked on properties like My Little Pony, Womanthology, Monsters and Other Scary Sh*t, Marvel, DC Comics, Adventure Time and many more. I also exhibit at San Diego Comic Con as Zorilita - Mary Bellamy, an independent publisher specializing in pro-girl graphic novels.
After producing over 12 full-color, graphic novels and a plush doll line, the Zorilita Guardians, I moved into buttons and stickers, but as this is my 10th year exhibiting I want to do something really nice and I'm sure enamel pins will fit the bill.
I'm most known for my two series Ah Heck!! The Angel Chronicles and Faux Facts - The Truth Can Be Strange! And this year Cosmic Cupcake Chaos will be debuting in Mangazine! So I decided that the evil bunnies and killer teddy bears from Ah Heck!!, angry cupcakes and Sioux's magic wand from Cosmic Cupcake Chaos would make cute sassy pins.
They willl be:
Hard Enamel
Black Nickel Plating
Butterfly Clutch
Backing Card Packing
This design is fully funded!
 "Go to Heck!" 1.5x1.5 inches
In my comic "Ah Heck!! The Angel Chronicles" Evil bunnies infest regions of Heck and it's Angel's job to try to wrangle them. They're cute but destructive.
 This design is now funded! You can now add it to your pledge.
 Add $12 to your pledge to get this pin!
"Not Your Cupcake!" 1.5x1.5 inches
Cosmic Cupcake Chaos is a one shot story that is being serialized in Antarctic Press' Mangazine anthology series. I wanted to do a nasty cupcake from the series because it fits perfectly with the theme.
At $900 I will unlock the Magical! Design and you can add an additional $12 to your pledge.
"Magical By Nature!" 1.5x1.5 inches Cosmic Cupcake Chaos, along with many of my other series deal with magical girls so I wanted to represent that through this pin. By nature, we're all magical.
At $1300 I will unlock the Bite Me! Design and you can add an additional $12 to your pledge.
"Bite Me!" 1.5x1.5 inches
In my comic "Ah Heck!! The Angel Chronicles" killer teddies help run a neighboring kingdom in Heck and Angel must evade them in order to escape. They're cute but deadly.

Each design comes with a printed backing board will cost $330 to produce.
Sugar Bits Tier Reward
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While I have been assured that production will only take a few weeks there could always be unforseen delays with shipping but I will keep you all in the loop. I am hand packing and shipping these myself but a few hundred pins should not take too long either.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
UPDATE 04/04/2018:
  Hello, Kickstarter lurkers and social media link-followers! Have WE got a fun-filled, insanity-driven comic book for YOU!
   That's right, it's called "The Filbert Factor," and it is one ridiculous ride directly into the heart of Crazy Town! "The Filbert Factor" is a full-color, 32-page comic book, and the brainchild of creator and writer Mike Wolfer. Set in the town of Turtleview, Filbert and his friends Cashew and Hazel are just ordinary 4th graders, but in this first outing, they'll find themselves thrust into the center of a real-life disaster movie when the Meowstorm, a gigantic storm filled with furious felines, rolls into town!
  Now, here's the backstory about why we're here on Kickstarter looking to fund the book through your generous donations: You see, American Mythology Productions had this plan, to create a new comic series that would appeal to kids, adults, and everyone in between; a sarcastic, irreverent snapshot of what it's really like to be a kid. Mike Wolfer got right to work creating the characters and story, Disney animator Adrian Ropp designed the leads, and artist Horacio Domingues, colorist Jeremy Kahn, and letterer Natalie Jane got to work on the interiors. 
  Then we had a real brainstorm: Let's see if we can get the first issue approved as an official entry in the 2018 Free Comic Book Day event, thus reaching hundreds of thousands of potential readers and introducing them to the incredible characters we've created. Well, the Free Comic Book Day committee said, "Bah. We're not interested." Dang. So we listed the book in the distributor catalog, sure that retailers and comics readers would see "The Filbert Factor" as the next big thing that we feel that it is and order lots and lots of copies. And their response was, "Bah. We're not interested." Double-dang. So, the only way to show the world what we have and pay all of the bills associated with getting this piece of comic mayhem printed and into peoples hands is to turn to Kickstarter... And YOU!
   What we're offering to you, the backer, are a bunch of super-cool, Filbert-related goods that are sure to be collector's items, beginning with the books themselves:
   As we mentioned, the orders for the book were low... Really low... So we're giving you the opportunity to pick up not only the Kickstarter Edition of THE FILBERT FACTOR #1, but also the two cover variants that are going to be on sale in very small amounts in only the coolest, smartest, hippest comic book stores in the world (and if your local comic shop carries the book this coming May, tell them that we love them).
  But you'll be getting more than just comic books when you become a backer. Oh, SO much more. So let's look at the backer levels, shall we?
  First up, the good, ol', reliable Digital Level...
Only $5? What a steal!
   Next, the good, ol' physical copy...
Physical book also good for rolling up and swatting flies.
 For the real collectors out there, you'll be interested in the next level...
   Oooh... What do we have here? More comics, and rare ones at that!
 SPECIAL NOTE ABOUT FIRST ISSUES COLLECTOR'S SETS: Many of these books are nearly sold out, so quantities of the exact cover variants shown above are in limited supply. We'll most likely have enough books on-hand to fill backer orders, but please be aware that the exact cover variants that you receive may vary, based on demand.
Now, how do we make this even more ridiculous, and give you the opportunity to share with the world your twisted sense of humor?
(T-shirt probably looks better on the male model than it will on you or I.)
   But if you're really dedicated to making the nutty Filbert Factor dream a reality, feast your eyes on this collection of craziness...
    Next up: Original art!
    Yep, you can get a Mike Wolfer original pencil drawing on a 5.5" x 8.5" plate, which will be autographed and have Filbert saying something insulting to you, because what's more fun than that?!
  Which leads us to the ULTIMATE REWARD- YOU get to "meet" FILBERT!
   You won't find an opportunity like this very often! Backers of this Ultimate Level will find themselves transformed into an animal by artist Adrian Ropp, and drawn into a one-page strip that will appear in THE FILBERT FACTOR #1! Talk about bragging rights! Naturally, you'll need to provide us with a clear photo of yourself, but wow- Imagine what ridiculousness you might be facing in the world of THE FILBERT FACTOR!
  Stretch Goals
  You can bet your life that there's going to be Stretch Goals! In fact, Miss Natalie Jane (letterer extraordinaire) will be hand-crafting a little something for our first Stretch Goal, but we'll save that surprise for later.
  In closing, thank you all for checking out our campaign, and we hope that you'll be intrigued enough to help us fund this really fun project. We can guarantee you that if you're a fan of classic & modern comics, classic & modern cartoons, and classic & modern humor, then you're going to love THE FILBERT FACTOR, and we just can't wait to share this book with everyone! 
  And this just in: Follow Filbert on Twitter @FilbertFactor!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The only risk involved with this campaign is the distinct possibility that after you read this first issue, you're going to be hounding us for the next one, so the risk will be all ours. But seriously, the book is nearly completed and on schedule for the late April release, so we'll only need a couple of months to have all of the other rewards and Stretch Goals assembled and/or manufactured, for prompt shipping in July.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
That's right, friends of Filbert!  There's a wicked Meowstorm in your area because we're sending out the prizes to our fantastic supporters today!  You should be seeing emails with your tracking from USPS throughout the day.  
We added a Pink surprise in your packs!  Everyone who supported us at the print level is getting an extra free Pink Panther Cartoon Hour comic!  This is our way of thanking you for your support of our kids comics and hopefully introducing you to our favorite cool cat.

updates.update_userinfo: Digital is HERE + Get the T-SHIRT!
updates.update_content:
That's right, everyone, the digital copies of THE FILBERT FACTOR #1 are now ready for download! Check your private messages for the handy link where you can download your PDF and get ready to laugh your head off! (American Mythology is not responsible for heads that have been laughed off.)
  Also, we're getting ready to place the Filbert t-shirt order with the manufacturer, but if you're not getting a shirt with the rewards for your level, guess what? Now you CAN!

Yep, thanks to an awesome backer who pledged to that incredible level that's going to put them in the actual comic itself as a cartoon character who will interact with Filbert and the cast, WE'VE (at last) REACHED OUR GOAL!
  As an extra-special way of saying "thank you" to the exclusive club of Filbert backers, letterer Natalie Jane wanted to exercise her crafting skills and whip up a cool keepsake that gets you honorary member status in the Super Adventure Science Squad...

Hey Filbert Supporters,
We're less than $100 away from funding the Filbert Factor with 12 days left in our project.  Indie comics are such a challenge these days.  Sometimes it feels like the world is against you.  But we really believe that Filbert is a special comic and one that fans will enjoy when they see it.  We poured so much wackiness into this series and we believe that it's truly one of a kind.

campaign.story:
STRETCH GOAL ANNOUNCEMENT!!

Jeff, Mark, Steve and I want to thank you for your support and generosity with helping us to fully fund the Kickstarter to finish The Altar Boys project: No Substitute. With this goal met we'd like to offer a unique stretch goal. Here's what we propose:
Before the close of the Kickstarter on April 20, if we raise $25,000, everyone who has pledged on the campaign will receive a FREE download of No Substitute: The RAW original tracks as recorded in 1991 and 1993. These tracks will contain both electric and acoustic guitars, plus all the lead and background vocals where they were added. (It will also contain a number of lead solos that were replaced by Steve on the "produced" tracks.) These are the tracks that we all listened to back in September of 2017 that spurred us on to want to finish this project.
Additionally, if we make the $30,000 by the Kickstarter closing date we will offer a FREE CD of the RAW No Substitute tracks (in addition to the download) to anyone who has pledged a minimum of $25 (before shipping). The track order of the RAW album be according to date recorded - which is very different from the official No Substitute release. The track order for RAW is as follows (from 1991): "Rebel Rock," "History Comes Back," "Light of Freedom," "Outside in the Distance," "Surround Me," "Let Me See Your Hands," "No Substitute." (From 1993): "Devotion," "The Kids Cry," 1,000 Mile," "Give our hearts," "Revolution of Love."
Whatever happens, we can't thank you enough for getting us to our goal, and past it. We are putting finishing touches on the recording and art as we speak, and God willing, plan to turn masters over to Lo-Fidelity Records for Vinyl and CD manufacturing within the month of May. The campaign ends on Friday night at midnight (central), so share the campaign link and let's see how far we can take this together!
http://bit.ly/TheAltarBoysKickstarter
~ The Altar Boys / No Substitute ~
Expect the unexpected?” “With God, all things are possible?” Well, ya, of course!
But come on! A new release from The Altar Boys in 2018? What? How? That’s crazy! And The Altar Boys are inclined to say: “Exactly, we're totally surprised ourselves!”
Here's the backstory: In 1991 and early 1993, Mike Stand made a series of smart and passionate recordings for a future, brand-new Altar Boys project titled, “No Substitute.” Try as they may, however, the band was never able to release this record. Sadly, it was all but abandoned and thrown on the “scrap heap.”
Fast forward to the fall of 2017.
Upon the urging of both fans and friends, these recordings were revisited. What was surprisingly discovered was a perfect “time capsule” that remarkably preserved both the urgency, music, and message of The Altar Boys - as it was, intact, from way back when.
This discovery did not happen in a vacuum. Instead, the focal point of this journey finds God temporarily taking something near and dear away from Mike, yet all the while giving him something back with strict marching orders: “To finish what you started!”
Now, some 25 years later, what was deemed impossible has miraculously happened...
With YOUR help, The Altar Boys will release their long-awaited 6th album: “No Substitute.” The band genuinely believed it was over, but “You can’t stop the Rebel Rock message of faith and hope, sent to this world of Rebel Rock Souls.” And so it is, because, as it was then - and now! - there’s “No Substitute.”

You have questions - we have answers!
Is Kickstarter a store? ~ No! For those unfamiliar with Kickstarter ~ this is an "all or nothing" fundraising platform.  You pledge the level that you want, and if we make our financial goal ($20,000) we use those pledged funds to finish our record ~ and then you get whatever it is you've pledged for!  If we don't make the fundraising goal, your cards aren't charged and the album goes back into limbo.

Who is playing on this record? ~ The Altar Boys circa 1991/1993 are on this recording, and the record features original guitars and vocals recorded during those years.  The band was/is Mike Stand, Jeff Crandall, Steve Pannier and Mark Robertson.
The Altar Boys (1991/1993)
What formats are being offered in the Kickstarter? ~ We are offering Downloads, CDs, and limited edition 180g Vinyl in this campaign. 

How many songs are on the album? ~ There are 12 songs we are hoping to release on download and CD.  10 songs will be on the vinyl (with all 12 on the accompanying download.)

What kind/size of T-Shirts are being used in the campaign? ~ Our manufacturer will use BLACK pre-shrunk, 100% cotton, heavyweight Fruit Of The Loom shirts in mens sizes Small through 5XL. We will also produce the design on "Ladies Cut" t-shirts in sizes X-Small through 2XL.
No Substitute T-Shirt Concept
If we meet the goal, how long will it be before you get my album? ~
August 2018 is the projected shipping date. This could change based on manufacturing times, unforeseen delays, etc. This is a projected date - not carved in stone.

Where can I get more info on this project? ~ The band did a Facebook Live Q&A session and explained the whole project.  Check it out!
We thank you for any and all support in making our dream of "No Substitute" a reality!

updates.update_content: In 1985 - sheesh just a few years ago - The Altar Boys released a record called "When You're A Rebel!" Maybe a few of you have "heard" of the record?  This album was a huge jump for us and we must give huge kudos to the mixing engineer: Leroy Cuenga (aka Mark Heard!!). But this guy had a lot more than just engineering skills, he wrote a lot of great music too. Lo-Fidelity and Fingerprint Records is pleased to announce the long awaited reissue campaign for Mark Heard's "Dry Bones Dance" project. Check out the campaign at the link below, and tell'm Mike Stand sent ya!

Wanted to post a quick update on the "No Substitute" campaign.  

A lot has happened since the campaign closed - most of which Mike Stand has documented on the official Altar Boys Facebook group.  If you're on Facebook and want to keep up with all things Altar Boys and Altarbillies, check it out here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/92228097501/

Jeff, Mark, Steve and I want to thank you for your support and generosity with helping us to fully fund the Kickstarter to finish The Altar Boys project: No Substitute. With this goal met we'd like to offer a unique stretch goal. Here's what we propose:

Before the close of the Kickstarter on April 20, if we raise $25,000, everyone who has pledged on the campaign will receive a FREE download of No Substitute: The RAW original tracks as recorded in 1991 and 1993. These tracks will contain both electric and acoustic guitars, plus all the lead and background vocals where they were added. (It will also contain a number of lead solos that were replaced by Steve on the "produced" tracks.)  These are the tracks that we all listened to back in September of 2017 that spurred us on to want to finish this project.

Additionally, if we make the by the Kickstarter closing date we will offer a of the tracks (in addition to the download) to anyone who has pledged a . The track order of the album be according to date recorded - which is very different from the official release. The track order for is as follows (from 1991): "Rebel Rock," "History Comes Back," "Light of Freedom," "Outside in the Distance," "Surround Me," "Let Me See Your Hands," "No Substitute." (From 1993): "Devotion," "The Kids Cry," 1,000 Mile," "Give our hearts," "Revolution of Love."

Whatever happens, we can't thank you enough for getting us to our goal, and past it.  We are putting finishing touches on the recording and art as we speak, and God willing, plan to turn masters over to Lo-Fidelity Records for Vinyl and CD manufacturing within the month of May.  The campaign ends on Friday night at midnight (central), so share the campaign link and let's see how far we can take this together!

32% funded in just 24hrs, and all thanks to you!

Let's keep this moving.  If you have friends and family that are or were fans of The Altar Boys, please tell them about the campaign and share this link with them and all over social media!  
http://bit.ly/TheAltarBoysKickstarter

Thank YOU again for the support in our efforts to make "No Substitute" a reality....

The Altar Boys
Lo-Fidelity Records

project_data.project_name: Let's Finish & Release The Altar Boys "No Substitute"!!

campaign.story:
In order to self release this record on our terms, we share this process and we’re asking for help. Our main funding goal is $50,000. With this money, the bulk of it is going to be spent on prep and marketing. We intend to self release this record all around the world, not just North America, and to do that, we’re gonna need to advertise. We also have costs of hiring an engineer to record and mix our record, as well as the costs in fulfilling the perks in this here campaign. We haven’t been this excited to work on music in years. Our ultimate goal is to write and record the best record of our career, and share it with as many people as possible, all over the globe.
We intend to be highly interactive with this campaign from the launch through the finish. If we sell out of perks, we will get creative and add new ones. Have any ideas? Email us, mxpxnews@gmail.com — lets do this!
ADD ONS READ HERE:
To adjust your pledge amount to include an add on, choose your pledge and then edit the amount in the "Your Pledge Amount" box to reflect the cost for the items you are adding i.e. $25 Black Vinyl and adding $25 Plush would be $50 as your pledge amount. Message us which item you want to add after you have adjusted your pledge amount.
This only applies to items which are NOT already sold out and that are NOT already in a bundle option. If shipping needs to be added for your add ons we will message you directly.
CD: $20
HORNS $20
Acoustic EP $20
Plush Doll: $25
Black Vinyl: $25
SIGNED items $25 each item
Photobook- $50
Woodcut: $120 ($100 for the Woodcut $20 for the shipping as it is separate from other perks with and size)
Colored Vinyl Collectors Edition Vinyl are not available via ADD ONs.
STRETCH GOALS
Stretch Goals involving cities:
—if 1000 people in a 250 mile radius pledge, we’ll come to your city in 2018.
—if 1000 people in one country pledge, we’ll come to your country in 2018-2019.
Stretch Goals involving Money:
At $300,000 —the horns EP and the acoustic EP go on streaming services, as well as sent to everyone that ordered in download
At $300,700 —MxPx buys Yuri an iPhone
At $500,000 —we’ll perform records in their entirety in the next few years, in a full world-wide tour. All backers will be able to get tickets first.
PLAY

PxPx Plush Doll
 Photobook by Jered Scott!
PLAY

RUNNING PUNK WOODCUT
 The Running Punk Woodcut is 19.5x16.5 inches
SIGNED MxPx Watch
SIGNED Yuri Ruley Drumsticks
SIGNED Left Coast Live Test Pressing Vinyl
Slowly Going The Way of the Buffalo Alternative Art
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’re a small do-it-yourself team and the biggest challenge we face is getting the word out about whatever we do. How does a band in America, market their music in Japan? A country we have done very well in over the course of the last 20 years. Thats just one example of what we’re trying to do. At the same time, because our team is small, we will be all hands on deck to fulfill these perks/pledges. Time is valuable— but we will deliver. We’ve run our own webstore for the last five years, and have experience in organizing and shipping out the perks/pledges in this campaign. However, it’s one thing to say it, it’s another to do it and we will need our full team on hand to not leave people hanging that help us. The main risk involved is the cost of this whole endeavor. There are costs from everything to recording, design, vinyl pressing, t-shirt printing, shipping, personnel, and marketing the record once it is complete. These bills add up quick. We have to make a real budget and allocate it correctly to our needs. The priority will be to delivering what we promise, and the remainder will be used for marketing upon release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: MXPX is going live Friday, October 16TH!

WE did it!!!  You did it!!!  We did it!!!!
We have officially shipped all the orders from the merch arsenal.  There are literally 36 people who did not send us addresses- we have tried to get in touch by emailing directly to no response.  If you are one of these people please email us: mxpxnews@gmail.com -- in the meantime, we have your packages packed and labeled and we're putting them on a shelf for a few months to see if you come find us.

We're on the homestretch of the shipping process.  There are 40 people or so that have not filled out the address survey and we cannot ship your stuff.  Some pledged as guests so we don't have your names, but of those that we do.... we're looking for you!  Please email us at mxpxnews@gmail.com so we can get your address and shirt sizes (if applicable).
ROLL CALL:
1.Scott Turner

Check your emails if you pledged to the Acoustic EP Perk.
If you have not received your download, you can respond to our mailing list email: mxpxnews@gmail.com and we will manually deliver you a link.  A few people unsubscribed (hehe- CAUGHT)... but that means you'll have to come to us and we can get you your tracks.  
Still shipping vinyl, Horns EP... not yet!  All is coming.  This night is young.

Still shipping!
Last glance, we have about 400-ish packages to still get out, but we're on the home stretch.  Stoked to see so many pictures out there, but those who haven't gotten their stuff yet, please bear with us- we're still going!!  We will announce when everything is out and at that time, if things are missing, we'll direct ya on what to do.
Almost there!

We're now about 68.6% through the shipping process.  Yes, "about" 68.6%.
; )
Plenty of people have started receiving their vinyl and tweeting pictures and videos.  We love it!  But before you start worrying if yours was missed, please know we still have a good amount to get into the mail.  We are on it.  Thank you for your patience!

In news we wish we could have posted a month ago-- we are happy to report vinyl has started shipping.  In fact, a few backers have already received and started posting pictures on social media.  FAIR WARNING- we have only begun.  We have many of these packages to get out.  We ask for your patience!  We got our team on it, we don't plan to stop until we get them all out-- but they all cannot ship at the same time.  We have to pack each order ourselves!   That said, watch the mail.  We'll update you here as we go.  
We have completed most of the other perks but there are still some lingering things:

I feel like we might have developed a new type of anxiety with the constant delays in vinyl production, but i am happy to report that vinyl production is COMPLETE!  That means, its almost vinyl time.  First up, we apologize immensely.  We're told this happens all the time when producing vinyl and since Left Coast Live was so easy to produce, we figured- we can do it ourselves right?  .....well then, there we go again getting ahead of ourselves  *sigh* .  The one thing is, it looks and sounds AMAZING.  Our friend Jason put alot of time in helping us make sure this was A+... and you'll be able to hear it soon enough.  The order ships to us tomorrow.  It will take a few days to get here, and then we're gonna start shipping to you.

Let’s jump right in. First- thank you so much! As of now, it looks like 4% of you haven’t downloaded the new record. Is that because you haven’t gotten the links? If this is you, PLEASE reach out- you can message us here on Kickstarter— or you can email mxpxnews@gmail.com -
now. Updates.
We’re just about 50% of the way through the shipping process. So some of yall have gotten your stuff and been posting, others have been wondering where their stuff is. Here’s a more indepth update of what we have gotten to- and what is still coming:

the band just finished playing the full album on the internet- and now you should have received an email from us with an ACTUAL download of the record. Check your emails— if you didnt message us here, and we will respond with a link tonight. It appears we got to 98% of the backers from the first two tests- so there will be some that are missed. DO not panic! Just message us, and we’ll get you! Thank you!!!!
